which will allow you to place a building over top of the water canal from the modular flooring system unlocked at the $10k stretch goal level.The water wheel of the building actually extends down through the floor of the building into the canal below to simulate it really being in the water canal.  The water wheel is a full circle which means it can be spun.Here is a picture of the first prototype of this building design:  This stretch goal unlocked the design of three more angular roof themes:(1) The "Xavier" Roof Design (2) "Hospital" / "Asylum" Roof (3) The "Blank Canvas" Roof  This stretch goal unlocked the design of a sidewalk accessory pack which can be used with our Tiled Terrain Flooring System or by itself to add sidewalks around your building. The sidewalks are made up of a few basic pieces. The first pieces is a full length piece which is the exact width of one building (156mm , Approx. 6 inches). You can see here in this next picture on the bottom right. Then going from top left to right we see an inner corner piece, a 1/2 length piece, 1/4 length piece, 1/8 length piece, then on the second row we have a rounded outer corner and a full length piece. Here's what you can do by placing 4 rounded corner pieces and a couple 1/8 length pieces together. Here's how the pieces can be arranged to go around corners of buildings. Obviously the width would be made wider by using wider pieces, but I Just used a 1/2 width piece in the middle here so that it would fit in the picture.   More examples of how they can be used. The full length piece is exactly the width of one building, which is 156mm (Approx 6inches) and 39mm wide (Approx 1.5 inches).The 1/2 width piece is 78mm (Approx 3inches) x 39mm wide (Approx 1.5 inches).The 1/4 width piece is 39mm x 39mm (Approx 1.5 x 1.5 inches).The 1/8 width pieces is 19.5mm x 39mm (Approx 0.75 x 1.5 inches).Both the rounded and regular corner pieces are 39mm x 39mm (Approx 1.5x1.5 inches) This stretch goal unlocks a street lamp accessory pack.  Now that we have streets and sidewalks, we might need some street lamps!It can be dangerous for our miniatures to walk around in the streets after dark with no lights!  Help spread the word about this Kickstarter to help us unlock a street lamp accessory pack.  :)(Note: This will be an accessory made from MDF wood, not one that actually lights up, although we are talking to a potential supplier about creating LED lighting kits for our backers.  If you have an interest in potentially getting an LED kit for your terrain, leave a comment and let us know.) This stretch goal unlocks the design of a card box accessory for storing playing cards such as the Fate Decks used in Malifaux and other miniature games which use cards.More details and prototype designs will be revealed soon.This stretch goal unlocks the design of a modular interior wall system for the buildings.  These will be free-standing walls and walls with doors which players can place inside the buildings to split up the modules into "rooms" for games where rooms add to the game play.This stretch goal unlocks the design of a new bridge accessory which will allow miniatures to get across the water canal module from the modular flooring system.A design of the bridge with photos will be made available as soon as the first prototype design is completed.This stretch goal will unlock not one but THREE new items.The first thing will be an external staircase accessory which will allow the setup of a building where the middle door w/2 windows module can be placed on the second floor so that the entrance to the building can be on the 2nd floor, instead of at ground level.  The stairs will look very similar to the internal stairs accessory, except it will be modified to fit the front of a building and made slightly wider as well to look more like an external stair case.The second thing that will be unlocked will be a swimming pool accessory for the flat roof top.  It will basically be an insert that fits in the same roof hole as the skylight accessory.  So you can simply lift the skylight out of there and drop a swimming pool in.  The swimming pool will basically just be an insert that drops the roof floor down a bit, similar to how the waterway works, but not as deep and then you can use paint and "water works" techniques to make it look like water.The third thing will be the design of some pool chairs for the rooftop pool.Why would we want a pool on the roof?  The real question is why not? :)We all know that when someone comes over to your house and sees your terrain the first thing they'll say is "Is that a swimming pool on the roof!?  Awesome!" :)THIS STRETCH GOAL IS CURRENTLY LOCKED - Help us unlock it by spreading the word about our campaign!THE BUILDINGS - The Modular ElementsUPDATE: Since unlocking many new options, including an even more modular system which now allows you to individually choose each of the four walls and the floor of your modules, we now have many new options which are not show below.We will be updating this page to reflect those options soon, but in the meantime you can see a more up-to-date listing of the different options by visiting our site by clicking here.Each of our buildings are made up of three types of modular elements which stack on top of each other to form a complete building.The three types of elements are:(1) THE GROUND FLOOR MODULE This is the first / ground floor of a building.  Each building you'll use on your tabletop will start with ONE of these ground floor modules, and all of the other modular elements will stack on top of it.(2) THE MIDDLE FLOOR MODULES Each building can be built with any number of middle floor elements (including zero) which stack on top of the ground floor element to form a multi-storey building.If you want a two-storey building you'll use one middle floor module on top of the ground floor module.If you want a three-storey building you'll use two middle floor modules on top of the ground floor module.If you want a four-storey building you'll use three middle floor modules on top of the ground floor module.etc.(3) THE ROOF MODULE Each building will also require ONE roof module to be placed on top of either the ground floor module (in a single-storey building scenario), or on top of all of the middle floor modules that have been stacked on top of each other (in a multi-storey building scenario).ROOF MODULE OPTIONSThe roof modules in our modular system bring the buildings to life with various elements built into them to either act as a strategic setup for miniatures to utilize, such as in the case of our flat roof modules, or as a themed setup, such as in the case of our themed angled roofs.ROOF OPTION #1 - THE FLAT ROOF MODULE  This is the flat roof module. This is the flat roof module shown placed on top of the ground floor module.The flat roof module acts as a simple un-themed roof option which can optionally also be used to allow miniatures to use the roof as a vantage point on top of the building. The optional balcony accessories can also be attached to the flat roof in the middle on one or both sides to form a balcony on the roof.  (Sniper positions? :) )ROOF OPTION #2 - THE ARCANIST LABORATORY ROOF MODULE  This is the Arcanist Laboratory Roof Module... ... and here it is shown on top of a Ground Floor Module.The "Arcanist Laboratory" is our first themed roof module.These modules transform your buildings into one or more Arcanist Laboratories and features a two layer steampunk themed gears and cogs design.ROOF OPTION #3 - THE CLOCK TOWER (NIGHTMARE) ROOF MODULE  This is the Clock Tower Roof Module... ... and here it is on top of a Ground Floor Module.The next roof option is our "Clock Tower (Nightmare)" themed roof module.These modules transform your buildings into a clock tower.  However, this is no ordinary clock tower.  At first glance this themed roof module looks like an ordinary clock tower, but on careful inspection several strange and weird elements present themselves.Firstly, one of the letters on the clock tower is reversed.  That's weird, right?Secondly, you may also notice that unlike a regular clock, this clock has 13 numbers on it - not 12!  Everyone knows that the number 13 is a weird number...... but that's not all... if you look even further, the 9 and the 6 digits on the clock have been reversed!!Why all this weirdness?  Well, when I designed this clock tower roof module, I wanted it to be utilized as either a simple - albeit somewhat weird - clock-tower - OR - something a little bit more sinister.The strange elements of this clock tower make it perfect for playing a scenario where your miniatures are stuck inside a dream - or rather a NIGHTMARE!Inside this NIGHTMARE theme, things are a little weird, and the letters and numbers signify that things aren't exactly normal. :)What's really neat about this clock tower module too is that virtually NOBODY notices the fact that the clock has 13 numbers on it even when they're starting right at it, until you point it out!  It's actually quite fun to see if your friends will notice some of these elements or if they'll play the entire game and not realize it. :)THE WALKWAYIn addition to utilizing the different building modules to create numerous building combinations, the addition of a walkway extends the possibilities even further.UPDATE: The walkway has been updated.  Here are pictures of the new update: Placing a walkway in between two buildings gives you the ability to expand your scenarios to allow miniatures to walk from one building to another, across the walkway, on three different floors (1st / 2nd / 3rd floor), or to use the walkway as a vantage point to see the rest of the terrain.The walkway can also be placed on the outer edge of a building to act as a terrace / vantage point that the miniatures can walk out onto without it necessarily acting as a walkway between two buildings.TERRAIN DIMENSIONS AND SCALE (NOTE: 32mm Miniatures shown in picture are NOT included in this Kickstarter.  They are just shown for scale purposes only!)The terrain dimensions are as follows:Ground Floor and Middle Modules:
Length: 276mm - (Approx 11 inches)
Width: 156mm - (Approx 6 inches)
Height: 76mm - (Approx 3 Inches)
Angled Roof Modules:
Length: 276mm - (Approx 11 inches)
Width: 156mm - (Approx 6 inches)
Height: 110mm - (Approx 4.5 Inches)
HOW TO PLEDGEIn order to allow you to pledge early we have simplified the pledging options for our backers into the following system.As a backer, you will receive a certain number of CHOICE CREDITS for your pledge.  The number of CHOICE CREDITS offered with each pledge amount is listed in the rewards section on this page.At the end of the Kickstarter funding period, you will be sent a survey which will allow you to choose how you spend your CHOICE CREDITS towards the terrain.The following chart explains how many CHOICE CREDITS are required for each item offered in this campaign.PLEDGE CALCULATOR
 The first version of our PLEDGE CALCULATOR available to help you determine the exact amount of CHOICE CREDITS you'll need to assemble the terrain options you'd like, and then to convert those options into the exact amount you'll need to pledge in CAD.CLICK HERE TO USER OUR CALCULATORPLEDGE CHARTIf you'd prefer not to use the calculator, you can also use this chart to calculate how many CHOICE CREDITS you'll need to get the terrain building combination you'd like to order, and then select the appropriate pledge amount.  If more modules or accessories are added throughout the campaign, this chart will be updated with their choice credit values.  EXAMPLE CALCULATIONS FOR CHOICE CREDITSHere are some example terrain combinations and their respective CHOICE CREDIT values.      PRODUCTION WAVES & SHIPPINGThe production for this campaign will start immediately after the funding period is over and once we have received your survey responses.The terrain will be produced and shipped out in Waves based on the following schedule:
IndieGogo Wave 1 - Production Starts Apr/May/June - Shipping July 2016
IndieGogo Wave 2 - Production Starts July/Aug - Shipping Sept 2016

IndieGogo Wave 3 - TBA (If Required)

Wave 2/3/4 Pledge Rewards will be added once Wave 1 is sold out.This Kickstarter / IndieGogo Campaign ships worldwide.  To keep things simple, we have instituted a flat-fee shipping amount which will be displayed and added to your pledge when you choose your pledge level.WHY YOU WANT TO BACK THIS PROJECT NOWWe highly recommend placing your pledges early to get in the front of the line of our fulfillment queue during the production phase of this Kickstarter / IndieGogo Campaign.Once the campaign funding period is completed, we will be producing and fulfilling orders in waves, starting with orders from those who pledged first, then moving onto those who pledged second and so on.Therefore, the sooner you pledge, the closer you'll be to the front of the line in the queue and the sooner you'll receive your terrain!!!ADEPTICON 2016 SPONSORAlso, for those of you who will be attending AdeptiCon this year, we'd like to announce that we are a proud terrain sponsor of a table in the Malifaux Hall ( Schaumburg Ballroom A&B) of AdeptiCon 2016.If you'd like to see our Victorian Steampunk terrain in action, you can see it at this year's AdeptiCon.
MODULE COMPONENT OPTIONS CHARTSIn addition to the photos above, here is a chart of the Ground / Middle Floor Module and the various different component options that can now be chosen PER module that you choose.Each Ground / Middle Floor Module will consist of a FLOOR + FRONT + BACK + LEFT + RIGHT wall option that you can choose from the options below.This gives you total control over how you want to setup your buildings, and you can also order extra components for any of the walls or floors if you'd like to have options to swap out. 
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Our terrain is made from 3mm MDF and requires assembly as well as painting.

story:
Short Summary

O-Nett Gaming Co. is moving to a new location and we need your help!  On August 21st we will be moving to 215 W. Washington St. in Ottawa, IL(only 4 blocks North of our current location).  We are looking for your support so we can make the most out of our new location.

The Impact

Our new location will allow us to expand both the arcade and our merchandise sections of our store.  It will also allow us to host more special events and tournaments!

We will be changing how our arcade is operated.  Instead of using quarters, customers will now be able to pay one price for unlimited game play.

We will also be adding a table top gaming room, where customers can come play their favorite board and card based games!


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least $1,000 from our Indegogo campaign.  However, additional funds will allow us to do even more with our new location!

The money raised here will go toward purchasing new signs, displays, shelves, and of course some new arcade machine!

In exchange for your contribution we will be offering a number of different memberships that will include unlimited play in our arcade and our new table top gaming area.   

Risks & Challenges

Moving into a new location can be a challenge for any small business, but with your help we believe that we will be able to make significant improvements to O-Nett Gaming Co. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us out by telling others about our new location and by following us on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/onett.gaming

F.A.Q.

Any of the memberships and passes will allow you access to the arcade and our table top gaming area during our regular store hours.  
Passes will become available once our Indiegogo campaign ends and we have moved into our new location.
For VIP and entourage passes, the membership holder must be present for any guest to enter.
All memberships and passes are non-transferable and are for a single person, unless stated otherwise. 
Feel free to contact us with any further questions.

story:
For more information visit evolutionoftweets.com!



The Exodus is Here

George Orwell was right! It's the year 2016 and Twitter has been over-run by special interest groups who seek to silence their opposition and control global thought.


Is Twitter Dying?

Twitter's CEO has changed 3 times in the past 2 years, their board members are leaving, their public stock price is tanking, and they still haven't figured out how to make money!

Add-on a desperate last-ditch attempt to create a safe space for their loudest and most annoying users, thus ushering in the era of censorship on the platform.... And Twitter might as well be dead!

Is It Time to Move On?

We think so, and we're pretty sure we know where people are going to go!


Freebird is Freedom of Tweets

It's A Censorship-proof Twitter

It's built on blockchain technology which can only be circumvented by a complete shut-down of power and the internet. Your voice will never again be silenced, because this is the age in which we live.

It Has No Gatekeepers

Freebird has no controllers, it has no power to be seized and no people to be corrupted. Freebird is just a place where people go to say whatever they want, and follow whomever they want.

Isn't this Scary?

If you believe that free speech is important, you believe that free tweets are important.

It's our natural right as human beings to think what we want and to say what we want, as thoughts and words do not prevent any other from being able to do the same.


We're Bringing Back the Apps

Twitter intentionally destroyed their developer eco-system in search of a business model and control.

Innovative apps are what made Twitter great, and the side-effect of Freebird is that they'll be back forever!


And We're Getting Rid of Algorithms

Although it's up to user to choose their experience, our apps are never going to mess with user's timelines and the fact that they have and should always be organized by time!




Help us Build This

Doing this right takes a little bit of work, but if everyone kicks in just a little bit, it's possible.

If you think the time is right for this to happen, fund this project!

For more information visit evolutionoftweets.com!

Here's a Catchy Tune

story:
Our Mission:

Every major sport and activity has a Hall of Fame to honor their greatest people, except video games - let's change that!

If you've ever experienced the magic of a place like Cooperstown, NY as a baseball fan, then you can appreciate the same spirit being contagious in Seattle when it comes to gaming. It's time we add to that, and build a landmark, The Gaming Hall of Fame.

Gaming is becoming a major part of our pastime, culture, and future. The museum to commemorate those individuals that raised the bar, players or designers, needs to be a cut above existing Hall of Fame museums. We aim to build a destination that showcases the highlights of the history of game design and the evolution of competitive play in a way that can only be as innovative and unique as games are to other sports and activities.

Some of the most memorable advances in online gaming have come from the communities that love the games, and now, we are asking you to share that same passion to help build this Hall of Fame, and be a permanent part of gaming history by doing so.

What We Need 


Share, Share, Share!

Potentially the biggest factor in our success will be expanding the reach of our mission to gaming enthusiasts around the world. We totally understand that most people can't afford to contribute right now, but keep us in mind and use our share buttons on this page!

$50,000+

We will continue our efforts to find support for this museum and app and will now be able to afford the hosting to make it available and secure worldwide. 

$250,000+

If we make it this far, we will have enough to close on the property where the Hall of Fame will be built, AND have our developers working full time to have the GamingHoF app released by 2016. 

$500,000+

With this much support, we will be eligible for State and Federal Grants, and will seek out the remaining funds from private investors to build the most awesome video game landmark imaginable!


What You Get!

Be sure to check out all of our perks for contributing off to the right, but let's take a second to talk about the featured ones that not only make the biggest difference, but have the coolest rewards!


$25 

Admit Two! Admission for you and another to the Hall of Fame museum upon the completion, these tickets are good for life! That's right, permanent entrance for you to make as many visits as you'd like. This will not include special events, or inauguration ceremonies, but you will always have access to the museum to see our ever changing exhibits. Bonus: A unique flair for your username on our web application that is only available through this campaign.

$250

Have your name engraved in a tile that we call the "Founder's Walk" which will be the main entrance of the museum. These are limited, because space is limited. The exact designs won't be finalized until we are further along, but, each name will be very easy to read because anyone claiming this perk is a huge factor in our success.  These will be maintained forever, and you can show off your name when you take your kids or even grandchildren to the museum. Bonus: Everything from the $25 perk, as well!



The Impact

There are Hall of Fame museums for multiple aspects of sports, culture, and entertainment. Gaming, however, is a worldwide phenomenon that has a playing field that almost everyone in the world has access to. It is also driven by our rapidly advancing technology and infrastructure of high speed internet and next generation capabilities developed by brilliant people, and pushed to the limits by extremely talented players. We want the museum that celebrates these individuals to reflect that next generation technology by being something truly unique that will be a destination for generations to come.

The cost of building such an extravagant Hall of Fame is estimated at $17 million. We could only dream that enough enthusiastic gamers out there will contribute all of that. Through a successful campaign, we will legitimize our cause and be eligible for state and federal grants, as well as validating private investment to take care of the rest.

But, that's not all we intend to do!

Imagine walking into the Gaming Hall of Fame where you will see iconic avatars from back to your childhood. Around every corner, commemorations of those individuals who created them, and the elite players that let their talent shine above the rest. Most games boil down to numbers, and almost all games that are played competitively online have ranking systems in place.

Our web application pools the data across all platforms and games to create a cumulative ranking of players. For instance, if you were to look at two players, each Rank 1 in their respective game, they will be on the same level. If one was Rank 1 in a second game, on perhaps a different platform, that player would be a higher rank than the player that is only ranked in one game.

Alpha screenshot showcasing how ranking differs. We plan to also add Clan, Team, Guild and/or Group rankings as well.


This is no small task, and has been in the works for well over a year. We need the support to secure and finish this application and make it available to everyone.

Walking among the Greatest of All Time, as a visitor to the museum, we will create in real time an exhibit to showcase your gaming career, whether it be professional or as a hobbyist, everyone who contributes to the Hall of Fame will have their place in it. There are so few that make up the best players in the world, but because gaming can be played by everyone, we think it's important that we can also celebrate the best among friends and in smaller regions.

You will be able to see who the first of your friends are to complete achievements. These can be anything from world firsts to friend firsts in any game, and as simple as the achievements and trophies in current games or so hard to reach that only one or two will ever claim them. Achievements can be created by users and shared, as well as including rewards!

As many of us are huge fans of Diablo 3: RoS, it was the first game we included for our Social Achievements:

Adding more functionality to this app, and crossing platforms is necessary.

Risks & Challenges


We want our web application to be secure. There is an immense amount of data being processed and stored to create these rankings, and we want to be sure that it cannot be manipulated or used for any other purpose by outside parties. This will require the support of everyone contributing, as well as a dedicated team to maintain and the funding to support this much activity. Filling up the rest of our team will require hiring some of the most talented developers out there for this project to be done properly. With your support, we will add talented and passionate people to our team.

Construction is everywhere in Seattle, but there are still some fantastic locations available for the museum. Being overly selective of where and how big we can build will depend on the support we receive from you today. The interest we've generated from private investors to subsidize the cost of construction is only stalled by whether or not the world is ready for a Gaming Hall of Fame. There have been so many blog lists and museum exhibits to honor games that have stood the test of time – let's show them that we are ready for a true Gaming Hall of Fame dedicated to the people we look up to in this industry!

The Gaming Hall of Fame is an inevitable addition to the world of video games - please help us make it happen by either contributing, or just sharing our mission to the gaming enthusiasts you know.

Thank you!

-Rich Fussell, Max Chesnut, Corey Johnson, and the rest of the Official Online Gaming Hall of Fame Organization

million. We could only dream that enough enthusiastic gamers out
there will contribute all of that. Through a successful campaign, we
will legitimize our cause and be eligible for state and federal
grants, as well as validating private investment to take care of the
rest.But, that's not all we intend to do!Imagine
walking into the Gaming Hall of Fame where you will see iconic
avatars from back to your childhood. Around every corner,
commemorations of those individuals who created them, and the elite
players that let their talent shine above the rest. Most games boil
down to numbers, and almost all games that are played competitively
online have ranking systems in place. 



Our web application pools the data
across all platforms and games to create a cumulative ranking of
players. For instance, if you were to look at two players, each Rank
1 in their respective game, they will be on the same level. If one
was Rank 1 in a second game, on perhaps a different platform, that
player would be a higher rank than the player that is only ranked in
one game.
Alpha screenshot showcasing how ranking differs. We plan to also add Clan, Team, Guild and/or Group rankings as well.


This is no small task, and has been in the works for well
over a year. We need the support to secure and finish this
application and make it available to everyone.Walking among
the Greatest of All Time, as a visitor to the museum, we will create
in real time an exhibit to showcase your gaming career, whether it be
professional or as a hobbyist, everyone who contributes to the Hall
of Fame will have their place in it. There are so few that make up
the best players in the world, but because gaming can be played by
everyone, we think it's important that we can also celebrate the best
among friends and in smaller regions. 



You will be able to see who the first
of your friends are to complete achievements. These can be anything
from world firsts to friend firsts in any game, and as simple as the
achievements and trophies in current games or so hard to reach that
only one or two will ever claim them. Achievements can be created by
users and shared, as well as including rewards!As many of us are huge fans of Diablo 3: RoS, it was the first game we included for our Social Achievements:

Adding more functionality to this app, and crossing platforms is necessary.   Risks & Challenges
  
We want our web application to be
secure. There is an immense amount of data being processed and stored
to create these rankings, and we want to be sure that it cannot be
manipulated or used for any other purpose by outside parties. This
will require the support of everyone contributing, as well as a
dedicated team to maintain and the funding to support this much
activity. Filling up the rest of our team will require hiring some of
the most talented developers out there for this project to be done
properly. With your support, we will add talented and passionate people to our team.Construction is everywhere in Seattle, but there
are still some fantastic locations available for the museum. Being
overly selective of where and how big we can build will depend on the
support we receive from you today. The interest we've generated from
private investors to subsidize the cost of construction is only
stalled by whether or not the world is ready for a Gaming Hall of
Fame. There have been so many blog lists and museum exhibits to honor
games that have stood the test of time – let's show them that we
are ready for a true Gaming Hall of Fame dedicated to the people we look up
to in this industry!
The Gaming Hall of Fame is an inevitable addition to the world of video games - please help us make it happen by either contributing, or just sharing our mission to the gaming enthusiasts you know.Thank you!-Rich Fussell, Max Chesnut, Corey Johnson, and the rest of the Official Online Gaming Hall of Fame Organization

story:
This is the expanded information, for my pitch Video.
  • Hello, My name is Robert Goodall, and I'm the owner of Red Panda Games Inc.
  • I am here asking for finacial help, to open a game store.
  • This campaign is important to me on many levels. The first reason is that I'm currently on disability, and am looking to make myself useful. The second reason is my niece and nephew. My niece recently started playing My little Pony, and my nephew plays Pokemon, I've noticed that there are less and less stores in the nearby area for them or their friends to play at. The third reason is, the opportunity for me to give back. That's why after my store been open for 3 years, I'll be donating at least 1% of our net earnings, to other projects.
  • By donating, you are helping create jobs, make a safe environment in which gamers can meet and play, and make your donated money go further.
    Funding
    • To open a game store, I'd need about $15,000. I'm only asking for $10,000, as I can cut overhead by taking a salary of only 1 dollar a month for the first 9 months.
    • This money will go to starting inventory, the first 6 months rent, insurance, setting up our website, and any fixtures that we'll need to buy.
    • In the event that I can't reach my goal, The funds would go into a savings vehicle. That way the money can continue to grow, while I continue to gather funds.

    What you get by contributing
    • All contributors of $10 or more will get a membership card with their name on it.
    • Perks of membership. For all members, we'll have special days where the store will open earlier just for them. For Regular members, there will be a 10% discount on all new product. For Premium members, your cost will be 20% above cost on new product. For Founder members, Your cost will be 10% above cost on all product.
    • For members that are out of area, they will be able to order online using their discount levels, and have their products shipped to them.
    • Members get a discount on tournament fees. (Example. The fee to get in to an event is $5. Members will get a dollar off, Premium Members will get 2 dollars off, and Founders will get 3 dollars off. If the fee to get into an event is $15, members get $3 off, premium $6 off, and founders $9 off.)
    • Members with children. You'll will be able to pay for your child's tournament fees using your discount.

    Risk and transparency
    • What qualifies me to run a store? I've managed small business before, as well operated a home business. I know these products, and enjoy teaching people how to play the games I'll be selling.
    • Once we've opened the store. If your in the neighborhood, stop by and see what your money has paid for. If not, I'll be posting pictures and updates on our Facebook group page. "Red Panda Games Inc."
    • All business activity will be published on my group page, and we welcome any questions from donators.

    What I'll be carrying.
    • CCG
    • RPG
    • LCG
    • Boardgames
    • Dart
    • Chess
    • Dice
    • And anything else related to good old fashion table top games.
    If you can't help?
    Thank you for taking the time to read all of this. If your short on cash, or just can't get behind this idea, that's OK. Please, share this either way.

      Robert Goodall

      Owner Red Panda Games Inc.

story:
Short Summary


Stage3 is a video-games development team born two years ago. We released our first game, Cyan, few months ago and it can be found for free on Google Play Store.

After Cyan we started developing other games until we decided to bring Cyan back with a sequel: Cyan Colorized.

Cyan Colorized (temporary name) is not just a new version of Cyan, it is a brand new game.

First of all we completely renewed the gameplay by making it funnier and more mind stimulating.


We also made it 3D, making possible new features like rotating the plat by 90 degrees, setting it up, and then moving on its side.

We have a lot of new amazing adds in pipeline like special tiles, new graphics and new musics but we need your help to fulfill them all.

Cyan Colorized will be available on iOS, Android, Windows Phone, PC, Mac and Linux!

What We Need & What You Get

We need 10000€ that will be used to add all the features that we have in our mind and to advertise our game.

Obviously you will get perks depending on the amount of your contributions:

1€:
-Every help is appreciated! You will get a sincerely thank you from the whole team.

5€:
-You will get a digital version of Cyan Colorized for Windows, Mac or Linux.

15€:
-You will get a limited edition CD with Cyan Colorized for Windows, Mac or Linux!

25€:
-You will get a Plat shaped 8GB USB flash drive with preinstalled a Windows, Mac or Linux version of Cyan Colorized!

30€:
-You will get an awesome Cyan Colorized t-shirt!

50€:
-You will get both a Plat shaped 8GB USB flash drive with preinstalled a Windows, Mac or Linux version of Cyan Colorized and an awesome Cyan Colorized t-shirt!

100€:
-Thank you so much! You will get all of the above plus you can create your own level for Cyan Colorized (the level will be published in the first update of the game which will be available few days after the end of the campaign).

10000€:
-WOW! You are amazing! You will get a trip to Italy and we will take you to Naples and you will have a dinner in the best pizzeria of Naples and we'll discuss about our future projects plus you will receive all of the above perks!


Cyan Colorized will be funded even if we don't reach the 10000€ goal.


Our dream is to make Cyan Colorized a great game and to let people know about it. Help us to make it possible!


Other Ways You Can Help

Do you like the project but you can't contribute? We would really appreciate if you'll share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter or any other social network that you use. Spread the word, every help is welcome! That means a lot for us!
