Making sure that our world is built optimized for all experiences from the very beginning such as Mobile VR, PC VR, Android apps etc to make sure smooth implementation later down the line.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Please use Indiegogo share tools!

story:
UPDATE: $3.000 goal has been reached! $7500 goal reached as well! Free fan disc will be added to all game rewards once it is released (See more about stretch goals at the bottom).

 

Hello, I am Jakke Elonen, one of the founders and project lead of Fruitbat Factory. Together with my partners Ozhan Sen and Yoshifumi Ishii we are an independent localization company whose sole goal is to bring great Japanese PC games to English-speaking audiences worldwide.

We released our first game,Yakiniku Banzai’s critically acclaimed strategy game War of the Human Tanks for Windows PCs in September 2012. War of the Human Tanks was named for 4th place in IndieGames' Top 10 Indie Strategy Games of 2012.

Soon after we announced our second project, TORaIKI’s Puzzle RPG 99 Spirits to be released in early 2013. Only a couple of months after its announcement, the project won the election for the Eclectic Indie Dev Grant by a wide margin, showing us that there are many people that want to play this game.

This brings us to the present. We are seeking the support of everyone interested in playing more unique Japanese PC games in English to help fund our current project and ongoing work.



30% of all the proceeds of a successful campaign will go to the original Japanese developer of the game, TORaIKI.

We are a completely independent company with no external financial backing. We are doing what we love and will continue to do so even if no funding is made available.

We have already committed to our entire development expenses through our personal resources and our IndieGogo fundraising is an appeal for you to support our work. Every cent donated here will support our small company, make 99 Spirits the best it can be and help ourselves and the developer release more interesting titles in the near future.

Released in Japan in August 2012, 99 Spirits is the first RPG produced by the indie game circle TORaIKI, and is currently being localized for English speaking audiences to be released on Windows PC in early 2013. The game features an original battle system where players will have to puzzle out the true identity of the enemy before defeating them. 99 Spirits revolves around the real Japanese legends of Tsukumogami, where everyday objects come alive on their 100th birthday.

- Over 10 hours of playtime in an RPG that mixes intense puzzles with fast paced action
- Work out the true identity of your enemies in a unique battle system
- Capture enemy spirits and turn them into allies
- Interact with over 40 unique characters that impact your journey
- Battle over 100 monsters and master a vast variety of skills
- Maintain your equipment and combat hunger as you traverse different regions
- Beautifully detailed art and an atmospheric original soundtrack bring feudal Japan alive

- Dual audio: Toggle between English and Japanese voice

Click to watch the 99 Spirits English Gameplay Preview video

The player guides Hanabusa on her travels across multiple regions, encountering events and enemies to battle.

The combat revolves around puzzling out the true identity of the Tsukumogami you are fighting - at the beginning of the battle, the enemy's presence is conceaeled and you cannot inflict lasting damage on them. Your actions give you hints towards the essence of the enemy. 

Once the enemy's identity has been correctly identified and revealed, the battle begins in earnest and Hanabusa is able to destroy the enemy - or claim them for her collection.

Keep track of all Tsukumogami you have fought. Capture and train them to use their skills in battle!

Encounter over 40 characters during Hanabusa's travels - some will help you, some will stand in your way. Visit various merchants to stay supplied and in fighting condition!

For a more detailed explanation of the battle mechanics, please see our blog post explaining them.

Hanabusa is a young headstrong girl living in the Heian capital within medieval Japan.  But when her mother is slain by evil spirits, her life turns into one of vengeance as she sets out to hunt and destroy the spirits. 

During Hanabusa’s travels, she meets a white fox who turns out to be a servant of the mountain god. Hanabusa receives a special sword passed down from her mother, which gives her the ability to see the true forms of spirits to help slay them. Shortly after, a spirit claiming to be Hanabusa’s long-lost father, Hidetada, breaks her sword and leaves Hanabusa powerless and confused.

Now to mend her broken sword and learn the truth about her father, Hanabusa embarks on a journey to annihilate every last one of the evil spirits.

You'll receive a copy from a retailer of your choice within our power to arrange, or alternatively a direct download - plus a Steam key if the game is Greenlit.

Simultaneously to the IndieGoGo campaign, we are also launching our efforts on Steam Greenlight to bring 99 Spirits into Steam.

Please vote for us at Steam Greenlight.

Towards that goal, everyone who receives a copy of 99 Spirits from this IndieGoGo project will receive a free Steam key for it once the game is greenlit!

Okuni - The original sound track for 99 Spirits + Special thanks in a collaborator section of our website, along with updates on the game's progress.

Kotetsu - All previous rewards + A digital copy of 99 Spirits upon release.

Waka - All previous rewards + A deluxe edition copy of our previous release, War of the Human Tanks including both the game and soundtrack.

Soujun - All previous rewards + Sneak peek! Exclusive access to 99 Spirits Trial Version at least a week before its public release. + Access to a private forum on our website to discuss updates and help us improve the game.

Tomiko - All previous rewards + A special card in thanks for supporting 99 Spirits, specially designed with beautiful artwork on one side and team signatures on the other, mailed to your home.

Yoshihisa - All previous rewards + Exclusive access to all compiled alpha builds of 99 Spirits during the localization process. + Name in credits under special thanks. + An extra copy of 99 Spirits deluxe edition including both the game and soundtrack - gift a friend!

Katsumoto - All previous rewards + Two IndieGoGo-exclusive stick posters with beautiful 99 Spirits art, free shipping (restrictions apply).

Komiya - All previous rewards + A specially designed 99 Spirits t-shirt (white, all sizes) with free shipping (restrictions apply).

Tamagami - All previous rewards + A specially designed physical copy of 99 Spirits artbook featuring 48 pages of hand drawn art with free shipping (restrictions apply) + The eternal friendship of Fruitbat Factory: A free copy of all our future games upon their release.

Kagerou - All previous rewards + A specially designed 99 Spirits body pillow (white, double sided), three options, free shipping (restrictions apply).

Improve Your Tier: Pledge an extra $100 each to get more body pillow cases. Options: Hanabusa, Saki, Rouran.

Note: Body pillow case only, pillow not included.

Izumo - All previous rewards + A super collectable IndieGoGo exclusive 99 Spirits Limited Collectors Edition in a special box including a physical copy of 99 Spirits + original soundtrack and two beautiful bookmarks featuring Hanabusa in two different outfits and a crowd of Tsukumogami. Free shipping (restrictions apply).

Hisame - All previous rewards + IndieGoGo-exclusive chance to design your own Tsukumogami. The team will create an original Tsukumogami based just on your input and put it into the game. + Name in credits with a special mention alongside your creation.

 

 

 

First strech-goal is at $7.500. If we reach this amount, we will localize and release the 99 Spirits fan disc in English language. It is an side-story for 99 Spirits.

 

 

 

We will be revealing more goals in time. We have some nice surprises planned.

For our friends in Japan.

story_txt:
UPDATE: $3.000 goal has been reached! $7500 goal reached as well! Free fan disc will be added to all game rewards once it is released (See more about stretch goals at the bottom).
 
Hello, I am Jakke Elonen, one of the founders and project lead of Fruitbat Factory. Together with my partners Ozhan Sen and Yoshifumi Ishii we are an independent localization company whose sole goal is to bring great Japanese PC games to English-speaking audiences worldwide.
We released our first game,Yakiniku Banzai’s critically acclaimed strategy game War of the Human Tanks for Windows PCs in September 2012. War of the Human Tanks was named for 4th place in IndieGames' Top 10 Indie Strategy Games of 2012.
Soon after we announced our second project, TORaIKI’s Puzzle RPG 99 Spirits to be released in early 2013. Only a couple of months after its announcement, the project won the election for the Eclectic Indie Dev Grant by a wide margin, showing us that there are many people that want to play this game.
This brings us to the present. We are seeking the support of everyone interested in playing more unique Japanese PC games in English to help fund our current project and ongoing work. 

30% of all the proceeds of a successful campaign will go to the original Japanese developer of the game, TORaIKI.
We are a completely independent company with no external financial backing. We are doing what we love and will continue to do so even if no funding is made available.We have already committed to our entire development expenses through our personal resources and our IndieGogo fundraising is an appeal for you to support our work. Every cent donated here will support our small company, make 99 Spirits the best it can be and help ourselves and the developer release more interesting titles in the near future. 

Released in Japan in August 2012, 99 Spirits is the first RPG produced by the indie game circle TORaIKI, and is currently being localized for English speaking audiences to be released on Windows PC in early 2013. The game features an original battle system where players will have to puzzle out the true identity of the enemy before defeating them. 99 Spirits revolves around the real Japanese legends of Tsukumogami, where everyday objects come alive on their 100th birthday.

- Over 10 hours of playtime in an RPG that mixes intense puzzles with fast paced action- Work out the true identity of your enemies in a unique battle system- Capture enemy spirits and turn them into allies- Interact with over 40 unique characters that impact your journey- Battle over 100 monsters and master a vast variety of skills- Maintain your equipment and combat hunger as you traverse different regions- Beautifully detailed art and an atmospheric original soundtrack bring feudal Japan alive
- Dual audio: Toggle between English and Japanese voice

Click to watch the 99 Spirits English Gameplay Preview video
The player guides Hanabusa on her travels across multiple regions, encountering events and enemies to battle.

The combat revolves around puzzling out the true identity of the Tsukumogami you are fighting - at the beginning of the battle, the enemy's presence is conceaeled and you cannot inflict lasting damage on them. Your actions give you hints towards the essence of the enemy. 

Once the enemy's identity has been correctly identified and revealed, the battle begins in earnest and Hanabusa is able to destroy the enemy - or claim them for her collection.

Keep track of all Tsukumogami you have fought. Capture and train them to use their skills in battle!

Encounter over 40 characters during Hanabusa's travels - some will help you, some will stand in your way. Visit various merchants to stay supplied and in fighting condition!

For a more detailed explanation of the battle mechanics, please see our blog post explaining them.

Hanabusa is a young headstrong girl living in the Heian capital within medieval Japan.  But when her mother is slain by evil spirits, her life turns into one of vengeance as she sets out to hunt and destroy the spirits. 
During Hanabusa’s travels, she meets a white fox who turns out to be a servant of the mountain god. Hanabusa receives a special sword passed down from her mother, which gives her the ability to see the true forms of spirits to help slay them. Shortly after, a spirit claiming to be Hanabusa’s long-lost father, Hidetada, breaks her sword and leaves Hanabusa powerless and confused.
Now to mend her broken sword and learn the truth about her father, Hanabusa embarks on a journey to annihilate every last one of the evil spirits.

You'll receive a copy from a retailer of your choice within our power to arrange, or alternatively a direct download - plus a Steam key if the game is Greenlit.

Simultaneously to the IndieGoGo campaign, we are also launching our efforts on Steam Greenlight to bring 99 Spirits into Steam.
Please vote for us at Steam Greenlight.
Towards that goal, everyone who receives a copy of 99 Spirits from this IndieGoGo project will receive a free Steam key for it once the game is greenlit!


Okuni - The original sound track for 99 Spirits + Special thanks in a collaborator section of our website, along with updates on the game's progress.

Kotetsu - All previous rewards + A digital copy of 99 Spirits upon release. 
Waka - All previous rewards + A deluxe edition copy of our previous release, War of the Human Tanks including both the game and soundtrack.

Soujun - All previous rewards + Sneak peek! Exclusive access to 99 Spirits Trial Version at least a week before its public release. + Access to a private forum on our website to discuss updates and help us improve the game.

Yoshihisa - All previous rewards + Exclusive access to all compiled alpha builds of 99 Spirits during the localization process. + Name in credits under special thanks. + An extra copy of 99 Spirits deluxe edition including both the game and soundtrack - gift a friend!

Katsumoto - All previous rewards + Two IndieGoGo-exclusive stick posters with beautiful 99 Spirits art, free shipping (restrictions apply).

Kagerou - All previous rewards + A specially designed 99 Spirits body pillow (white, double sided), three options, free shipping (restrictions apply).
Improve Your Tier: Pledge an extra $100 each to get more body pillow cases. Options: Hanabusa, Saki, Rouran.
Note: Body pillow case only, pillow not included.

Izumo - All previous rewards + A super collectable IndieGoGo exclusive 99 Spirits Limited Collectors Edition in a special box including a physical copy of 99 Spirits + original soundtrack and two beautiful bookmarks featuring Hanabusa in two different outfits and a crowd of Tsukumogami. Free shipping (restrictions apply).

Hisame - All previous rewards + IndieGoGo-exclusive chance to design your own Tsukumogami. The team will create an original Tsukumogami based just on your input and put it into the game. + Name in credits with a special mention alongside your creation.


 
 
 
First strech-goal is at $7.500. If we reach this amount, we will localize and release the 99 Spirits fan disc in English language. It is an side-story for 99 Spirits.

story:
WE DID IT!!! A huge thank you to everyone who helped us spread the word and donated. We really appreciate it a whole lot and we are looking for the future with excitement because of your generosity. Now let's get serious and create a kick-ass game!

Please follow the game's development on the devblog!

Indie Game Story is all about choices. You start alone with very little money and a crappy computer. You must start freelancing to be able to pay for the bills, and once you ready you can start to fill your office with awesome stuff, hire more employees to help you, manage them, make difficult choices to stay on the track against other competitors (which on phase 2 is against the whole world). Shortly put, it's about optimizing revenue, having a blast while unlocking exciting new objects, new offices to rent and also developing your own indie games! 

 

Feb 27: New video update! Go check it out!

Feb 24: UPDATED PERK! For the rest of the campaign, the 25$ perk gives you your name in the game + TWO copies of the game on release! Make it quick only a few days left!

Feb 23: We will be live streaming with Handyman Studios tonight at 7PM! Don't miss this chance to see IGS gameplay!

Feb 21: We have new awesome forums! Published a new article about latest alpha progress, about our new community manager, a new IRC channel and more good stuff!

Feb 16: Alpha 1 has been released! And there's an awesome limited time offer! Check this out!

Feb 11: New development update is live on the blog! Also added a brand new screenshot featuring some new furniture! Go check them out in the gallery!

Feb 7: New article on development blog! and also a new article on Indie Sniffer!

Feb 6: New article on Indie Statik!

Feb 5: New article on Indius! New images are now up! Go check them out in the gallery!

 

I've got this question quite a few times, so I'm going to make sure everybody understands why this game exists.

Update! I just posted on IGS' blog about the whole GameDev* question. Please take a minute and check it out: http://indiegamestory.org/post/42284774718/this-needs-clarification

This game is not a simple game where you watch your screen while your projects get done. You have to interact with the game. Your employees have needs. Think about a mix between Theme Hospital, Rollercoaster Tycoon, Prison Architect and The Sims.

You have to actually move your employees around to get stuff done. Move someone to their desk to make him/her work on a project, if tired you have to make sure your employee rests a little, why not buy him something to eat or simply move him/her to the living room to watch tv?

Each employees have needs and if you want them to perform optimally you have to take care of them. There will also be different offices (which you can visit and and rent) with different permanent bonuses, and you will even be able to enhance your current office by buying vendor machines, coffee pots, couches and more! 

There is also have random events throughout the game. Employees can get sick, lowering the productivity. Also be sure you have installed an anti-virus and a firewall on your network because you can also get hacked or get viruses which will turn your computers into useless piece of hardware.

But don't worry, the goal here isn't about complicating things but about having fun with a non-linear gameplay providing many hours of replayability with its online features and its monthly content updates.

 

There's a very active development blog at www.indiegamestory.org. I post weekly development updates, and also many other related articles such as my vision for future features, etc. I'm also trying to get a little community around the game on our forums.

 

As you may have noticed, the game has a very basic artstyle at the moment. This is because I draw it all by myself, and I'm way better at programming than drawing hehe!

Now I'm right in the middle of development and I need an artist (already found one) to help me finish the game visually which I can't afford by myself at the moment since I'm freelancing development projects to pay for the bills and also for the game development.

So my choices were:

1) Keep the very basic looking arts and waste many days of work to draw everything by myself. Which would make the game unappealing, would give me less time to polish it and did I tell you that it would be ugly?

2) Get enough funds to pay for an artist which would fast forward the game development and get it released in the next months because arts would be made by a profesionnal so I'd have plenty of time to develop and polish the game. It would also look awesome!

The money may serve to get some better music for the game too.

I also would love to buy the Steam Greenlight license now so I could be sure of being able to push it there soon enough.

 

My name is Tommy Bergeron. I'm 24 years old and I've been a web, mobile and software developer for the last 8 years of my life. About two years ago I started playing with game engines just for fun and I totally fell in love with making games and haven't stopped since then.

Since the beginning of this project I never skipped one day, I really want this to work because I consider my ideas and I really believe that once the game's development finished: this game is really going to be awesome! (Even I can't wait to play it!)

Getting it done is the hardest part. It’s easy to get an idea, it’s easy to build a prototype, it’s easy to start development and it’s also easy to draw basic arts. But it’s harder to type thousands of lines of code, draw hundreds of sprites and animations and stay connected with the community all the way up to release.

I love to think about the day my game will be on Steam, I love to dream about people reviewing it, receiving plenty of emails from people, etc. I always think about the people, how happy I will make them if my game is good and fun.

That is why I need you, a bit of your time and your help.

 

I just really wanted to tell THANK YOU to anyone who gives any amount of money, who takes the time to share the campaign or simply likes it. Trust me, you're making a young man very happy to finally pursue his dreams.

 

Do not hesitate to write me an email, post on the forums or simply comment on the blog at any moment! I swear I'm going to take the time to read and respond accordingly!

You can also follow IGS' twitter, I also have one.

story:
The Paleo Diet Video Game 

Introducing Hundreds of Thousands of Young People To The Paleo Diet and Benefits of Organic Food.


Get updates on Twitter - @PaleoDietGame and our Facebook Group.

We've updated the perks -- what's mentioned in the video is no longer up to date, please check the perks on the right hand side.


My Story

You might not believe it looking at me now but 4 years ago I was a borderline type-2 diabetic, overweight and plagued with illnesses like IBS, anxiety, depression and psoriasis.  


4 years later and thanks to the paleo diet I've cured all of my illnesses, feel great and energetic every day.  My weight is a stable 66kgs (145lbs), Im stronger and fitter now than I've ever been and I never get sick.  


I love telling people about the paleo diet, I can talk about it for hours, all the benefits, the easy fat loss, the increased energy and also feeling better about knowing where my food comes from.  


But the young people of today need some help, because like us, they are indoctrinated from birth about the evils of meat and saturated fats, and are told by the medical profession, media and their governments that a high fat diet is a bad diet.


There is so much great information out there on paleo blogs and sites but many young people (and even most adults) won't get started because the information overload is just too great.


Our goal is to make an Fun, Educational Game That Teaches Young People How To Take Control of Their Health Through the Paleo Diet and Eating Organic, Local Food.



The game will be:


1) really fun to play!

2) Free to download - for maximum exposure

3) available on iPhone, iPad and Mac through the app store

4) shows a cute boy or girl character getting fat, sickly and unhappy when they eat processed food like donuts, pizza, cereal.

5) shows the same character getting slimmer, more healthy and happier when they eat organic natural whole foods like meat, butter, eggs and vegetables.

6) Provide snippets of information at the end of each game such as "Did you know, there is no proven link between saturated fat and heart disease?" and then include a link to relevent blogs or research if they wish to read further.


The gameplay style will be similar to popular games like Doodle Jump and Mega Jump.  the player tilts their phone to move left and right - Avoiding bad foods (which slow them down and make them fat) and moving into healthy foods which give them a boost and make them look more healthy.


History

In December I released a game called "Rainin Donuts" which was a subtle dig at the fattening effects of eating donuts, however this game did not take the message far enough, and there was no way for people to follow up.  


My plan is to use the base Rainin Donuts gameplay but completley overhaul the game and add:


* New graphics, characters and food items

* A decision based system - eating good food (meat, butter, vegetables) makes you lean and healthy, eating bad food (pizza, donuts) makes you fat and sickly

* At the end of each game, display various snippets of health information such as "Did you know there is no link between eating fresh meat and heart disease?"


Rainin' Donuts is available as a free download on the app store, here are the links so you can check it out


Rainin Donuts iPhone

Rainin Donuts iPad

Rainin Donts Mac


The Impact

Many of us didn't catch on to paleo until our adult life, after many years of battling sickness, obesity and disease.  You can help others to start the learning about paleo diet much younger.  

If we can change the lives of even a couple of thousand children and teens who are suffering with type-2 diabetes, obesity and sickness then it will be worth it.  

How many times have people asked you "how did you do it?".  Those people who play the game, change their lives will then become paleo advocates and help spread the word, just like you.


What We Need & What You Get

This game will be released as a free download because we want as many kids, teens and adults to play it and be introduced to the paleo diet.   Our goal for the game is 250,000 downloads, and with your help this is possible. After the game's release you can send the link to all of your friends and families, people you are about and people who you'd like to help overcome their health issues.


We need $7,500 to cover the costs of creating the art and programming of the game.  We are releasing the game as a free download so we are not making any profit on this.  All donations will be paid to the the developers of the game for their time and effort.


Launch Date - June 2012

We are aiming to launch the first version of the on iPhone, Ipad and Mac by June 2012 to coincide with the summer school holidays in the northern hemisphere.

If your donations exceed our target

We'll add extra content and gameplay modes.    A few ideas we have are:

* An endless runner style game similar to the popular Canabalt game, and use a caveman or cavewoman as the main character.

* Making the game accessible on Android phones and tablets

* localising the game so people in non-English speaking countries can play

* Supporting the game to be regularly updated with fresh tips and new gameplay modes. 

* If we receive over $50,000 we will re-develop the entire game in 3-D with highly animated characters and backgroundsand make it accessible on internet browsers, facebook as well as all of the mobile platforms listed above.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you know people who like us, are crazy about paleo and want to help children and teens understand more then please help spread the word by tweeting, facebooking, emailing and spreading this campaign.


Thanks for your support everyone!
story_txt:
The Paleo Diet Video Game 

Introducing Hundreds of Thousands of Young People To The Paleo Diet and Benefits of Organic Food.



Get updates on Twitter - @PaleoDietGame and our Facebook Group.

We've updated the perks -- what's mentioned in the video is no longer up to date, please check the perks on the right hand side.

My Story
You might not believe it looking at me now but 4 years ago I was a borderline type-2 diabetic, overweight and plagued with illnesses like IBS, anxiety, depression and psoriasis.  

4 years later and thanks to the paleo diet I've cured all of my illnesses, feel great and energetic every day.  My weight is a stable 66kgs (145lbs), Im stronger and fitter now than I've ever been and I never get sick.  

I love telling people about the paleo diet, I can talk about it for hours, all the benefits, the easy fat loss, the increased energy and also feeling better about knowing where my food comes from.  

But the young people of today need some help, because like us, they are indoctrinated from birth about the evils of meat and saturated fats, and are told by the medical profession, media and their governments that a high fat diet is a bad diet.

There is so much great information out there on paleo blogs and sites but many young people (and even most adults) won't get started because the information overload is just too great.

Our goal is to make an Fun, Educational Game That Teaches Young People How To Take Control of Their Health Through the Paleo Diet and Eating Organic, Local Food.


The game will be:

1) really fun to play!
2) Free to download - for maximum exposure
3) available on iPhone, iPad and Mac through the app store
4) shows a cute boy or girl character getting fat, sickly and unhappy when they eat processed food like donuts, pizza, cereal.
5) shows the same character getting slimmer, more healthy and happier when they eat organic natural whole foods like meat, butter, eggs and vegetables.
6) Provide snippets of information at the end of each game such as "Did you know, there is no proven link between saturated fat and heart disease?" and then include a link to relevent blogs or research if they wish to read further.

The gameplay style will be similar to popular games like Doodle Jump and Mega Jump.  the player tilts their phone to move left and right - Avoiding bad foods (which slow them down and make them fat) and moving into healthy foods which give them a boost and make them look more healthy.


History

In December I released a game called "Rainin Donuts" which was a subtle dig at the fattening effects of eating donuts, however this game did not take the message far enough, and there was no way for people to follow up.  

My plan is to use the base Rainin Donuts gameplay but completley overhaul the game and add:

* New graphics, characters and food items
* A decision based system - eating good food (meat, butter, vegetables) makes you lean and healthy, eating bad food (pizza, donuts) makes you fat and sickly
* At the end of each game, display various snippets of health information such as "Did you know there is no link between eating fresh meat and heart disease?"

Rainin' Donuts is available as a free download on the app store, here are the links so you can check it out

Rainin Donuts iPhone
Rainin Donuts iPad
Rainin Donts Mac


The Impact
Many of us didn't catch on to paleo until our adult life, after many years of battling sickness, obesity and disease.  You can help others to start the learning about paleo diet much younger.  
If we can change the lives of even a couple of thousand children and teens who are suffering with type-2 diabetes, obesity and sickness then it will be worth it.  
How many times have people asked you "how did you do it?".  Those people who play the game, change their lives will then become paleo advocates and help spread the word, just like you.


What We Need & What You Get
This game will be released as a free download because we want as many kids, teens and adults to play it and be introduced to the paleo diet.   Our goal for the game is 250,000 downloads, and with your help this is possible. After the game's release you can send the link to all of your friends and families, people you are about and people who you'd like to help overcome their health issues.

We need $7,500 to cover the costs of creating the art and programming of the game.  We are releasing the game as a free download so we are not making any profit on this.  All donations will be paid to the the developers of the game for their time and effort.


Launch Date - June 2012
We are aiming to launch the first version of the on iPhone, Ipad and Mac by June 2012 to coincide with the summer school holidays in the northern hemisphere.

If your donations exceed our target

We'll add extra content and gameplay modes.    A few ideas we have are:

Thanks for your support everyone!

story:
We are asking for $5,000 to help increase the initial size of the Steel Stars run. As it stands, we will be going into production in October, but would like to increase order with your help! What this means is that you are guaranteed a game for your contribution at any level!  

 

Purgatory Games is proud to present Steel Stars, a 4x Strategy board game by Canadian designer Scott MacArthur..

Steel Stars is a game of intergalactic warfare amongst rival corporations in Earth's dark future. With a near endless number of system configurations and multiple paths to victory (through the council, by researching technologies and advanced abilities, the creation of popular utopian worlds or by the might of your powerful fleets), Steel Stars offers new excitement and a rewarding game experience to 3-5 players.

 

 

We are hoping to be able to deliver the final version of the rulebook in 3 languages: English, French, and German, but will initially be only available in English. You can find a art-free version of the final rulebook below

DOWNLOAD IT HERE  

 

Video 1: Setup

Video 2: Actions

Video 3: Points
 

As we are from Australia shipping within the country is on us. For those in the rest of the world please include an extra $15 with your donations. If you have any questions please feel free to send them to mail@purgatorygames.com  

 

The components included with Steel Stars are::

Cards:

 -       49 System Cards

 -       45 Corporations cards, 9 for each of the 5 sides

 -       30 Action Cards

 -       25 Science Cards

 -       18 Council Cards

 -       18 Event Cards

 -       18 Exploration Cards

 -       10 space dock cards, 5 Heavy and 5 Light

 -       6 Control Points Board

 -       5 Action Breakdown Cards

 -       4 Bounty Cards

 -       3 Earth Council Cards

 -       1 First Player Marker

Markers:

 -       60 Ten millimeter cubes, 12 in each of 5 colors

 -       30 Colony Markers

 -       10 Player Pawns, 2 in each of 5 colors

Dice:

 -       60 Six-sided dice, 12 in each of 5 colors

 -       5 Twelve-sided dice

 -       1 Ten-sided dice

1 Rulebook

1 Game Box

 

Each player steps into the powerful and all encompassing shoes of the head of one of the five corporations fighting for the control of the universe. You will need to use cunning, guile, diplomacy, deception, and tactical thinking to make the decisions that will hopefully bring victory, control, renown, and respect to your corporation.In each round of the game, players select four actions to perform. Players take it in turns performing one of these. Whenever an action is performed, all other players may also perform that action. The available actions are: Fleet (move ships), Research (develop tech), Council (Create votes on new rules), Planetary (develop your civilization), Energy (generate resources) and Logistics (build new ships).

Players score points for colonizing worlds, developing tech, building colonies, passing votes and developing their civilization. The game finishes when one player has accumulated 15 points, but that player does not necessarily win, as there are bonus points scored for being the best player in each of several categories.
 

Each week we will be updating this page with more information about Steel Stars and its expanded lore. Below is the reveal schedule:

 Week 1: Announcement / What is Steel Stars? / Focusing on the Actions

 Week 2: Game Play focusing on the Research areas

 Week 3: Corporations/Back Story

 Week 4: Game Play Pt 2 focusing on the ways to gain Victory Points

 

 

At $5000 the game will be fully funded! As each goal is reached it will unlock the next funding goal. As they are reached, they will be revealed!

As a thank You for getting us to $5000 all people who have contributed will get there Shipping Cost refunded!

All people who have Pledged will get a set of promo cards. This Includes:

  -      3 x Mad Scientist for Cliché Conflict

 -       1 x Game Company for City Inc

 -       4 x Enemy Cards for Black and White

 -       1 x Dying Earth System for Steel Stars

Influence, a Mini-Expansion for steel stars will increase the number of command and manpower markers each corporation has at thier disposal as well as adding a unique system tile: The Nebula.

A hefty metal first player medallion will be included with your copy of Steel Stars. This medallion will be unique and will not be reproduced after the end of the campaign.

 

 

 

As it stands, all art for the game is complete and we wiil be putting the final touches on the layouts of the components as we target a late-August finish. Production should stat mid-September for an October release.  

 

 

At Purgatory Games we use Paypal as a reliable and secure method for making transactions on the web. If you don’t have an account, Paypal can also be used to securely process any Credit Card.  

 

Q: What are these other games you offer?

A: These are other games we have released! You can find more information abouth these, and downloadable rulebooks for them, here:

Any questions you might have please send them to mail@purgatorygames.com and we will try to get back to you with an answer as soon as possible

 

Please note that the final components are subject to change, due to production requirements and/or limitations.

All artwork and rules are property of Purgatory Games.

We're excited about answering your questions! Please send them to mail@purgatorygames.com and we will get back to you with an answer as soon as possible

 

© 2012 Purgatory Game. All Rights Reserved

story:
A New Magic Cube

Hello. Thank you for viewing. My name is Marion Tzui. I'm a designer at Desert Light Studio. I've designed a new magic cube that I called Luoshu. It is a 26-cubie 3-dimensional puzzle game, no more than 5.7 cm on each side, white, 100% ABS, EN-71 certified. In other words, it's a safe toy/game for gamers age 3 and up.

2-D puzzles are fun. 3-D puzzles are fun and challenging. Defying the traditional one-color and one-pattern design, Luoshu is a multi-colored, multi-patterned magic cube. It makes you think from the basics to the complexity of almost everything, through your hand movement if you are willing to give it a try. 

I'm very fond of this game. And I invite you to try it out. Your contribution will not only help the game grow, but also encourage me to distribute affordable cubes and cubing contests to other parts of the world.

And if you are not into cubing and definitely shy from trying it out, you can claim the perk for your child or children who might be willing to play, and the one who are. You can also help spread the word to the folks who might enjoy a brand new cubing experience. Like them, I'll be appreciating it.

Happy Holidays!

Marion Tzui

story:
Short Summary

We're creating an innovative game inclusive of custom built sets for Steamcon IV: Victorian Monsters and we need your support to fund our efforts!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500 for the suite and $500 for sets. The balance of the funds raised here on IndieGoGo will go toward campaign fees and perks.

Anything we raise over and above that will go towards creating UNFORGETTABLE gatherings following the Friday and Saturday events at the con!

All perks will be available at the Rise of Aester gaming suite staring on the first day of Steamcon. 

Thank you!

We are so grateful for your ongoing support in our community and we look forward to hosting an incredible game for you this year!

story:
Cushy is a turn based, online multiplayer, card game/fighting game mashup. Two players, each controlling a tag-team of cushy combatants, battle it out for ultimate Cushy superiority. The game does not end until one player's combatants have both been humiliated, and taken out with a class-themed finishing move. The last player with a fighter still standing wins.

Sam & Brittany battle it out while Jesse & Levi wait in the wings

Combatants are grouped into three archetypes: AB, DL, and Caretaker. Each archetype comes with its own unique move set, along with a globally shared set of Double Trouble tag-team attacks.

To attack, like inputting a combo in a fighting game, you chain together specific cards from your hand. Cushy combatants use just about every trick in the book to humiliate and defeat their opponents.

The game runs using WebGL 2 in modern web browsers. This is brand new tech. Firefox and Chrome only added support for it to their browsers in the past few months. I'm pushing the limits as far as they'll go here.

Awesomely, local to your particular game room, you'll be able to provide your own art for a selected class! For the duration of that particular game, you can play the game as your own character! This is completely different from the rewards tiers which bake your character directly into the game for everyone to see.
 

Missed your chance to back during the campaign? Card didn't work on IndieGoGo? We gotcha covered with a paypal-backed support page!

http://cushy.cc/support

 

Cushy Artists

Cushy is love letter to the entire ABDL community, so of course its art will be just as varied as our community is. I've reached out to as many exceptional artists, and have collected an elite group of stellar artist to bring Cushy to life! All twelve classes are accounted for.

  • BabyStar - Magical Girl
  • RFSwitched - Skunky Wrestler
  • BlackRoseSeduction - Momma Moo Cow
  • Merunyaa - Splash Fiend & Sissy Maker
  • Carotte - Cute Clown
  • Servas - Spoiled Princess
  • NormalDeviant - Dolly Dresser
  • Tato - Dr. Mom
  • ZombiNeko - Dungeon Lover
  • CSheriff - Big Bully
  • WonderingWolf18 - Playground

    Cushy Programmer

    My name is Ryhn! I've been programming things for the ABDL community for about seven years, mostly focused in on the Second Life slice of the world. Outside of our community, I'm a Senior Software Engineer, working every day to build unique systems from scratch for varying businesses.

    Cushy Modeler

    Tonky, my partner in all things Puddlepants, will be joining up with me on this project! He has already delivered a handful of 3D models on display in my alpha build. Tonky is a real pro, and will be able to deliver the kind of low-poly, stylish assets I'll need to keep this game running well inside of web browsers.

    Classes

    Cushy features 12 playable classes which can be mix-and-matched to form your team before each game starts. The classes are grouped into three categories, with four classes under each category.

    Caretakers

    • Sissy Maker
    • Momma Moo-Cow
    • Dr. Mom
    • Dolly Dresser

    Diaper Lovers

    • Big Bully
    • Dungeon Lover
    • Skunky Wrestler
    • Cute Clown

    Adult Babies

    • Magical Girl
    • Splash Fiend
    • Spoiled Princess
    • Playground

    What Cushy Needs & What You Get

    Minimally, Cushy needs 96 unique pieces of art to be completed. Depending on how funding goes, I may be able to expand the scope to include extra poses for characters. Breaking it down, we need art for:

    • 12 Classes (1 Pose)
    • 6 Special Attacks per Class
    • 1 Finishing Move per Class

    Funding this game, depending on what level you choose, will get you:

    • $1 Access to the finished game (Indiegogo exclusive!)
    • $15  Beta access to WIP builds
    • $50  A cameo appearance for your OC in the crowd, watching the match unfold
    • $100 A cameo appearance for your OC in a special attack/finishing move
    • Slots are first come first serve, ordered by Funder #

    Funding Overview

    I'm budgeting $70 per picture for this project. My minimal artistic implementation of the game require 8 pieces of art per class (not including alts, which are generally free).

    This works out to $6720 to get the entire roster and their attacks drawn. My ambition is to go further than this, but this is the bare-bones requirement.

    My stretch goal is to reach 11 pieces of art (not including alts) per class, which works out to $9240 total.

    This level of detail will allow for characters to visually display their diaper status as the game progresses, and change poses while said status changes, without relying entirely on one-off particle effects and debuff icons.

    Risks & Challenges

    Worth repeating, the game will be completed regardless of funding, at my own expense. This project is far too important to me to leave undone.

    The number one challenge to this project's completion is gathering all of the art required to bring it to life. Every $2500~ shaves about a year off of my internal art acquisition timeline.

    If anything is going to delay the full release, it'll be because I'm chasing down art. Ideally, for artistic consistency, I would like for a single artist to handle an entire class. This means gathering 8 commissioned pieces per class, from each artist involved in Cushy.

    Additionally, while I'm an experienced server programmer, high performance game servers are new ground for me. I spent a lot of time doing research before I began coding my server, but nothing reveals scaling issues like actually scaling up. If the game is very popular, and has high enough traffic, I may have to do some extra refinement on the performance of the system.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word! The better this campaign does, the more money I'll have for spending on premiere, top-shelf artists! The art is the lifeblood of the game, so I don't want to skimp here in the slightest.

    FAQ

    The answers to some common questions!

    • Are furries allowed?

    Cushy is furry friendly! The game is for the ENTIRE community. At least a couple of the core classes with be of the fluffy variety.

    • How do I contact you?

    Top right of the campaign, "Ask a Question" or email drizzleraincloud [at] gmail.com

    • How will you monetize the game?

    The game will only cost $5 after release. I only care to charge enough to keep the servers running. The only planned pay-for features right now are the ability to fully customize the look and feel of a class with your own custom art, and cushy combatant DLC which will add new fighters to the roster. As long as one player in your game room has purchased the content, everyone has access to it.

    Replacing a combatant with your OC is free.

    Replacing special attacks and finishers with your own art will be a premium feature.

    • Balance?

    I've built the game from the ground up to be easy to balance, and rebalance. If one strategy is too strong, or another too weak, I am more than equipped to address this without much coding effort on my part.

    • Will the game support playing offline?

    This is an area in which I still have research to do. Theoretically, I could magic something up, but I might be fighting my tech stack the whole way there. Worth mentioning, though, is that I designed my game to be playable with physical game pieces. Depending on the success of Cushy, you may find me selling physical playsets at conventions and online.

    • Will there be any male Cushy Combatants?

    I plan to have at least one male combatant, if not more. I want a mix of genders, though there's likely to be more female fighters than male when all of the classes are done!

    • Can I use my YCH slot for a licensed character?

    Sorry friend, no. I don't want anything in the game that could cause me trouble with the law. Hope you'll understand!

    • Where can I find a list of special attacks for YCHing?

    https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18LGfKnl...
    You can also find a tracker for my hours spent on the game, as well as the currently taken YCH slots in various tabs. (Click them on the bottom left corner!)

    Disclaimers

    All characters depicted in this game are 18+

    Everything about the game is subject to change. Like any software project, as systems mature and the game is play tested, I'll be making changes here and there for the betterment of the project.

Combatants are grouped into three archetypes: AB, DL, and Caretaker. Each archetype comes with its own unique move set, along with a globally shared set of Double Trouble tag-team attacks.
To attack, like inputting a combo in a fighting game, you chain together specific cards from your hand. Cushy combatants use just about every trick in the book to humiliate and defeat their opponents.
The game runs using WebGL 2 in modern web browsers. This is brand new tech. Firefox and Chrome only added support for it to their browsers in the past few months. I'm pushing the limits as far as they'll go here.
Awesomely, local to your particular game room, you'll be able to provide your own art for a selected class! For the duration of that particular game, you can play the game as your own character! This is completely different from the rewards tiers which bake your character directly into the game for everyone to see. 
Missed your chance to back during the campaign? Card didn't work on IndieGoGo? We gotcha covered with a paypal-backed support page!
http://cushy.cc/support
 

Cushy Artists
Cushy is love letter to the entire ABDL community, so of course its art will be just as varied as our community is. I've reached out to as many exceptional artists, and have collected an elite group of stellar artist to bring Cushy to life! All twelve classes are accounted for.


BabyStar - Magical Girl

RFSwitched - Skunky Wrestler

BlackRoseSeduction - Momma Moo Cow

Merunyaa - Splash Fiend & Sissy Maker

Carotte - Cute Clown

Servas - Spoiled Princess

NormalDeviant - Dolly Dresser

Tato - Dr. Mom

ZombiNeko - Dungeon Lover

CSheriff - Big Bully

WonderingWolf18 - Playground



Cushy Programmer

My name is Ryhn! I've been programming things for the ABDL community for about seven years, mostly focused in on the Second Life slice of the world. Outside of our community, I'm a Senior Software Engineer, working every day to build unique systems from scratch for varying businesses.

Cushy Modeler

Tonky, my partner in all things Puddlepants, will be joining up with me on this project! He has already delivered a handful of 3D models on display in my alpha build. Tonky is a real pro, and will be able to deliver the kind of low-poly, stylish assets I'll need to keep this game running well inside of web browsers.

Classes
Cushy features 12 playable classes which can be mix-and-matched to form your team before each game starts. The classes are grouped into three categories, with four classes under each category.



Caretakers

Sissy Maker
Momma Moo-Cow
Dr. Mom
Dolly Dresser

Diaper Lovers

Big Bully
Dungeon Lover
Skunky Wrestler
Cute Clown

Adult Babies

Magical Girl
Splash Fiend
Spoiled Princess
Playground



What Cushy Needs & What You Get

Minimally, Cushy needs 96 unique pieces of art to be completed. Depending on how funding goes, I may be able to expand the scope to include extra poses for characters. Breaking it down, we need art for:

12 Classes (1 Pose)
6 Special Attacks per Class
1 Finishing Move per Class

Funding this game, depending on what level you choose, will get you:


$1 Access to the finished game (Indiegogo exclusive!)

$15  Beta access to WIP builds

$50  A cameo appearance for your OC in the crowd, watching the match unfold

$100 A cameo appearance for your OC in a special attack/finishing move
Slots are first come first serve, ordered by Funder #


Funding Overview
I'm budgeting $70 per picture for this project. My minimal artistic implementation of the game require 8 pieces of art per class (not including alts, which are generally free).
This works out to $6720 to get the entire roster and their attacks drawn. My ambition is to go further than this, but this is the bare-bones requirement.
My stretch goal is to reach 11 pieces of art (not including alts) per class, which works out to $9240 total.
This level of detail will allow for characters to visually display their diaper status as the game progresses, and change poses while said status changes, without relying entirely on one-off particle effects and debuff icons.


Risks & Challenges

Worth repeating, the game will be completed regardless of funding, at my own expense. This project is far too important to me to leave undone.
The number one challenge to this project's completion is gathering all of the art required to bring it to life. Every $2500~ shaves about a year off of my internal art acquisition timeline.
If anything is going to delay the full release, it'll be because I'm chasing down art. Ideally, for artistic consistency, I would like for a single artist to handle an entire class. This means gathering 8 commissioned pieces per class, from each artist involved in Cushy.
Additionally, while I'm an experienced server programmer, high performance game servers are new ground for me. I spent a lot of time doing research before I began coding my server, but nothing reveals scaling issues like actually scaling up. If the game is very popular, and has high enough traffic, I may have to do some extra refinement on the performance of the system.


Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! The better this campaign does, the more money I'll have for spending on premiere, top-shelf artists! The art is the lifeblood of the game, so I don't want to skimp here in the slightest.

FAQ
The answers to some common questions!
Are furries allowed?
Cushy is furry friendly! The game is for the ENTIRE community. At least a couple of the core classes with be of the fluffy variety.
How do I contact you?
Top right of the campaign, "Ask a Question" or email drizzleraincloud [at] gmail.com
How will you monetize the game?
The game will only cost $5 after release. I only care to charge enough to keep the servers running. The only planned pay-for features right now are the ability to fully customize the look and feel of a class with your own custom art, and cushy combatant DLC which will add new fighters to the roster. As long as one player in your game room has purchased the content, everyone has access to it.
Replacing a combatant with your OC is free.
Replacing special attacks and finishers with your own art will be a premium feature.
Balance?
I've built the game from the ground up to be easy to balance, and rebalance. If one strategy is too strong, or another too weak, I am more than equipped to address this without much coding effort on my part.
Will the game support playing offline?
This is an area in which I still have research to do. Theoretically, I could magic something up, but I might be fighting my tech stack the whole way there. Worth mentioning, though, is that I designed my game to be playable with physical game pieces. Depending on the success of Cushy, you may find me selling physical playsets at conventions and online.
Will there be any male Cushy Combatants?
I plan to have at least one male combatant, if not more. I want a mix of genders, though there's likely to be more female fighters than male when all of the classes are done!
Can I use my YCH slot for a licensed character?
Sorry friend, no. I don't want anything in the game that could cause me trouble with the law. Hope you'll understand!
Where can I find a list of special attacks for YCHing?
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18LGfKnl...You can also find a tracker for my hours spent on the game, as well as the currently taken YCH slots in various tabs. (Click them on the bottom left corner!)

Disclaimers
All characters depicted in this game are 18+
Everything about the game is subject to change. Like any software project, as systems mature and the game is play tested, I'll be making changes here and there for the betterment of the project.

story:
Our Story

The night before a business trip overseas, in which I was fortunate enough to bring my best friend (my wife, Rebecca), she told me a story about wanting to help a woman at the checkout of a grocery store by holding her baby while the woman paid her tab.  The woman had three children, two toddlers and the baby she was holding while fumbling with her purse to pay.  My wife wished that she had something on her that could create a connection and give comfort to the woman for offering assistance.  Rebecca continued how cool it would be if this symbol went to Europe with us and was recognized there as well, an icebreaker to meet a new friend from a different culture.  From this experience, the idea of the Meridian and One World Connects was born.  The Meridian being a tradable medallion that acts as a social icebreaker and could have it's whereabouts and legacy followed online.  Our goal is to connect the world!


The next day we spoke about the idea and felt if we started it, we would build giving and do-gooding into our mission.  Immediately we decided to donate part of the proceeds to organizations that help others.  Also, we decided we wanted to be economically sustainable by creating job opportunities where we sell our products (starting in the US).  Finally, we decided we would find creative ways to provide job opportunities to those that have a hard time finding jobs, individuals with disabilities and/or recovering homeless.  That's where this campaign comes in.  


We need your support to start our "Do-Good Operations".  You can help provide scale so that we can place our first order assembling necklaces with the Bobby Dodd Institute in Atlanta GA.  With just 50 contributors, we can place our first contract with Bobby Dodd to assemble the necklaces that come with your Meridian.  This will establish the feasibility of our plan to provide opportunities for those overcoming employment challenges.           


           


The Impact

You can help achieve our first test run with the Bobby Dodd Institute.  Hopefully, you'll enjoy your Meridian enough to share this story with friends (it's a great conversation piece) and create more excitement about One World Connects.  This will allow us to continue to utilize the Bobby Dodd Institute for accessory assembly.  Once we really get rolling, we'll find other ways to create more job opportunities at similar facilities/organizations (we've got a ton of ambition and other ideas we'd like to implement).  Our mission is to think creatively about how we operate.  


If we meet our goal, we'll be able to purchase some metal forming equipment to place at a center and provide more job opportunities building different accessories.  If we exceed our goals, we'll be able to offer new products and find different ways to help disadvantaged employees.  Our next goal is to find ways to utilize individuals from First Step Staffing, a temp-to-hire agency that places transitioning homeless individuals.


What We Need & What You Get

Again, 50 supporters (pre-orders if you will) allows us to do our first run with the Bobby Dodd institute.  You will get a Meridian with a necklace that is assembled at the Bobby Dodd Institute.  Also, we'll be pooling 10% of all funds raised to give to a good cause and ask for your input to help decide where the funds should be donated.  Once we reach our first 50 supporters, we'll get some goods shipped out to you (within three weeks of hitting the milestone), as our project isn't dependent on full funding.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you really like our mission, we would greatly appreciate your help to get the word out to Family, Friends, Colleagues and followers.  What's the easiest way to do this?

  1. Share a link to this page using the tools directly below the video
  2. Find us on Facebook and "like" our page
  3. Follow us on Twitter
  4. Join One World Connects and begin interacting within the community
  5. Watch the end of our video above for a creative challenge!


Meet a few of our current community members




Left: This photo was taken by @gregz one of our biggest supporters.  He recently took :24 on a trip to Mexico.  


Right: @ckmunson started The Meridian Project (TMP), a way for our current community to make connections via snail mail.  She currently holds onto :Jolly, one of the most traveled Meridians via TMP.








Left: @herrick sporting his Meridian on a night out with a friend.  He works at Blue Sky Outfitters in Rome, GA, the first retail outlet to carry Meridians.


Right: @lovebeyondwords wears her Meridian everday!





Left: @runswithscissors is a prolific TMP trader (also very creative and generous).  These are some graphics she put together to find traders (more).  
 

Right: @Ehhpic had some fun with photo effects and uploaded this photo to our Facebook fan photos page.





Below: All shots from @sfdj, a traveler from SF that takes amazing pics. (l to r: :giggle on a helicopter ride in Hawaii, :epic getting sniffed out, :sympathy at Mourning Lady in SF)

story:
Monsieur Moustache needs funds to release Penguin Heroes Revenge on mobile devices. This is the long awaited sequel to the first game: Penguin Heroes! In our first attempt it was a success but only a test for us! Now our dream is to create a brand new game in our image that will keep you hooked and have fun all day long.

Penguin Heroes is an extreme racing game... with, you guessed it, PENGUINS! Try to get as far as possible by dodging traps and using boost props in each unique level.

It’s an addictive game sure to hook you for endless hours of pure badass fun.

  

Arcade Mode - Get as far as possible!
Multiplayer
Optimized Gameplay
New enemies
New stunning levels
An original game soundtrack
Optimized Sound Design
New obstacles and boost props

 

 

Monsieur Moustache is a small video game studio situated in Montreal. Talented and passionate designers and programmers form this crazy team, and fun is always to the rendez-vous!

It’s a small team with small desks and small cash, but with big plans and big dreams.

  

 

 

To the monkeys in the cage making the game for endless days and nights.

Groceries. (Pizzas and soft-drinks mostly!)

Buying the necessary licenses that will allow us to make the game

Sound design and the original soundtrack, made by awesome artists

Stretch goals extras!

Launch party! (the modest kind)

  

 

Want to upgrade your pledge? Go for it! IndieGoGo doesn’t support it directly, so here’s what you need to do:

1. Make a new pledge in the amount equal to the difference between the perks.
2. Send us an e-mail at indiegogo@mmoustache.com along with your username and describe the upgrade.

Please note that you cannot upgrade to sold out perks!
For example: You pledged 50$ to get the Chill Chick perk and want to get the Piranha Pirate. Great Idea! Just pledge an additional 100$ and send a mail. Done!

  

Don't be shy!

indiegogo@mmoustache.com

story:
Our Story

Hello everyone, my name is Mike. I'm 24 years old and an independent artist who loves to sculpt and animate after work and on weekends. I've always wanted to have my own figurine in a blister package like they have in toy stores. So I've hired some of my friends to help me do it. Jeremy Monz will be doing the Molds and Casting, Randy VanDyke will be professionally painting and Jeff Lafferty has done the artwork for the packages. These guys are all really talented and I'm so glad they are helping me.

 

This figurine is based on Uncharted hero Nathan Drake and he stands two inches tall with his base. I designed and sculpted him and had my friend Jeremy create the molds and cast me up a few. I then had Randy professionally paint a couple while Jeff was working on the package art. I went ahead and created the vacuforming machine and "buck" so I could create the plastic blister shells. Next up was getting Jeff's art and getting the backers printed and made. Finally, after a bunch of trial and error I finally have a complete custom, handmade package with our handcrafted figurines inside. I'm really proud of the end result and I hope you will enjoy the products as well and would consider backing my project to help me fund my next figurine.

 

These Drake figurines are all INDIE GOGO EXCLUSIVE and will never be available for sale or created after this project ends. I am a fan of Uncharted and this is fan art which I am giving away as perks if you decide to help pay for the materials, labor, shipping and campaign fees that it takes to get one hand made figurine created. It is my hope to use this project as a pitch to perhaps get a fan base built for future figurines, model kits and animations.  

 

I will be posting updates frequently detailing the 'making of' process the figurines and packages went through. 

 

Please consider supporting us and getting some amazing, high quality perks in return. Please look over the various pledge levels I have put together and if you have any questions or comments I would appreciate them.

 

My goal with this project is to just get these figurines in your hands so you can see the quality of each one up close and in person. I'm not making any money on this project from the figurines or a majority of the perks. I've already funded the project to this point and now I need your help to make more. I hope that you will see the hard work put into these and might consider pledging a little more than your perk so another figurine could be funded, even if it's just a dollar or two I would appreciate it so much.

 

 

The Impact

 

I hope to bring something cool and neat to fans of Uncharted, collectors, toy enthusiasts and lovers of artwork. If the campaign does not get funded, everyone who supported us will still receive their perks. I wanted everything to be created so you would have the opportunity to see what the actual product looks like finished and not some sketches or ideas of what we would like to do. These are the actual products you will receive in the mail if you decide to support the project.


What We Need & What You Get

I need your support to pay for the materials required to create the figurines and the packages. I have carefully calculated the cost of everything and the prices of each perk reflect this. There are other things like shipping costs, Indie Gogo and PayPal fees that were included. I have went to great lengths to come up with what I believe are awesome perks.

 

There are four versions of the Drake figurine, there's the professionally hand painted Drake painted by master painter Randy VanDyke.

 

 

 

 There's the awesome Glow In The Dark Drake.

 

 

 

 The Clear cast - see through - Drake

 

 

 

 And finally, the unpainted D.I.Y. resin version of Drake that you can paint yourself if you'd like.

 

 

 

There is also a really cool print of Jeff's artwork he did for the project which will be signed by Jeff Lafferty and myself. In addition I will sign every package and thank you card as well as hand number each one up to the number of actual figurines created. Say 20 folks claim a perk with a figurine - I will number each one 1/20, 2/20, 3/20 etc.

 

There is also a perk level where you can be a part of the team on the next project and help me direct and produce the figurine and even make some money off of each figurine sold when we launch it here on Indie Gogo if you'd like. You also get to pick the topic of the project and help design the figurine!  

 

YES, you can pledge as many times as you want and receive as many perks as you want. There is no limit to the number of times you can pledge so you can combine the perks you want most and get another one as a great gift idea!

 

- WORLDWIDE SHIPPING INCLUDED ON ALL PERKS -

 

Get the Complete set of figurines perk packaged or unpackaged and save upwards of $55.00

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread the word and link (indiegogo.com/uncharted) for this campaign to your friends, if you don't have the funds to support the project you can still help a ton by just spreading the word and getting more eyes to visit our page. Also, just leaving comments will help our Gogo factor and increase the chances of Indiegogo.com helping us spread the word as well. Hours and hours of work went into making these figurines a reality. Please help anyway you can.

 

- Thank you for your time and for any consideration -

 

 

 Uncharted and Nathan Drake were created by Naughty Dog for Sony and the games are available on PS3

 

This project is not endorsed by or affiliated with Naughty Dog, Sony, or Sony Computer Entertainment. Trademarks are the property of their respective owners. Naughty dog, Sony, Sony Computer entertainment, Uncharted and related properties are trademarks in the United States and/or in other countries of Sony Computer Entertainment and/or its affiliates. Â© 2006-2012 Sony Computer Entertainment or Naughty Dog. All Rights Reserved.

 

Please check the gallery for more pictures and please visit again to keep up with the updates.

Get the Complete set of figurines perk packaged or unpackaged and save upwards of $55.00 
 

 

 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help me spread the word and link (indiegogo.com/uncharted) for this campaign to your friends, if you don't have the funds to support the project you can still help a ton by just spreading the word and getting more eyes to visit our page. Also, just leaving comments will help our Gogo factor and increase the chances of Indiegogo.com helping us spread the word as well. Hours and hours of work went into making these figurines a reality. Please help anyway you can. 
 
- Thank you for your time and for any consideration -
 

 

 Uncharted and Nathan Drake were created by Naughty Dog for Sony and the games are available on PS3
 
This project is not endorsed by or affiliated with Naughty Dog, Sony, or Sony Computer Entertainment. Trademarks are the property of their respective owners. Naughty dog, Sony, Sony Computer entertainment, Uncharted and related properties are trademarks in the United States and/or in other countries of Sony Computer Entertainment and/or its affiliates. Â© 2006-2012 Sony Computer Entertainment or Naughty Dog. All Rights Reserved.
 
Please check the gallery for more pictures and please visit again to keep up with the updates.

story:
Classic Video Game Fun:

Fans of John aka "Gamester81", the host of the website www.gamester81.com, with video game and system reviews, interviews, news, shows, forums and entertaining dialog can now be a part of retro video game history. Join Gamester81 and Joe Cody (Owner of www.Atari2600.com) in supporting the production and release of Gamester81: The Video Game for the ColecoVision video game system.

Now is your opportunity to be a part of a brand new homebrew for the ColecoVision console. Gamester81: The Video Game is a tribute to both the retro video games and arcades of the 1980's, featuring three unique levels, four difficulty settings, special cut scenes and a voice audio sample in the game from Gamester81 himself! 

All domestic shipping is included in the prices.  Additional international shipping rates do apply.  



Exclusive Indiegogo "RED Label" Cart: 


Black Label: 


Why the ColecoVision System?: 

The ColecoVision is a classic retro video game system that came out in 1982 and discontinued in 1984.  Overall over two million ColecoVisions were sold and today the ColecoVision is beloved by many gamers alike.

The ColecoVision was the first system that John Gamester81 played growing up as a kid, so it also has nostalgic significants as well. 

Even if you don't currently own a ColecoVision, this game makes an awesome novelty gaming item for anyone's game collection.  If you don't own a ColecoVision system, now is the reason to go out and buy one too! 

The ColecoVision is also region free, so Gamester81: The Video Game will be compatible on all systems worldwide!

The Game: 

The game is designed by Youki (http://www.atomicfe.com), and tools provided by NewColeco (http://www.ccjvq.com/newcoleco/). Box art created by Coleco Master (www.colecoboxart.com)

Gamester81 gets sucked into the video game world, and it's up to you to get get him out! There are three unique game stages in Gamester81: The Video Game including: 

Monkey Madness: 

Avoid the barrels coming from both sides of the screen by either jumping or ducking under them, but watch out because DK Jr. is dropping bananas from above too. 

 

Invaders Rain: 

Collect the power packs while avoiding the "Invaders" coming from all direction.  You can fire at them, but if you don't do it fast enough, they'll all come after you.  In harder difficulties you have to worry about the gravitational pull, and fire at the bottom that can kill you for good. 

Ghost Zone: 

Collect all of the cherries but watch out for the ghost coming from both directions! 

The Lost Level: 

A Berzerk themed stage was in the initial planning for Gamester81: The Video Game, however it ended up getting replaced by a Space Invaders themed stage later on.  Now is your chance to own a very rare playable version of this lost stage through the only five limited prototype cartridges available. 

The goal in this stage is to collect the coins before the robots get you.  You can fire up to protect yourself, but be careful because the harder the difficulty  the more robots there are!

How you can help: 

Through this campaign there are some great opportunities to pick up exclusive Gamester81: The Video Game swag including posters, polo shirts, bumperstickers, etc.  In addition, any contribution big or small is greatly appreciated and goes towards keeping the great ColecoVision alive with this one of a kind game.  Even if you're unable to help out financially, word of mouth is also greatly appreciated.  Tell a friend and share this campaign with people you know through your social networks. 

Our Goals: 

Our main goal is to release a top-notch video game that is fun to play, has great replay value, and something that you'll be proud to own in your gaming collection.  Both John and Joe have worked extremely hard on this project working with Youki in developing the game and CollectorVision.com in producing the artwork and production of the game. 

Our other goal is to raise at least $5,000 to help in the production cost for the game. 

Stretch Goals: 

If we hit $7,500:

  • Everyone will receive an exclusive never before seen detailed ColecoVision system review by Gamester81 (digital copy of the video).  This review is only viewable for those who back the project on any tier level. 

If we hit $10,000: 

  • Everyone will receive an exclusive detailed ColecoVision system review by Gamester81 (digital copy of the video).  This review is only viewable for those who back the project on any tier level. 
  • Gamester81 will sign all copies of the game sold.  

If we hit $12,500:

  • Everyone will receive an exclusive detailed ColecoVision system review by Gamester81 (digital copy of the video).  This review is only viewable for those who back the project on any tier level. 
  • Gamester81 will sign all copies of the game sold.
  • Everyone on all tier levels will receive a personalized postcard with box art from Gamester81 for free. 

If we hit $20,000: 

  • Everyone will receive an exclusive detailed ColecoVision system review by Gamester81 (digital copy of the video).  This review is only viewable for those who back the project on any tier level. 
  • Gamester81 will sign all copies of the game sold.
  • Everyone on all tier levels will receive a personalized postcard with box art from Gamester81. 
  • Everyone who purchased the game will also receive a free digital copy of the game to play on their computer too!
If we hit $25,000: 

  • Everyone will receive an exclusive detailed ColecoVision system review by Gamester81 (digital copy of the video).  This review is only viewable for those who back the project on any tier level. 
  • Gamester81 will sign all copies of the game sold.
  • Everyone on all tier levels will receive a personalized postcard with box art from Gamester81. 
  • Everyone who purchased the game will also receive a free digital copy of the game to play on their computer too!
  • One lucky winner from all who purchased the game (drawn at random) will win a one of a kind exclusive "Gamester81 ColecoVision" system.  This system and controllers will be red and come complete in box.  


Awesome Exclusive Swag: 

A personalized handwritten postcard to you thanking you for your contribution.  The postcard features the game box art. 

Get an exclusive Gamester81: The Video Game bumper sticker.  A great item to display on your car, in your game room or wherever you want! Only available through this campaign. 

And more...


Who are Joe & John?: 

Joe Cody: Joe Cody is Owner of www.atari2600.com where they sell retro video games and systems worldwide.  Joe over the years has earned a very strong reputation in the retro video game community with his knowledge of pricing and his enthusiasm for retro video games.  

John Lester: John "Gamester81" Lester launched his YouTube channel "Gamester81" back in 2008 posting reviews over retro games and retro consoles.  John is also one of the hosts of the weekly video game podcast All Gen Gamers (www.allgengamers.com). Today John's YouTube channel has nearly 10 million total views and over 63,000+ subscribers.  In November of 2011 John launched www.gamester81.com which is a community video game website focusing both on modern and retro video gaming.
