HBFS-30

"Harder","Better","Faster","Stronger/Silent"  

                                  
Stimulate Finger's Potential
Specifically designed for the FTG Gamer
I build the all new button HBFS-30, and to achieve more than five kinds of  original ideas to help your technology to a new level. More sensitive response. A longer life. Quieter input. Better understanding of your habits, and a new original shape.



HBFS-30 use Cherry MX mechanical Keyswitch. Designed for professional gamers. Unprecedented pleasure by only 45g operations force. Now, the button to keep up with the reaction of your brain.


50 million operations of Cherry MX mechanical micro switch. 10 times the life of the current RG buttons. You can be fierce to operate your weapon, so comfortably and irresponsibly. Become the master of Lightning Kick!!



The new internal parts design,Completely eradicate the ear-piercing noise of keys generated by the beat. The use of high specification vibration damping materials, Japan PORON Microcellular Polymer Sheets. Reduce the noise up to 20 db effectively. Such as the ninja defeat the enemy in silent!!So the wisdom of the choice,was no longer make your family fury!Your sweetheart will be more to love your Stick!

HBFS-30 & OBFS-30 Decibel Test


According to your habits to change the micro switch at any time. Different characters, different game, different strategies, with various characteristics of the different micro switch. Enjoy favorable of the Battle.
The original octagonal design and keycap height adjustment. Promote smooth when Plink, and become the focus of all eyes!
 
HBFS-30 can be installed in any commercially available Arcde Stick case.


Releases your case's internal space ! The HBFS-30 installation depth of just 2cm.Do not have to change the case.

The Adapter socket specifically developed for HBFS-30, No more welding. Change & Fix it yourself! Adapter socket will be easier to install and to replace HBFS-30. It is compatible with existing female terminal. You do not have to change your wiring system. Replace HBFS-30 just like replace a new OBSF-30.


Light up your Arcade Stick case! HBFS-30 already have the LED holes.You can attach LED lighting in HBFS-30.
 
I believe HBFS-30 make you excited.
Now the HBFS-30 has developed and made using in, which shows its well function and stable performance. Now, we are raising amount of funding for HBFS-30's production plan.

To thank you for your full support and funding, we will provide you the highest priority and the most favorable commodity pre-order in accordance with the amount of your funding. When the  funding plan is completed you will be the first to get our first batch of production HBFS-30.

story:
Some of you may already know Dave Ingram, some of you may only just be getting to know him thanks to the Glypher app (http://goo.gl/YRQ0nO) that he made to help Ingress players practice the mini-glyph game outside of the Ingress Scanner. Dave is a hard worker and a terrific programmer that is always looking for ways to make our lives a little bit easier.

Dave is also very unselfish, and as such has decided to not only keep Glypher free of charge, but has also promised to never put advertisements in the app as well. Well I, and many others, think he deserves recognition for his amazing work. 

The Glypher app has now been downloaded more than 10,000 times, has more than 2500 +1s, and more than 750 reviews. If you've been following the app from the beginning you also know that he listens to feedback and updates the app extremely quickly, and will never stop until it is perfect.

So if you've been looking for a way to recognize Dave for this amazing app, this is the place. I would like to raise $1600 for Dave to buy him something that he has been wanting for a long time - a Google Glass. (The Glass is $1500, plus shipping, plus covering the IndieGoGo fee.)

Donate any amount you would like. Even if we just had 1600 agents "pay" $0.99 for the app it would cover the cost of the Google Glass. If you think it's awesome enough to warrant $5, $10, $20, or even more, then that would be awesome as well.

Just think, with so many downloads and the fact that we all play this practice app for hours on end, Dave could likely make way more than $1,600 with this app, but he has chosen not to, because that would be annoying, and he should be recognized for that.

Spread the word, share the link, you can direct people to http://igg.me/at/glypher to get to this page!

story:
Come on down! You're ________!

GOING TO HELP CHARITY AND GET A GAME BY SUPPORTING THIS CAMPAIGN: As an incentive to donate to the fourth annual "24-Hour Game Show Marathon" which benefits Child's Play, I've assembled 2 unofficial CAH expansions of cards that will humor fans of game shows, from the casual to the hardcore.

One "Contestants Answering Hosts" deck will contain 54 total cards (14 prompts and 40 responses) inspired by US game shows and reality shows; the other deck of 18 cards (5 prompts and 13 responses) are about UK game shows.

Warning: Some prompts within each deck have the same level of crudeness as the original CAH game!


4 cards from the US version.


Big Bucks, no ________!

FINANCIAL GAIN: I want all profits earned during this Campaign to benefit the charity/marathon.

I have carefully calculated the cost to produce each deck and added approximate shipping costs in order to fulfill all orders so that there will still be a nice chunk of money on each claimed Perk to donate to the charity after the Campaign is completed.

Each deck sold (according to current estimates) will create a donation of approximately $2.

In summary, all funds that remain after producing and shipping the decks will be donated to Child's Play.


I'd like to buy ________.

AN EXPANSION: Awesome! Check the sidebar for the breakdown on the costs for each deck. If you want both decks, there's a special option that will save your wallet a little money.

Please add a minimum of $4 to your selected Perk for a shipping address outside the United States.


3 cards from the UK version.


Deal...or ________?

JUST SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH OTHERS: Even if you cannot donate to this Campaign, consider supporting the "24-Hour Game Show Marathon" by watching it live, starting at Noon on Saturday, June 6.

Thanks for your time!

story:
Click here for the English version


Unsere Leidenschaft!

Wir sind begeisterte Kartenspieler! Die Lust auf ein gutes Kartenspiel kann uns jederzeit und überall heimsuchen -  am Abend nach einem stressigen Tag, am Morgen auf dem Weg zur Arbeit oder während einer öden Mittagspause. Ob Skat, Rommé, Doppelkopf oder Canasta - wir mögen Kartenspiele, die unsere Gehirnzellen kitzeln, weniger solche bei denen nur Glück und Zufall über den Spielverlauf entscheiden. Wir wollen in einer angenehmen und freundlichen Spielumgebung spielen, nicht in dunklen Zockerhöhlen und wir wollen unsere Begeisterung mit vielen anderen teilen.

Warum also ProGames?

Viele von uns haben einen vollgestopften Alltag inklusive eines stressigen Jobs, familiärer Verpflichtungen und zahlreicher Termine -  da wird die Organisation eines netten Spieleabends mit Freunden schnell zur Herausforderung. Ist das Leben hingegen ‚ein langer ruhiger Fluss‘ und man haust eher abgeschieden, fehlen einem meist die netten Leute, mit denen man sich spontan auf ein gutes Blatt verabreden kann.

Die gute Nachricht

Es gibt jede Menge Gleichgesinnte da draußen. Sie mögen sich zwar nicht unbedingt in deiner Nachbarschaft, deinem Land, nicht mal auf deinem Kontinent oder in deiner Zeitzone befinden, aber sie haben mindestens zwei wichtige Dinge mit dir gemein: Sie wollen vielleicht zur selben Zeit Karten spielen wie Du, egal wo sie sich gerade aufhalten und sie haben ein Gerät zur Verfügung, auf dem sie online spielen können.

Es gibt allerdings noch immer keinen Ort im Web, wo all diese Leute zusammenkommen können um mit- und gegeneinander Karten zu spielen, denn bisher ist es immer noch nicht möglich, auf unterschiedlichen Geräten und Plattformen  online miteinander Karten zu spielen.

Die Lösung!

Mit ProGames schaffen wir einen Ort für Strategie-Kartenspiele im Web. ProGames kann von allen mobilen und stationären Geräten, auf allen browserfähigen Betriebssystem genutzt werden. So ist es möglich, dass ein Spieler in der kanadischen Wildnis mit seinem iPhone mit einer Spielerin aus Köln, die ein Android Tablet benutzt, und einem Spieler, der zuhause auf der Hallig Hooge am PC sitzt, gemeinsam ein paar Runden Skat kloppen. ProGames wird mit Skat und Rommé starten, gefolgt von Canasta und Doppelkopf. Nach und nach werden weitere beliebte europäische und international erfolgreiche Strategie-Kartenspiele wie Bridge (England), Belote (Frankreich), Chinchón (Spanien) und Briscola (Italien) folgen.

Alle ProGames Kartenspiele sind kostenlos erhältlich - im Web und als App in iTunes, Google Play, im Windows Store und auf Facebook. Du kannst entweder im ‚free-2-play‘ (ohne Geld) oder im ‚play-4-money‘ (um Geld) Modus spielen. Im ‚play-4-money‘ Modus wird um kleine Geldbeträge gespielt -  für uns stehen jedoch das Kartenspiel und der spielerische Wettstreit  im Mittelpunkt - wir wollen unsere Spieler nicht dazu zu animieren, Haus und Hof zu verzocken!

Wofür wir das Kampagnen-Geld einsetzen

ProGames ist bereits zu  70% von uns finanziert - um das Projekt erfolgreich an den Start zu bringen, benötigen wir weitere €30.000. Deine Spende soll uns dabei helfen,  einen Teil der Entwicklungskosten und erste Marketing Aktivitäten zu finanzieren. ProGames wird im April 2015 an den Start gehen.

Das Projekt

Der Grundstein für unser ProGames Projekt wurde 2009 gelegt. Damals haben wir zwei Kartenspiele-Apps für das iPhone entwickelt: ProSkat and ProRommé.

Der große Erfolg dieser Apps und die daraus hervorgegangene Gemeinschaft von Spielern haben uns ermutigt, die Spielmöglichkeiten auszubauen und zu erweitern.

Das Wichtigste im Überblick:

  • ProGames ist kostenlos und alle Kartenspiele können um Punkte und Ranglistenplätze gespielt werden. Die Kosten für Aktualisierungen, Kundenbetreuung und den täglichen Betrieb von ProGames werden durch den seriösen und sicheren ‚play-4-money‘ Bereich finanziert, wo  Spieler rundenbasierte Kartenspiele für kleine Geldbeträge spielen können.
  • ProGames ist kein Ort für Glücksspieler und Zocker. Wir legen sehr viel Wert auf eine freundliche und sichere Spielumgebung, in der man sich wohlfühlen und auf das Kartenspiel konzentrieren kann. Wir ermutigen unsere Spieler, den kostenlosen ‚free-2-play‘ Bereich zu besuchen und ausgiebig zu nutzen.
  • Alle auf ProGames verfügbaren Kartenspiele können auf iOS, Android, Win/MAC und Facebook miteinander gespielt werden. Spieler können dazu mobile Geräte wie Smartphones, Tablets, Laptops oder auch einen stationären Computer nutzen. Einzige Voraussetzung ist eine funktionierende Internetverbindung.
  • Für uns stehen beliebte, strategische  Kartenspiele im Mittelpunkt - unser Fokus liegt auf dem Gameplay und dem spielerischen Wettstreit. 


Beispiel - ProGames im Web - HomePage - (under construction)


Beispiel - ProRommé - Auswahl Spielmodus  (in Arbeit)

               


Beispiel - ProRommé - Spieltisch (in Arbeit)

               


Play-4-Money

Das Spielen um kleine Geldbeträge ist auf ProGames sehr einfach geregelt. Jeder Spieler erhält für die Einzahlung seiner Spieleinsätze bzw. die Ausschüttung des Preisgeldes ein individuelles Konto. Der Zahlungsverkehr wird von einem international zertifizierten und seriösen Payment Provider abgewickelt. Der Gewinner einer Spielrunde erhält sein Preisgeld sehr schnell ausgezahlt - in der Regel innerhalb eines Werktages.

Beispiel ProSkat - Play-4-Money - Regelsets wählen (in Arbeit)

                 


Beispiel ProSkat - Spieltisch  mit zuletzt gespieltem Stich (in Arbeit)

                 


Die Technologie

Die Technologie, die wir einsetzen, ist durch eine hohe Performance, ständige Verfügbarkeit und durch dauerhaft stabile Verbindungen gekennzeichnet. Das liegt im Wesentlichen daran, dass nur geringe Daten zwischen den Spielern und den Servern ausgetauscht werden müssen. ProGames nutzt und verbindet die Vorteile der neuesten App- und Web Technologien.

Unsere höchste Priorität ist Eure Sicherheit. Daher arbeiten wir mit einem Hosting Provider zusammen, der von der BaFin (Bundesanstalt für Finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht) zertifiziert ist und einer ständigen Überwachung unterliegt. Ein höheres Maß an Sicherheit ist nicht zu bieten.

Respekt, Vertrauen und Anonymität!

ProGames respektiert und garantiert Dir die absolute Geheimhaltung aller persönlichen Daten. Wir halten die Spielerdaten und die Daten für den Zahlungsverkehr in getrennten Datenbanken. ProGames verpflichtet sich außerdem, Daten nicht an Dritte weiterzugeben oder zu veräußern!

Personenbezogene Daten werden nur dort erhoben, wo diese für den reibungslosen Ablauf, die Teilnahme an unseren Kartenspielen oder die Ein- bzw. Auszahlungen von Geldbeträgen nötig sind.

Für uns steht die Zufriedenheit der ProGames Nutzer im Vordergrund - wir wollen, dass sich die Spieler bei uns wohl fühlen und gerne wiederkommen. Wir geben uns sehr viel Mühe damit, eine nutzerfreundliche Umgebung mit tollen und einfach zu bedienenden Spielen in einem schönen und schlichten Design bereitzustellen. 

Wir suchen den direkten Kontakt mit unseren Usern - für uns sind Support Anfragen, Verbesserungsvorschläge, aber auch Kritik sehr wichtig, da sie uns helfen, unser Angebot stetig zu erweitern und zu verbessern. Wir versuchen alle Anfragen umgehend, spätestens aber innerhalb von 24 Stunden zu beantworten. 

                                                          

- beliebte Strategiekartenspiele -
- userfreundliche, angenehme Spielumgebung -
- spielen egal wann, egal wo und egal auf welchem Gerät -
- free-2-play und play-4-money Spielmodi -


Übersicht der Perks

(Zahlungen per PayPal ODER  per Kreditkarte im PayPal Gastzugang möglich)

10 € Perk - Mächtiges "DANKESCHÖN" 

>> Persönliche Würdigung in der ProGames "Hall of Game"

25 € Perk - Bronze Sponsor

>> Bronze-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint

50 € Perk - Silber Sponsor

>> Silber-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 5 € ProGames Spielgutschein

100 € Perk - Gold Sponsor

>> Gold-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 10 € ProGames Spielgutschein + ProGames T-Shirt

200 € Perk - Platin Sponsor

>> Platin-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 20 € ProGames Spielgutschein + ProGames T-Shirt + hochwertiges ProGames Kartenblatt deiner Wahl

500 € Perk - Diamant Sponsor

>> Diamant-Sponsor Kennzeichnung in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 30 € ProGames Spielgutschein + hochwertiges ProGames Kartenblatt deiner Wahl + einen ProGames Hoodie 


                         

 

                                                       

                 

                                         


Bitte unterstütze uns mit Deiner Spende!


Vielen Dank!



ENGLISH VERSION


What do we want?

We love to play cards! Playing in the evening after a busy day, on our way to work or just a few minutes during lunch break. No matter if Rummy, Canasta, Skat or Doppelkopf - we love card games which are easy to access and tickle our brains. We love a pleasant and playful gaming atmosphere - no gambling dungeons. And we love to play with friends and other people who share our enthusiasm.

So why ProGames?

Most of us live a strenuous daily routine. A simple matter such as organizing a cheerful gaming event with friends can be quite a challenging thing to do. Or our life might be a long and quiet river - but then we most certainly live somewhere in the countryside where no one is around to join us and share our spontaneous idea of playing cards.

Here’s the good news: there are a lot of players out there - they might not live next door, nor in the neighborhood, nor share the same time zone  - but they have some important things in common with us: they love to play card games, they want to play no matter when and where and they want to play on whatever device.  

As of today there is no such place where all these people can join up and play.

With ProGames we are creating a cross-platform and multi-device card gaming location where most favored skill card games can be played at any time by you and your friends. First we will launch ProGames featuring four traditional card games such as Rummy, Canasta, Skat and Doppelkopf and as a second step the collection will expand to other popular skill card games such as Bridge, Belote, Chinchón and Briscola. 

All our card games will be available for free on the Web,  on iTunes, GooglePlay,  in Windows Store and on Facebook. Players can choose between a ‚free-2-play’ and a ‚play-4-money’ mode. The ‚play-4-money’ mode invites users to play for small amounts of money -  at ProGames, our focus is on playing cards and the fun of competition - we do not intend to waste our players’ savings!

The Budget

70% of the total development budget for ProGames is financed already and covered by us.  In order to successfully bring the project into the market, we need another €30.000. Your support will allow us to finalize the development and programming and enable us to cover initial marketing expenses.

The scheduled launch date of ProGames is April 2015.

The Project

The roots of ProGames were sowed in late 2009 when we published two iOS Apps: ProSkat and ProRummy. The existing community of players and the sustaining success of these two Apps encouraged us to expand to more platforms and to develop more games. 

ProGames at a glance

  • ProGames card games can be played cross-platform on iOS, Android, Win/MAC and Facebook 
  • ProGames card games can be played on any device that has an internet connection such as smartphones, tablets, computers and laptops. 
  • ProGames' focus  is on the card games and the fun of playing.
  • ProGames applications are for free. But of course we need to make some money to run ProGames, make progress in development, provide updates and customers services. That’s why a safe and serious ‚play-4-money‘ area will be available - where you can play turn-based games for small amounts of money. 
  • ProGames provides a cheerful and safe atmosphere where players feel comfortable and enjoy playing cards 
  • ProGames is not a place for gamblers or cheaters.

ProGames Homepage (under construction)


ProGames - ProRummy - Select Play Mode (under construction)


ProGames - ProRummy - Table  (under construction)

  


The Technology

ProGames provides multi-device and cross-platform gaming - for example: you can play on your iOS smartphone with somebody using an Android tablet and another one using a windows laptop!  

The gaming technology supplies high performance and a solid connectivity. This is possible because  only little data is exchanged between players and game servers. ProGames combines the advantages of App technology with Web technology using state of the art engineering. 

The extraordinary high level of security is granted by our certified BaFin hosting provider (governmental institution that rules and supervises banks and financial markets in Germany according to European standards).

Play-4-money

Playing-4-money is very easy on ProGames. We will provide an individual, free account served by a legitimate, certified international payment provider which players use to transfer their stakes and cash-out their prize-money within a day! 

ProGames - ProSkat - Play-4-Money - Rule sets  (under construction)

               



ProGames - ProSkat- Play Table - Last Trick  (under construction)

 


Respect!

ProGames respects the anonymity of individual data. Our priority is your security. We will not provide personal data to any other third party! We will only raise individual data at a minimum necessary limit that we need for playing and payment. We will make sure that personal data is always kept anonymous!

ProGames' focus lays on our customers. Our Apps are 'easy-2-use' and have an appealing design. We care about our users’ feed-back, demands and comments and we guarantee that all requests are responded to within a day. We value players’ feed-back very much – as it is our most important asset– and we will base regular improvements, updates and extensions on them.


- most popular skill card games -

- playable whenever, wherever and on any device -

- pleasant and userfriendly gaming experience -

- free2play and play4money mode -


Overview of Perks

(You can effect payments through PayPal OR as PayPal guest!)

10 € Perk - Big "THANKS!" Hug

>> Personal appreciation in ProGames "Hall of Game"

25 € Perk - Bronze Sponsorship

>> Bronze sponsorship crown in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay

50 € Perk - Silver Sponsorship

>> Silver sponsorship crown  in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay + 5 € ProGames voucher

100 € Perk - Gold Sponsorship

>> Gold sponsorship crown in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay + 10 € ProGames Voucher + ProGames T-Shirt.

200 € Perk - Platin Sponsorship

>>Platin sponsorship crown in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay + 20 € ProGames voucher + ProGames T-Shirt + high quality ProGames deck of playing cards

story_txt:
Click here for the English version

Unsere Leidenschaft!
Wir sind begeisterte Kartenspieler! Die Lust auf ein gutes Kartenspiel kann uns jederzeit und überall heimsuchen -  am Abend nach einem stressigen Tag, am Morgen auf dem Weg zur Arbeit oder während einer öden Mittagspause. Ob Skat, Rommé, Doppelkopf oder Canasta - wir mögen Kartenspiele, die unsere Gehirnzellen kitzeln, weniger solche bei denen nur Glück und Zufall über den Spielverlauf entscheiden. Wir wollen in einer angenehmen und freundlichen Spielumgebung spielen, nicht in dunklen Zockerhöhlen und wir wollen unsere Begeisterung mit vielen anderen teilen.Warum also ProGames?Viele von uns haben einen vollgestopften Alltag inklusive eines stressigen Jobs, familiärer Verpflichtungen und zahlreicher Termine -  da wird die Organisation eines netten Spieleabends mit Freunden schnell zur Herausforderung. Ist das Leben hingegen ‚ein langer ruhiger Fluss‘ und man haust eher abgeschieden, fehlen einem meist die netten Leute, mit denen man sich spontan auf ein gutes Blatt verabreden kann.Die gute NachrichtEs gibt jede Menge Gleichgesinnte da draußen. Sie mögen sich zwar nicht unbedingt in deiner Nachbarschaft, deinem Land, nicht mal auf deinem Kontinent oder in deiner Zeitzone befinden, aber sie haben mindestens zwei wichtige Dinge mit dir gemein: Sie wollen vielleicht zur selben Zeit Karten spielen wie Du, egal wo sie sich gerade aufhalten und sie haben ein Gerät zur Verfügung, auf dem sie online spielen können.Es gibt allerdings noch immer keinen Ort im Web, wo all diese Leute zusammenkommen können um mit- und gegeneinander Karten zu spielen, denn bisher ist es immer noch nicht möglich, auf unterschiedlichen Geräten und Plattformen  online miteinander Karten zu spielen.
Die Lösung!
Mit ProGames schaffen wir einen Ort für Strategie-Kartenspiele im Web. ProGames kann von allen mobilen und stationären Geräten, auf allen browserfähigen Betriebssystem genutzt werden. So ist es möglich, dass ein Spieler in der kanadischen Wildnis mit seinem iPhone mit einer Spielerin aus Köln, die ein Android Tablet benutzt, und einem Spieler, der zuhause auf der Hallig Hooge am PC sitzt, gemeinsam ein paar Runden Skat kloppen. ProGames wird mit Skat und Rommé starten, gefolgt von Canasta und Doppelkopf. Nach und nach werden weitere beliebte europäische und international erfolgreiche Strategie-Kartenspiele wie Bridge (England), Belote (Frankreich), Chinchón (Spanien) und Briscola (Italien) folgen.Alle ProGames Kartenspiele sind kostenlos erhältlich - im Web und als App in iTunes, Google Play, im Windows Store und auf Facebook. Du kannst entweder im ‚free-2-play‘ (ohne Geld) oder im ‚play-4-money‘ (um Geld) Modus spielen. Im ‚play-4-money‘ Modus wird um kleine Geldbeträge gespielt -  für uns stehen jedoch das Kartenspiel und der spielerische Wettstreit  im Mittelpunkt - wir wollen unsere Spieler nicht dazu zu animieren, Haus und Hof zu verzocken!Wofür wir das Kampagnen-Geld einsetzenProGames ist bereits zu  70% von uns finanziert - um das Projekt erfolgreich an den Start zu bringen, benötigen wir weitere €30.000. Deine Spende soll uns dabei helfen,  einen Teil der Entwicklungskosten und erste Marketing Aktivitäten zu finanzieren. ProGames wird im April 2015 an den Start gehen.Das ProjektDer Grundstein für unser ProGames Projekt wurde 2009 gelegt. Damals haben wir zwei Kartenspiele-Apps für das iPhone entwickelt: ProSkat and ProRommé.Der große Erfolg dieser Apps und die daraus hervorgegangene Gemeinschaft von Spielern haben uns ermutigt, die Spielmöglichkeiten auszubauen und zu erweitern.Das Wichtigste im Überblick:



ProGames ist kostenlos und alle Kartenspiele können um Punkte und
Ranglistenplätze gespielt werden. Die Kosten für Aktualisierungen,
Kundenbetreuung und den täglichen Betrieb von ProGames werden durch den
seriösen und sicheren ‚play-4-money‘ Bereich finanziert, wo  Spieler
rundenbasierte Kartenspiele für kleine Geldbeträge spielen können.


ProGames ist kein Ort für Glücksspieler und Zocker. Wir legen sehr viel
Wert auf eine freundliche und sichere Spielumgebung, in der man sich wohlfühlen
und auf das Kartenspiel konzentrieren kann. Wir ermutigen unsere Spieler, den
kostenlosen ‚free-2-play‘ Bereich zu besuchen und ausgiebig zu nutzen.


Alle auf ProGames verfügbaren Kartenspiele können auf iOS, Android, Win/MAC
und Facebook miteinander gespielt werden. Spieler können dazu mobile Geräte wie
Smartphones, Tablets, Laptops oder auch einen stationären Computer nutzen.
Einzige Voraussetzung ist eine funktionierende Internetverbindung.


Für uns stehen beliebte, strategische  Kartenspiele im Mittelpunkt -
unser Fokus liegt auf dem Gameplay und dem spielerischen Wettstreit. 





Beispiel - ProGames im Web - HomePage - (under construction)
Beispiel - ProRommé - Auswahl Spielmodus  (in Arbeit)               
Beispiel - ProRommé - Spieltisch (in Arbeit)
               Play-4-MoneyDas Spielen um kleine Geldbeträge ist auf ProGames sehr einfach geregelt. Jeder Spieler erhält für die Einzahlung seiner Spieleinsätze bzw. die Ausschüttung des Preisgeldes ein individuelles Konto. Der Zahlungsverkehr wird von einem international zertifizierten und seriösen Payment Provider abgewickelt. Der Gewinner einer Spielrunde erhält sein Preisgeld sehr schnell ausgezahlt - in der Regel innerhalb eines Werktages.Beispiel ProSkat - Play-4-Money - Regelsets wählen (in Arbeit)
                 
Beispiel ProSkat - Spieltisch  mit zuletzt gespieltem Stich (in Arbeit)                 Die TechnologieDie Technologie, die wir einsetzen, ist durch eine hohe Performance, ständige Verfügbarkeit und durch dauerhaft stabile Verbindungen gekennzeichnet. Das liegt im Wesentlichen daran, dass nur geringe Daten zwischen den Spielern und den Servern ausgetauscht werden müssen. ProGames nutzt und verbindet die Vorteile der neuesten App- und Web Technologien.Unsere höchste Priorität ist Eure Sicherheit. Daher arbeiten wir mit einem Hosting Provider zusammen, der von der BaFin (Bundesanstalt für Finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht) zertifiziert ist und einer ständigen Überwachung unterliegt. Ein höheres Maß an Sicherheit ist nicht zu bieten.
Respekt, Vertrauen und Anonymität!
ProGames respektiert und garantiert Dir die absolute Geheimhaltung aller persönlichen Daten. Wir halten die Spielerdaten und die Daten für den Zahlungsverkehr in getrennten Datenbanken. ProGames verpflichtet sich außerdem, Daten nicht an Dritte weiterzugeben oder zu veräußern!Personenbezogene Daten werden nur dort erhoben, wo diese für den reibungslosen Ablauf, die Teilnahme an unseren Kartenspielen oder die Ein- bzw. Auszahlungen von Geldbeträgen nötig sind.Für uns steht die Zufriedenheit der ProGames Nutzer im Vordergrund - wir wollen, dass sich die Spieler bei uns wohl fühlen und gerne wiederkommen. Wir geben uns sehr viel Mühe damit, eine nutzerfreundliche Umgebung mit tollen und einfach zu bedienenden Spielen in einem schönen und schlichten Design bereitzustellen. Wir suchen den direkten Kontakt mit unseren Usern - für uns sind Support Anfragen, Verbesserungsvorschläge, aber auch Kritik sehr wichtig, da sie uns helfen, unser Angebot stetig zu erweitern und zu verbessern. Wir versuchen alle Anfragen umgehend, spätestens aber innerhalb von 24 Stunden zu beantworten.                                                           - beliebte Strategiekartenspiele -- userfreundliche, angenehme Spielumgebung -- spielen egal wann, egal wo und egal auf welchem Gerät -- free-2-play und play-4-money Spielmodi -Übersicht der Perks(Zahlungen per PayPal ODER  per Kreditkarte im PayPal Gastzugang möglich)10 € Perk - Mächtiges "DANKESCHÖN" >> Persönliche Würdigung in der ProGames "Hall of Game"25 € Perk - Bronze Sponsor>> Bronze-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint50 € Perk - Silber Sponsor>> Silber-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 5 € ProGames Spielgutschein100 € Perk - Gold Sponsor>> Gold-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 10 € ProGames Spielgutschein + ProGames T-Shirt200 € Perk - Platin Sponsor>> Platin-Sponsoren-Krone in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 20 € ProGames Spielgutschein + ProGames T-Shirt + hochwertiges ProGames Kartenblatt deiner Wahl500 € Perk - Diamant Sponsor>> Diamant-Sponsor Kennzeichnung in unserer "Hall of Game" und überall im Spiel, wo dein Name erscheint + 30 € ProGames Spielgutschein + hochwertiges ProGames Kartenblatt deiner Wahl + einen ProGames Hoodie 
                         
                                                                                                                  Bitte unterstütze uns mit Deiner Spende!Vielen Dank!ENGLISH VERSIONWhat do we want?

We love to play cards! Playing in the evening after a busy day, on our way to work or just a few minutes during lunch break. No matter if Rummy, Canasta, Skat or Doppelkopf - we love card games which are easy to access and tickle our brains. We love a pleasant and playful gaming atmosphere - no gambling dungeons. And we love to play with friends and other people who share our enthusiasm.
So why ProGames?
Most of us live a strenuous daily routine. A simple
matter such as organizing a cheerful gaming event with friends can be quite a
challenging thing to do. Or our life might be a long and quiet river - but
then we most certainly live somewhere in the countryside where no one is
around to join us and share our spontaneous idea of playing cards.
Here’s the good news: there are a lot of players out there
- they might not live next door, nor in the neighborhood, nor share
the same time zone  - but they have some important things in
common with us: they love to play card games, they want to play no matter when and where and
they want to play on whatever device.  

As of today there is no such place where all these people can join up and play.
With ProGames we are creating a cross-platform and multi-device card gaming location where most favored skill card games can be played at any time by you and your friends. First we will launch ProGames featuring four traditional card games such as Rummy, Canasta, Skat and Doppelkopf and as a second step the collection will expand to other popular skill card games such as Bridge, Belote, Chinchón and Briscola. 
All our card games will be available for free on the Web,  on iTunes, GooglePlay,  in Windows Store and on Facebook. Players can choose between a ‚free-2-play’ and a ‚play-4-money’ mode. The ‚play-4-money’ mode invites users to play for small amounts of money -  at ProGames, our focus is on playing cards and the fun of competition - we do not intend to waste our players’ savings!The Budget70% of the total development budget for ProGames is financed already and covered by us.  In order to successfully bring the project into the market, we need another €30.000. Your support will allow us to finalize the development and programming and enable us to cover initial marketing expenses.The scheduled launch date of ProGames is April 2015.The Project

The roots of ProGames were sowed in late 2009 when we published two iOS Apps: ProSkat and ProRummy. The existing community of players and the sustaining success of these two Apps encouraged us to expand to more platforms and to develop more games. ProGames at a glance

ProGames card games can be played cross-platform on iOS, Android, Win/MAC and Facebook 

ProGames card games can be played on any device that has an internet connection such as smartphones, tablets, computers and laptops. 


ProGames' focus  is on the card games and the fun of playing.


ProGames applications are for free. But of course we need to make some money to run ProGames, make progress in development, provide updates and customers services. That’s why a safe and serious ‚play-4-money‘ area will be available - where you can play turn-based games for small amounts of money. 

ProGames provides a cheerful and safe atmosphere where players feel comfortable and enjoy playing cards 

ProGames is not a place for gamblers or cheaters.


ProGames Homepage (under construction)
ProGames - ProRummy - Select Play Mode (under construction)ProGames - ProRummy - Table  (under construction)  The
Technology
ProGames provides multi-device and cross-platform gaming - for example: you can play on your iOS smartphone with somebody using an Android tablet and another one using a windows laptop!  The gaming technology supplies high performance and a solid connectivity. This is possible because  only little data is exchanged between players and game servers. ProGames combines the advantages of App technology with Web technology using state of the art engineering. 
The
extraordinary high level of security is granted by our certified BaFin hosting provider (governmental institution
that rules and supervises banks and financial markets in Germany according to European
standards). 
Play-4-money

Playing-4-money is very easy on ProGames. We will provide an individual, free account served by a legitimate, certified international payment provider which players use to transfer their stakes and cash-out their prize-money within a day! ProGames - ProSkat - Play-4-Money - Rule sets  (under construction)               ProGames - ProSkat- Play Table - Last Trick  (under construction) Respect!

ProGames respects the anonymity of individual data. Our priority is your security. We will not provide personal data to any other third party! We will only raise individual data at a minimum necessary limit that we need for playing and payment. We will make sure that personal data is always kept anonymous!
ProGames' focus lays on our customers. Our Apps are 'easy-2-use' and have an appealing design. We care about our users’ feed-back, demands and comments and we guarantee that all requests are responded to within a day. We value players’ feed-back very much – as it is our most important asset– and we will base regular improvements, updates and extensions on them.
- most popular skill card games -
- playable whenever, wherever and on any device -- pleasant and userfriendly gaming experience -- free2play and play4money mode -Overview of Perks(You can effect payments through PayPal OR as PayPal guest!)10 € Perk - Big "THANKS!" Hug>> Personal appreciation in ProGames "Hall of Game"25 € Perk - Bronze Sponsorship>> Bronze sponsorship crown in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay50 € Perk - Silver Sponsorship>> Silver sponsorship crown  in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay + 5 € ProGames voucher100 € Perk - Gold Sponsorship>> Gold sponsorship crown in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay + 10 € ProGames Voucher + ProGames T-Shirt.200 € Perk - Platin Sponsorship>>Platin sponsorship crown in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay + 20 € ProGames voucher + ProGames T-Shirt + high quality ProGames deck of playing cards 500 € Perk - Diamond Sponsorship>> Diamond sponsorship label in our "Hall of Game" and during gameplay  + 30 € ProGames voucher + high quality ProGames deck of playing cards + ProGames hoodie                                                                                                               
Please support us and donate.

Thank You!

story:
Short Summary

Where can you take your family that's fun, cheap and family friendly?  Do these places still exist?  I am building a family leisure centre, much like the old "Downtown" or "Magic Mountain".  Something I am so passionate about, that it will happen...

My name is Danny and I am the creator of GameRoom Essentials.

GameRoom Essentials is a safe place for families to meet and enjoy many different activities.  Pinball, arcade games, 8-ball and more. We opened in August last year and have been expanding gradually, room by room, and now have around 100 machines.  But unlike other gaming arcades, we do not charge per game but by the hour.  This way you know your spend and budget, and our prices are lower than any other similar business.

Currently setting up LAN gaming which will be opening soon.  Classics like Empire Earth 2, Age of Mythology and Farcry are just a few of the classic games we have on offer. 


Another room will be dedicated to table games like War Hammer 40k, Magic: the Gathering and Yu-Gi-Oh! This is happening as we speak.


In the next stage, I'm going to need financial help due to the costs involved. Mini-golf (putt putt) in a theme based on arcade games or pinball machines will give a new twist.  Space Invaders, Pac-man and 1942 will join The Addams Family, Attack from Mars and KISS in a mini-golf game, with each hole a different theme.


The second part of this expansion will be building a stage and sound system to host live bands in a family environment.  A number of people from local bands have said it's hard to find venues to play without a resume.  And hard to build a resume when no one will let you play.  We will be offering local bands a chance to get out there, a chance to get known, to feed the people with the music they want to hear.  All in a family environment.


What We Need & What You Get

The costs for the mini-golf is expected to be around $9,000 or $500 per hole.  The stage and sound system approx $15,000-$20,000.  All money raised for this expansion, will go on this expansion.  Any extra will also be invested into more holes, better lighting and more speakers.

We have many perks to choose from and a number of them can be used straight away.

  • Want to choose a mini-golf hole theme? An information plate on each hole will include the name of the person who suggested the theme.
  • Want to be the first band to play to an audience at GameRoom Essentials?With a big opening day planned, it will be great exposure to a new and upcomming band.
  • Private party, bucks night, corporate event? Invite up to 80 people to play pinball and arcade.  You will be the talk of the town.
  • How about an annual pass to every lock-in gaming session on Thursday and Saturday nights?

If we do not reach our goal, then the expansion will still go ahead. It will just take us a little longer to get there.

Our success story...

From our initial move-in back in July 2013, we have grown from 2 pinball and 4 arcade machines to over 100 machines.  We run a canteen with reasonably priced food, book the venue out for private parties, and host events.  Two such events are our "Annual TILT Tournament" and also pinball tournaments for the Australian Pinball League who are sponsored by AMD and TimeZone.


The reason that the venue has grown so big in such a short time, is from all money made going back into the venue.  It is a family owned business run by the family and friends who volunteer their time.  Most of the machines are for sale and owned by others.  We make no commission on the sales of the machines, but we can use them for lock-ins and private bookings/events.  We sell 2 to 3 machines per week, and word has got out about our sales success rate, so more machines arrive for sale.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our biggest asset is our devoted customers.  Without them, GameRoom Essentials would not exist.  We see the same people come back again and again, and they are spreading the word about us.  Every week we see new faces, mostly hearing about us from their friends.  We can't afford advertising, so we rely on word of mouth, and people sharing our posts on facebook.

If you can't help financially, then please let others know. We will be here when you are ready to join us.  You don't want your friends to miss out on all the fun.

Please like our facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/GameRoomEssentials

Also visit our website:

http://www.gameroom.com.au/

and don't forget to share our indiegogo page:

story:
I have been creating apps for non profit websites using an App creating tool called Andromo. I have been using their service with the starter package (paid for myself) but they onyl allow 50 apps to be made, and i've made all 50 apps. They have another package called the Professional package and that allows for unlimited apps, along with a few cool additional features.

http://andromo.com/pricing

The package is $21/Month and is billed annually upfront. $21 * 12 months = 252 which is what I need to continue helping people get an app for their cause. I only need 252 but the indigogo minimum is 500. So i'll use the total to pay for 2 years of the Professional package.

Some of these cool features that included with the Professional package include:

- Unlimited apps

- Option for no ads

- Option to change the about screen (Usually shows the andromo logo) to show a message that I offer free apps for non profits

- Priority building (My apps are built faster and dont have to wait for other apps to get built)

Anyways, I am excited to continue building apps with your help. Anyone who decides to help will get a free app built for their website (must be family friendly).

Thanks for your time everyone

story:
What is Minecraft Blueprint?

Minecraft Blueprint is a upcoming website based off www.minedraft.net. This website plans to improve the existing websites and programs out there to make mock up designs of your creations.

Why Re-Invent Something already out there?

After using a few similar websites and programs out there I have found areas that lack in functionality and that are not easy on the eye. I aim to fix this.

What will be different about Minecraft Blueprint?

Minecraft Blueprint will be built from the ground up and be a web based application within the Minecraft Blueprint website (to be announced). With this application being build from scratch means I can add nearly any features I can think of, including suggestions from you the PMC community.

What are some Features Minecraft BluePrints will offer?

- Save your Blueprint as a jpg or png file to your computer
- Save Projects for Later editing
- Share your Blueprint creations with an online community
- Make your Blueprint with Popular Texture Packs (eventually able to upload your own)
- Multiple Views
- Smooth User Interface
- Almost Unlimited Blueprint work area
- 16x16, 32x32 and 64x64 views of ALL Minecraft blocks
- Mob Icons for mob trap planning
- Much much more...

Possible Features:
- Create Accounts
- Share projects with comments like PMC

When will this be ready for testing / use?

Currently this is in the Planning and Design phase, I am creating the UI designs and mapping how the whole program will work so currently there is no ETA for this project.
 
Why do I need Funding?
 
The reason I need funding for this project is that I dont have ALL the knowledge coding wise to create a smooth running application in a reasonable time. This means i will be hiring a external developer to help with the creation of the project for parts of the coding that are beyond my knowledge.
 
Along with this the excess funds will go towards advertising, website hosting costs and general project expenses.
 
For more information and updates please see HERE for details
 
More about minecraft see minecraft.net
 

NOTE: all funds raised will go towards the project, even if just $5

story:
There are some changes in game design, so check out the updated contents. 


[Viva, Bacon!] is a 2D sideview action adventure game for PC(Windows, OSX) and mobile(Android, iOS) platform.

 

Players should explore 10 strange, new worlds in order to chase the unknown thieves who have stolen some of the food in your fridge(especially bacon!). The main character can gain stamina -which constantly decrease - by eating the food the thieves have dropped.

 


 

The strange worlds are NOT kind at all. The main character will be continuously distracted by the surrounding environment, or might even end up in a blocked way. If he can't proceed any further, he should find someone who can help him. That 'someone' will be willing to help the character, if the players do him/her a favor.


[Viva, Bacon!] has simple and straight forward interface for both of PC and mobile environment. Players won't have to think over which key to press in order for character to take certain action.

Also, we are trying to impress the players with all of the hand-drawn background image, platform artwork, and character animation.




Below is a schedule for game production.

For the prototype and beta version for free distribution, players will be able to play only the first world. 



Your contribution will be used as :


 


[Viva, Bacon!] is a game made by a one-person company, Flying Head Studio.

The founder, Zi has started his career by working as an educational media animator in 1997, and has continuously worked made character art, game design, 2D animation, motion graphic, action script for web and broadcast, and sometimes worked as a illustrator in the publishing field in South Korea.

Zi rather prefer 2D games which are 'just enjoyable', than large-scale 3D games. Therefore try to make such.

Personal youtube channel.

 


[Viva, Bacon!] is currently on Steam's Greenlight project. If the game gets greenlit by the community, we provide Steam key and DRM Free version to all the contributor who funded more than 10 USD.

 

1 PC version(windows, OSX) game copy.


   

1 PC pack + mobile version(android, iOS) game copy.


full pack + special equipment item for contributors.

*This item reinforces character's abilities, and appears more frequently than other equipment items.


special item pack + 1 special playable character for contributors.

*This character will be unlocked from the very first.


special item pack + 3 special playable characters for contributors.

* This character will be unlocked from the very first.


special item pack + 3 special playable characters for contributors.

* This character will be unlocked from the very first.


special character pack No.3 + contributors can design 1 special playable character .

*Contributors will be given a template with basic design setting and numerical range, but it is possible to design and plan a character on their own. Also, if they send us a reference which doesn't go against the copyright law, the character can be designed accordingly.

The characters that are made by contributors will be unlocked if certain condition is satisfied.

 

Perks higher than special item pack will be provided with DRM free version game with each perks applied, and unlock key for perks will be provided when the game is purchased from Steam or App/Play store.


All of the contributors' nicknames or real name will be written on the credit.

story:
This Indiegogo campaign is a continuation of our crowdfunding campaign for Hunter's Moon Remastered, the official 30th anniversary cartridge edition of the classic Commodore 64 shoot 'em up. Hunter's Moon is regarded as one of the finest games on the C64, and we’re working closely with creator Martin Walker to ensure we stay true to his original vision.

Released in 1987, Hunter's Moon became an instant classic thanks to its measured balance of strategic planning and psychotic blasting. Boasting one of the earliest uses of procedurally-generated content in a computer game, Hunter's Moon pushed the boundaries of the genre and helped redefine what a shoot 'em up could be.

Hunter's Moon Remastered will be the first release from the Thalamus Remastered collection, which will feature cartridge versions of classic Thalamus games tweaked and updated in various ways. These remastered editions will come in cartridge format and boast numerous enhancements and exciting new features.

We believe there is a community of fans who share a love for this seminal retro shoot 'em up, and with your help we can bring the concept to fruition. We also believe in giving back, and in this regard 25% of the proceeds from each game goes directly to the original developers.

 

If you're a TL;DR kind of person and like to cut to the chase, here's the basics:

  • Browse the Perks on the right to find a perk that's right for you.
  • Click on your chosen perk to purchase it.
  • If you want to order multiple items, simply purchase multiple perks.
  • Sit back and relax - we'll handle the rest!

 

We've tried to create a series of perks to accommodate as many different preferences as possible - we want you to be able to choose the extras you really want without being restricted to a specific perk. You can purchase as many perks and extras as you wish, as many times as you wish. However, please read the perk descriptions carefully to avoid purchasing duplicate items!

The game is available in five different versions:

  • Digital Edition [£15]
  • Physical Edition [£40]
  • Physical (Karma) Edition [£45]
  • Physical & Digital Edition [£50]
  • Signed Copy [£50]

Note: All versions of the game include a free copy of the 'Thirty One' digital album (scroll down the page for more information). All physical versions of the game will also include a slick outer sleeve and a free Thalamus bookmark and sticker.

Additionally, there are a number of different extras which you can also purchase:

  • A3 Cover Art Poster [£10]
  • Hunter's Moon Pin badges [£15]
  • Slippytee Postcards [£15]
  • Thalamus T-Shirt [£20]
  • Hunter's Moon Strategy Guide [£20]
  • Thalamus Mug [£20]
  • Slippytee Prints [£20]
  • Hunter's Moon T-Shirt [£25]
  • Signed Soundtrack CD [£25]
  • Signed A2 Cover Art Poster [£25]

Note: None of these extras include a copy of the game.

Finally, there are six premium perks which contain both the Physical Edition (signed by Martin Walker), Digital Edition, and selected extras.

  • Thalamus Perk [£75]
  • T-Shirt Perk [£85]
  • Slippytee Perk [£85]
  • Collector's Edition [£100]
  • Prints & Posters Perk [£100]
  • The Swag [£200]

Note: All of the premium perks include a discount on the regular prices.

 

    After flying your trusty ship Hunter too close to a black hole, you find yourself lost in space on the wrong side of the galaxy, surrounded by sprawling, hive-like cities. At the core of each city lie mysterious alien starcells – these contain valuable navigational data, and must be collected in order to plot a course back home to Hunter's Moon.

    The aim of each level is to blast through the hive and grab the starcells, a task made more challenging by the invincible white worker cells which endlessly patrol the cities repairing any damage inflicted. These workers also bring the hive's defenses to life, causing them to spew deadly spores that can only be resisted by using your ship's trusty Perma-Shields.

    The game features 128 levels spread across 16 star systems. When all the starcells on a level have been collected you'll enter the bonus game where you can earn a perma-shield and an extra life. You must complete every level within each star system to advance to the next; however, should you manage to collect four flashing starcells before the time limit expires you'll automatically jump to the next system.

    As you progress through the different star systems you'll encounter an array of diverse and challenging hive types, including Attackers that throw out deadly spores, Wormcells that roam freely in space, Darkcells which are only visible on radar, Stargates requiring precision timing to navigate, and Switchers that change direction without warning. Do you have the dexterity and psychopathic blasting skills to find your way home to Hunter's Moon...?

     

    The premise behind Hunter's Moon Remastered is to not only re-release the game on cartridge, but also add new content, levels, music, and graphics, as well as make various tweaks, bug fixes, and improvements. And naturally, we want to create something which is luxuriously packaged and looks great on a shelf next to a string of Thalamus Remastered games.

    • New Levels: We've reverse-engineered the game to find out how the procedurally-generated levels were created, allowing us to add more levels and Star Systems (including new levels from the game's creator, Martin Walker!).

    • Graphical Tweaks: We'll be adding a new logo on the Title Screen, thicker lasers for the Hunter, and hopefully some extra layers of parallax on the in-game starfield.

    • New Packaging: The cartridge will be housed in a sturdy clamshell case, complete with an updated A6 instruction manual, cover art postcard, and Thalamus sticker.

    • New Cover Art: The game will boast remastered cover artwork by legendary illustrator Oliver Frey, based on his Zzap!64 cover from 1987.

    • New 'Loading' Screen: We'll be employing the exemplary pixel-bashing skills of legendary C64 artist Robin Levy to translate Oli Frey's new cover artwork to the C64.

    • In-Game Music: You'll be able to choose between in-game music or sound effects on the Title Screen. The game will also feature brand new music from composer Matt Gray.

    • Hint Pages: If you're new to Hunter's Moon, don't worry - we'll be adding hint pages to the game’s front end which will cover the fundamental basics of playing the game.

    • Trainer Mode: If the thought of conquering 128+ levels fills you with dread, we'll give you infinite lives, infinite perma-shields, and a shortcut to the first eight star systems.
    • Saving & Passwords: As well as a save feature which saves your progress directly to the cartridge, we'll include a password system that jumps to the Star System of your choice.

    • Gameplay Tweaks: We'll make a few judicious tweaks wherever necessary; let's face it, wouldn't it be great if those Perma-Shields lasted just a little bit longer?
    • Demo Mode: We'll add a rolling demo to the game's attract mode, which will show tantalizing glimpses of some of the game's 128+ levels.

    • Bug Fixes: Games often have their bugs, and Hunter's Moon is no exception; we'll use this valuable opportunity to address some of the minor bugs in the game.

    • Localised Text: As a treat for our European cousins, we'll be translating all of the in-game text into French, Italian, German, and Spanish.

    • Original Version: For all of you die-hard Hunter's Moon purists still wearing shoulder pads and living in 1987, we'll include the original version of the game on the cartridge.

    • Boot Menu: We'll add a boot menu which will allow you to choose the version (Original or Remastered), activate the Trainer, select a language, and access the Level Editor.

    • Expanded High Score Table: We’ll be expanding the High Score Table to include five high scores instead of four. No longer will 4th place be the ultimate humiliation!

     

    Thanks to the success of our original crowdfunding campaign, we were able to smash through our funding goal and add a plethora of extras to the game:

    • NTSC Compatibility: We'll be performing various optimisations to the game engine to ensure the game is fully compatible with NTSC (North American) C64s.


    NTSC version (left) versus the PAL version (right)
     

    • New Music: Matt Gray will be creating some brand-new SID tracks for the game, designed to perfectly compliment his original Hunter's Moon soundtrack.

    • New Level Types: We'll be adding three new level types (Jumpgates, Infrared, and Emperor Hives), as well as new level designs by Martin Walker himself!
    • Random Mode: We'll add add a new mode to the game which randomly shuffles the level order; even if you're an experienced player, you'll never quite know what's coming next!

    • Level Editor: We'll add our Level Editor to the cartridge, allowing you to create your own devilishly tricky alien hives and share them with your friends!

    • Packaging Upgrade: This goal allowed us to add a glossy cardboard sleeve that neatly slides over the top of the clamshell case. Trust us, it's lusher than lush.

    • New Intro: We're employing the graphical talents of Robin Levy to help us create an intro which sets the perfect mood and tone for the action that lies ahead.

    • Manual Illustrations: As we're revamping the instruction manual, we'll  be commissioning Oli Frey to create some new illustrations to dot throughout the text.

    • New Outro: To compliment the new Intro Sequence, we'll also be revamping the outro sequence (which will now also include all of our wonderful backers' names).

    • Walker's Warbles PDF: This exclusive feature is Martin's personal retrospective of his career as a video game musician, including his inspirations and favourite compositions.
    • Localised Manual: As well as in-game text translations, we'll also be translating the instruction manual into French, Italian, German, and Spanish.

    • Bookmark & Sticker: A last-minute addition to the Stretch Goals, we'll also be adding a Thalamus bookmark and sticker to each physical copy of the game.

    All versions of the game will include a free copy of Thirty One, an 11-track digital compilation album featuring some of the best Thalamus remixes from C64audio.com's catalogue (including the eagerly-awaited Sidologie). We've also included two tracks from Matt Gray's forthcoming Reformation album, including that killer track from the campaign video!

    The current track list includes:

    1. Sanxion - Slow Poison (Karma 64)
    2. Delta 97 Plus - Chris Abbott & Rob Hubbard (Back in Time)
    3. QueDex Loading Theme - Matt Gray (Reformation)
    4. Hunter's Moon Loading Theme - Matt Gray (Reformation)
    5. Armalyte Asteroid Storm - Fabian Del Priore feat. Puffy64 (Back in Time 3)
    6. Sanxion - Erwin "Tron" Beekveld (Syntax Era - Remix64 Volume 3)
    7. Hunter's Moon - Marcel Donne (Waiting for SID)
    8. Sanxion - Markus "Makke" Lagre (It's Binary, Baby)
    9. Delta Victory - Marcel Donne (Waiting for SID)
    10. Thalamusik 2000 - Chris Abbott (Back in Time 2)

    Special thanks to Chris Abbott from C64audio.com and Matt Gray for their incredible support in making this album possible.

     

    Thanks to the success of the initial crowdfunding campaign, development has already commenced. The estimated completion date is end of February 2018, with orders ready for dispatch in late March 2018.

     

    Thalamus Digital Publishing is an independent UK game developer and publisher specializing in high-quality retro games. Our team of dedicated professionals have decades of experience, and have collectively worked on over 160 titles for a variety of world-class companies.

    • Andy Roberts [Designer / Producer] Andy has worked in the games industry since 1989; cutting his teeth on Zzap!64 magazine, he went on to freelance for numerous publications including Commodore Format. He also worked on three of the most successful C64 games of all time: Creatures, Creatures 2, and Mayhem in Monsterland.

    • Dan Hotop [Programming] Dan is an experienced programmer hailing from New South Wales, Australia. After graduating with a Bachelor of Computer Science (Games Tech), he went on to join Sony Computer Entertainment, working on various PSP, PS2, and PS3 titles such as MediEvil: Resurrection, Heavenly Sword, and LittleBigPlanet.

    • Rob Levy [Graphics] An accomplished artist and animator, Rob began his career as one third of the legendary Cyberdyne Systems, who created the spectacular C64 shoot 'em up Armalyte. As well as contributions to games such as Hunter's Moon, Hawkeye, and Citadel, Rob also worked for System 3, producing visuals for Last Ninja 3 and Turbo Charge.

    • Matt Gray [Music] Matt began his career in 1987 with his high-energy tracks for QueDex. He went on to produce music for games such as Driller and Hunter's Moon, which led to Matt joining System 3, where he produced audio for Bangkok Knights, Dominator, Tusker, Vendetta, and his much-lauded soundtrack for Last Ninja 2.

     

    Order fulfillment will be handled by RGCD, who have been publishing, and distributing C64 cartridge games since 2011. RGCD’s expertise and attention to detail will ensure that every order is handled with the utmost care and professionalism.

     

    After market retail sales will be handled by Protovision. Founded in 1996, Protovision is one of the world’s leading suppliers of new C64 hardware and software, and is the exclusive after market retailer for Thalamus Digital Publishing.

     

    Physical copies of the game will be dispatched in a sturdy A4 postal box capable of a copy of the game, a rolled A3 poster, and numerous extras (this allows us to combine multiple items into one box). Depending on the item, miscellaneous extras will be dispatched in A4 postal boxes or padded envelopes. Posters will be included in the A4 box wherever possible, or shipped separately in a sturdy cardboard tube.

    Basic postage rates for physical game pledges are as follows:

    • United Kingdom - £4.00
    • European Union - £8.00
    • Rest of World - £12.00

    For all other extras, the postage is included in the price (see individual perks for details).

    Note: Some premium (£75+) perks have a slightly higher postage rate due to the size, weight, or quantity of the rewards.

    All packages will be sent via Royal Mail UK Standard Delivery or International Standard Delivery, which includes £25 coverage. If you wish to upgrade your postage method to UK Signed or International Tracked & Signed, please contact us at: postage@thalamusdigital.co.uk for a quote.

     

    Creating and publishing computer games can be a huge challenge. However, as a game designer and producer well experienced in managing video game projects of varying scope and complexity, I am more than qualified to deliver this project to a high standard.

    I have over 27 years' experience in the games industry, having worked on 80+ games across 20 different formats. In 1993 I helped publish the classic C64 game Mayhem in Monsterland, including duplication, packaging design and print, advertising, localization, and order fulfillment.

    The development process is something I have absolute confidence in; the project has been in the planning stages since late 2014, and I've already invested hundreds of man hours to mitigate as many risks as possible:

    • I've consulted with some incredible advisors, including Sam Dyer of Bitmap Books, Chris Abbott of C64audio.com, and James Monkman of RGCD.
    • I've worked tirelessly to try and source rewards from trusted, quality suppliers and manufacturers, as well as backup suppliers should any unexpected issues occur.

    Certainly, it's a logistical challenge to bring this many moving parts together to deliver a final product, and it would be foolish to suggest that everything will run without a hitch. However, the team is ready, we've done the preliminary R&D, and I'm confident that any problems that arise from this point on would merely cause a delay.

    And if delays do occur, naturally you'll be the first to know: one of my promises to you the backers is that you'll receive regular, weekly updates direct to your inbox. No surprises, and no radio silence – I'll keep you in the loop every step of the way.

    If you have any further questions, please get in touch.

    Andy Roberts 
    andy@thalamusdigital.co.uk

    Web: www.thalamusdigital.co.uk 
    Facebook: www.facebook.com/thalamusdigital 
    Twitter: @thalamusdigital 
    Instagram: @thalamusdigital

     

    ​Special Thanks: Chris Abbott, Jim Brain, Ste Day, Sam Dyer, Oli Frey, Matt Gray, Neil Grayson, Mark Hardisty, Dan Hotop, Roger Kean, Rob Levy, Jason Mackenzie, Carl Mason, Marty Millar, James Monkman, Paul Morrison, Mat Recardo, Jennifer Roberts, Jens Schönfeld, Trevor Storey, Stephen Thomson, Johan Vinet, Jakob Voos, Martin Walker, The Commodore Format Archive, The Retro Hour Podcast, Retro Domination Podcast, Retro Asylum Podcast, Stirring Dragon Games, One More Story Games, and Retro Gamer. Additional thanks to Gary Winnick & Ron Gilbert for the Karma Pledge idea.

    Hunter's Moon & Mugician artwork © 1986-2017 Oliver Frey.
    Thalamus logo © 1986-2017 Oliver Frey. Used under exclusive licence.
    Turbocharge, Last Ninja 2, and Last Ninja 3 artwork © 1988-1991 System 3.

    All images shown are for illustration purposes only and may not be an exact representation of the final product due to product enhancement.

These workers also bring the hive's defenses to life, causing them to spew deadly spores that can only be resisted by using your ship's trusty Perma-Shields.The game features 128 levels spread across 16 star systems.
