You must complete every level within each star system to advance to the next; however, should you manage to collect four flashing starcells before the time limit expires you'll automatically jump to the next system.As you progress through the different star systems you'll encounter an array of diverse and challenging hive types, including Attackers that throw out deadly spores, Wormcells that roam freely in space, Darkcells which are only visible on radar, Stargates requiring precision timing to navigate, and Switchers that change direction without warning. Do you have the dexterity and psychopathic blasting skills to find your way home to Hunter's Moon...? The premise behind Hunter's Moon Remastered is to not only re-release the game on cartridge, but also add new content, levels, music, and graphics, as well as make various tweaks, bug fixes, and improvements. And naturally, we want to create something which is luxuriously packaged and looks great on a shelf next to a string of Thalamus Remastered games.
New Levels: We've reverse-engineered the game to find out how the procedurally-generated levels were created, allowing us to add more levels and Star Systems (including new levels from the game's creator, Martin Walker!).
Graphical Tweaks: We'll be adding a new logo on the Title Screen, thicker lasers for the Hunter, and hopefully some extra layers of parallax on the in-game starfield.
New Packaging: The cartridge will be housed in a sturdy clamshell case, complete with an updated A6 instruction manual, cover art postcard, and Thalamus sticker.
New Cover Art: The game will boast remastered cover artwork by legendary illustrator Oliver Frey, based on his Zzap!64 cover from 1987.
New 'Loading' Screen: We'll be employing the exemplary pixel-bashing skills of legendary C64 artist Robin Levy to translate Oli Frey's new cover artwork to the C64.
In-Game Music: You'll be able to choose between in-game music or sound effects on the Title Screen. The game will also feature brand new music from composer Matt Gray.
Hint Pages: If you're new to Hunter's Moon, don't worry - we'll be adding hint pages to the game’s front end which will cover the fundamental basics of playing the game.
Trainer Mode: If the thought of conquering 128+ levels fills you with dread, we'll give you infinite lives, infinite perma-shields, and a shortcut to the first eight star systems.
Saving & Passwords: As well as a save feature which saves your progress directly to the cartridge, we'll include a password system that jumps to the Star System of your choice.
Gameplay Tweaks: We'll make a few judicious tweaks wherever necessary; let's face it, wouldn't it be great if those Perma-Shields lasted just a little bit longer?
Demo Mode: We'll add a rolling demo to the game's attract mode, which will show tantalizing glimpses of some of the game's 128+ levels.
Bug Fixes: Games often have their bugs, and Hunter's Moon is no exception; we'll use this valuable opportunity to address some of the minor bugs in the game.
Localised Text: As a treat for our European cousins, we'll be translating all of the in-game text into French, Italian, German, and Spanish.
Original Version: For all of you die-hard Hunter's Moon purists still wearing shoulder pads and living in 1987, we'll include the original version of the game on the cartridge.
Boot Menu: We'll add a boot menu which will allow you to choose the version (Original or Remastered), activate the Trainer, select a language, and access the Level Editor.
Expanded High Score Table: We’ll be expanding the High Score Table to include five high scores instead of four. No longer will 4th place be the ultimate humiliation! Thanks to the success of our original crowdfunding campaign, we were able to smash through our funding goal and add a plethora of extras to the game:
NTSC Compatibility: We'll be performing various optimisations to the game engine to ensure the game is fully compatible with NTSC (North American) C64s.NTSC version (left) versus the PAL version (right) 
New Music: Matt Gray will be creating some brand-new SID tracks for the game, designed to perfectly compliment his original Hunter's Moon soundtrack.
New Level Types: We'll be adding three new level types (Jumpgates, Infrared, and Emperor Hives), as well as new level designs by Martin Walker himself!
Random Mode: We'll add add a new mode to the game which randomly shuffles the level order; even if you're an experienced player, you'll never quite know what's coming next!
Level Editor: We'll add our Level Editor to the cartridge, allowing you to create your own devilishly tricky alien hives and share them with your friends!
Packaging Upgrade: This goal allowed us to add a glossy cardboard sleeve that neatly slides over the top of the clamshell case. Trust us, it's lusher than lush.
New Intro: We're employing the graphical talents of Robin Levy to help us create an intro which sets the perfect mood and tone for the action that lies ahead.
Manual Illustrations: As we're revamping the instruction manual, we'll  be commissioning Oli Frey to create some new illustrations to dot throughout the text.
New Outro: To compliment the new Intro Sequence, we'll also be revamping the outro sequence (which will now also include all of our wonderful backers' names).
Walker's Warbles PDF: This exclusive feature is Martin's personal retrospective of his career as a video game musician, including his inspirations and favourite compositions.
Localised Manual: As well as in-game text translations, we'll also be translating the instruction manual into French, Italian, German, and Spanish.
Bookmark & Sticker: A last-minute addition to the Stretch Goals, we'll also be adding a Thalamus bookmark and sticker to each physical copy of the game.All versions of the game will include a free copy of Thirty One, an 11-track digital compilation album featuring some of the best Thalamus remixes from C64audio.com's catalogue (including the eagerly-awaited Sidologie). We've also included two tracks from Matt Gray's forthcoming Reformation album, including that killer track from the campaign video!The current track list includes:

Sanxion - Slow Poison (Karma 64)


Delta 97 Plus - Chris Abbott & Rob Hubbard (Back in Time)


QueDex Loading Theme - Matt Gray (Reformation)


Hunter's Moon Loading Theme - Matt Gray (Reformation)


Armalyte Asteroid Storm - Fabian Del Priore feat. Puffy64 (Back in Time 3)


Sanxion - Erwin "Tron" Beekveld (Syntax Era - Remix64 Volume 3)


Hunter's Moon - Marcel Donne (Waiting for SID)


Sanxion - Markus "Makke" Lagre (It's Binary, Baby)


Delta Victory - Marcel Donne (Waiting for SID)


Thalamusik 2000 - Chris Abbott (Back in Time 2)

Special thanks to Chris Abbott from C64audio.com and Matt Gray for their incredible support in making this album possible. Thanks to the success of the initial crowdfunding campaign, development has already commenced. The estimated completion date is end of February 2018, with orders ready for dispatch in late March 2018. Thalamus Digital Publishing is an independent UK game developer and publisher specializing in high-quality retro games. Our team of dedicated professionals have decades of experience, and have collectively worked on over 160 titles for a variety of world-class companies.
Andy Roberts [Designer / Producer] Andy has worked in the games industry since 1989; cutting his teeth on Zzap!64 magazine, he went on to freelance for numerous publications including Commodore Format. He also worked on three of the most successful C64 games of all time: Creatures, Creatures 2, and Mayhem in Monsterland.
Dan Hotop [Programming] Dan is an experienced programmer hailing from New South Wales, Australia. After graduating with a Bachelor of Computer Science (Games Tech), he went on to join Sony Computer Entertainment, working on various PSP, PS2, and PS3 titles such as MediEvil: Resurrection, Heavenly Sword, and LittleBigPlanet.
Rob Levy [Graphics] An accomplished artist and animator, Rob began his career as one third of the legendary Cyberdyne Systems, who created the spectacular C64 shoot 'em up Armalyte. As well as contributions to games such as Hunter's Moon, Hawkeye, and Citadel, Rob also worked for System 3, producing visuals for Last Ninja 3 and Turbo Charge.
Matt Gray [Music] Matt began his career in 1987 with his high-energy tracks for QueDex. He went on to produce music for games such as Driller and Hunter's Moon, which led to Matt joining System 3, where he produced audio for Bangkok Knights, Dominator, Tusker, Vendetta, and his much-lauded soundtrack for Last Ninja 2. Order fulfillment will be handled by RGCD, who have been publishing, and distributing C64 cartridge games since 2011. RGCD’s expertise and attention to detail will ensure that every order is handled with the utmost care and professionalism. After market retail sales will be handled by Protovision. Founded in 1996, Protovision is one of the world’s leading suppliers of new C64 hardware and software, and is the exclusive after market retailer for Thalamus Digital Publishing. Physical copies of the game will be dispatched in a sturdy A4 postal box capable of a copy of the game, a rolled A3 poster, and numerous extras (this allows us to combine multiple items into one box). Depending on the item, miscellaneous extras will be dispatched in A4 postal boxes or padded envelopes. Posters will be included in the A4 box wherever possible, or shipped separately in a sturdy cardboard tube.Basic postage rates for physical game pledges are as follows:
United Kingdom - £4.00
European Union - £8.00
Rest of World - £12.00
For all other extras, the postage is included in the price (see individual perks for details).Note: Some premium (£75+) perks have a slightly higher postage rate due to the size, weight, or quantity of the rewards.All packages will be sent via Royal Mail UK Standard Delivery or International Standard Delivery, which includes £25 coverage. If you wish to upgrade your postage method to UK Signed or International Tracked & Signed, please contact us at: postage@thalamusdigital.co.uk for a quote. Creating and publishing computer games can be a huge challenge. However, as a game designer and producer well experienced in managing video game projects of varying scope and complexity, I am more than qualified to deliver this project to a high standard.I have over 27 years' experience in the games industry, having worked on 80+ games across 20 different formats. In 1993 I helped publish the classic C64 game Mayhem in Monsterland, including duplication, packaging design and print, advertising, localization, and order fulfillment.The development process is something I have absolute confidence in; the project has been in the planning stages since late 2014, and I've already invested hundreds of man hours to mitigate as many risks as possible:I've consulted with some incredible advisors, including Sam Dyer of Bitmap Books, Chris Abbott of C64audio.com, and James Monkman of RGCD.I've worked tirelessly to try and source rewards from trusted, quality suppliers and manufacturers, as well as backup suppliers should any unexpected issues occur.Certainly, it's a logistical challenge to bring this many moving parts together to deliver a final product, and it would be foolish to suggest that everything will run without a hitch. However, the team is ready, we've done the preliminary R&D, and I'm confident that any problems that arise from this point on would merely cause a delay.And if delays do occur, naturally you'll be the first to know: one of my promises to you the backers is that you'll receive regular, weekly updates direct to your inbox. No surprises, and no radio silence – I'll keep you in the loop every step of the way.If you have any further questions, please get in touch.Andy Roberts andy@thalamusdigital.co.ukWeb: www.thalamusdigital.co.uk Facebook: www.facebook.com/thalamusdigital Twitter: @thalamusdigital Instagram: @thalamusdigital ​Special Thanks: Chris Abbott, Jim Brain, Ste Day, Sam Dyer, Oli Frey, Matt Gray, Neil Grayson, Mark Hardisty, Dan Hotop, Roger Kean, Rob Levy, Jason Mackenzie, Carl Mason, Marty Millar, James Monkman, Paul Morrison, Mat Recardo, Jennifer Roberts, Jens Schönfeld, Trevor Storey, Stephen Thomson, Johan Vinet, Jakob Voos, Martin Walker, The Commodore Format Archive, The Retro Hour Podcast, Retro Domination Podcast, Retro Asylum Podcast, Stirring Dragon Games, One More Story Games, and Retro Gamer. Additional thanks to Gary Winnick & Ron Gilbert for the Karma Pledge idea.Hunter's Moon & Mugician artwork © 1986-2017 Oliver Frey.Thalamus logo © 1986-2017 Oliver Frey. Used under exclusive licence.Turbocharge, Last Ninja 2, and Last Ninja 3 artwork © 1988-1991 System 3.All images shown are for illustration purposes only and may not be an exact representation of the final product due to product enhancement.

story:
1. THE PROJECT

OmuniOnline, A Fantasy based MMO RPG with a twist. The Idea of this project Is actually based in the future yet it is still displayed as the fantasy medieval era. You play the roll of one of the "Soul Children" witch essentially is just a person who was born with a bit of a destroyed god's power imbedded in a distant relative then passed into you when you where in the womb. You get to completely customize your character then enter this diverse and beautiful world to either play the main story or just do what ever you want. The freedom is yours. The combat is completely unique and actually relies on your skill as a player. This will not be a point click, and wait fighting style, You will need to attack, dodge, block, etc all on your own in real time. You have numerous stats for you to train in order to grow your character's abilities. These skill will of course include: attack,strength,defense, range, magic, wood cutting, mining, smithing, agility, health, cooking, fishing, etc. We will display these skill in a unique way and make sure that they are all enjoyable to train and use throughout the game. There will be many items and themes that involve futuristic technology to add the twist in the game for example "hover boards". The monsters in this game will be very diverse and will prove to be challenging and entertaining to fight. Weapons and armor are completely interchangeable as you are able to select five different main armor pieces add jewelry, capes, shields, and weapons, All of these will be able to switch and customize to make your perfect armor set. In order to obtain armor you can either buy it but in most cases you will need to pay and give the needed materials to a black smith. Blacksmiths will allow u to use less materials but will cost however if you have a high enough smithing level you may make your armor alone with the cost of more materials and no capital.

 

2. GAME CONCEPT

Back many years ago people worshiped gods and expressed their religion and faith. There where eight Gods in total four good and four that ended up being evil. Omuna, Shinya, Kyo, Darma who were the good gods and Omuni, Ruge, Punisher, Shento who were the evil. In the beginning all was great. The eight gods created a Demi god named Gaia who took the form of the earth the humans lived on, but then eventually the four evil gods started abusing the humans as they worshiped them instead of answering their prayers. Eventually they started to even kill the humans, Omuna the goddess of light and sister to Omuni the god of darkness, decided to punish the four evil gods by banishing them forever. Thousands of years have passed and the humans have advanced in technology and have forgotten about their magic and their religions, thus resulting in the humans poisoning gaia with pollution and side effects from their ways. The good gods did not want this to happen and could not stop it on their own so they summoned the four evil gods asking them to help. Instead of helping they actually started destroying every human and started to summon all kinds of grotesque monsters to cause chaos. The four evil god then took their revenge on the four good gods and ended up destroying them. Omuna, just before dying let her soul and pour flood into gaia so gaia could imbed Omuna's power in some of the surviving and hiding humans. Many years passed and the evil gods decided to take a long rest thinking that they destroyed all humans Unfortunately for the gods many humans were surviving just fine underground and when they noticed that the gods where sleeping they evacuated the hiding caverns to start rebuilding and repopulating. Thousands of years have passed and kingdoms, villages, bridges, etc have been created with just the materials found on gaia. You are then born with a fragment of Omuna's soul inside of you. Some more years skip and you decide to go adventure but when you do a strange old man speaks to you telling you who you are. He then trains you on how to survive in this world and become stronger because you are destined to find the other people with fragments of Omuna's soul and unite to slay the four evil gods when they wake.    

 

3. THEME

The story that goes with the game. What is the plot of the game and the main reason for it being. 

 

4. FEATURES

  • Character Customization
  • Many amazing skills to train and use in the game
  • Thousands or armor sets and clothing sets
  • Create armor and clothing from materials found in the game
  • Role playing capability
  • Thousands of non repetitive quests
  • Hundreds of monsters to slay
  • A very interactive combat system
  • Freedom to do what you want
  • Coliseum for players to have 1 on 1 fights with a paying audience.
  • Advanced technology (weapons, vehicles, robots)
  • Hover board race tracks
  • Intense PvP
  • Range, Melee, and magic combat types,
  • Hundreds of spells to gain.
  • Pets
  • Player houses
  • Mini games with rewards
  • An intense and complex story
  • The ability to craft weapons armors and many other great things
  • Chat system: Text and voice
  • Free to play or pay to play
  • Eshop to buy items or money in game with real money (optional)
  • Unlimited game play (Many updates)
  • Auto Updater
  • Weapon classes (each weapon class effects how your combat will be)
  • Much Much more!

 

 

5. ABOUT US

We are a small yet growing team known as MoyaGames. We are an independent team started by Ryan Nadeau. We have huge dreams in the world of video game design and hope to go as far as we can and bring joy and entertainment to thousands of people. We make very diverse games from shocking ones to horror to adventurous or humorous!

 

 

6. OUR MISSION

Our mission is to create an amazing MMO RPG with all the freedom you can have to be what ever you want to be and bring much joy to our players. We wish to make the most diverse and intense MMO out there! With our in-depth story and awesome gameplay this game will not disappoint. We wish to bring you some familiar aspects of mmo's to you but a ton of unique and original ideas as well!

 

7. THE IMPACT

The funding given to us for this project will have an enormous impact because we will actually be able to finish this project. It is extremely hard to make an MMO RPG such as our with a team of teenaged to middle aged people from all around the world for free! We have all been working hard and for free. With the proper funding we will be able to pay professional programmers and artists so we can actually create this game and keep a visually appealing aesthetic! All funding will go directly to the game's development. 

 

8. WHAT WE HAVE

So far we have the following.

  • A starter island to 
  • Male and female character modeled
  • Male character rigged and has customization assets
  • A massive continent to explore
  • Many monsters modeled and textured some animated
  • Hundreds of quests written down
  • MMO Networking DONE
  • Servers Running
  • Character Controller Beta done
  • Character customization screen beta done
  • Thousands of props, buildings, and environmental items
  • Basic Ai Started
  • Basic Combat Started
  • Chat System
  • Hundreds of weapons modeled and textured
  • Etc (FOR NOW much more coming soon)

 

9. WHAT WE NEED

  • 1 or 2 Professional programer
  • Professional texture artists
  • Optimization Engineer
  • Animators 
  • Web Programmers

 

10. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Offical Website - Register to our website. http://www.moyagames.com (need web programers to finish).

Youtube - Subscribe to our youtube channel! 

http:www.youtube.com/omunionline

Facebook - Like our facebook page! http://facebook.com/omunionline

Join - Join the team if you have experiance in3D modeling or whatever you need.

story:
Press

Read this article from the Chicago Sun-Times that provides great background on Mercy Cards.

Short Summary

Do handouts benefit the homeless?  This is a much debated question that most people struggle with every time they are asked for a handout.  Nonetheless, most people eventually relent.  However, even when we give, the main reservation that one has is that once we are relieved of our cash, there is no way to ensure responsible use of those funds. 

Jed JohnHope and Shantel Higgins began developing Mercy Cards as second-year MBA students at Northwestern University’s Kellogg School of Management. After a visit to a Chicago-area grocery store that had several homeless people outside, Jed began to contemplate the homeless population’s diminishing access to cash. Convinced that we could help, Jed and Shantel started Mercy Cards and proceeded to dedicate their careers to this problem that is well worth solving.

In short, Mercy Cards is seeking to revolutionize the way that we give to homeless.  We urge you to help us, but we don't need coins, we need CHANGE!

The Impact

Our mission is to create technological solutions that allow eager citizens to contribute to those less fortunate and manage those contributions to ensure that they are not spent on abusive substances.  By doing so, we will reduce the homeless’ access to drugs and alcohol and increase their ability to achieve employment and get off the streets.

Breaking bread with your neighbor was once commonplace and helping those in need went well beyond one’s own dinner table, but in today’s world social circles have become smaller and most people have become complacent to the plight of the homeless.  In fact, most people rationalize this complacency with the two following reasons:

  • No Change – Donors, simply, do not carry cash anymore and change is a byproduct of cash
  • No Trust – While everyone is eager to buy someone a meal, most donors were concerned with giving someone money to support a substance abuse habit
Mercy Cards will directly address both concerns and provide a way for everyone to play an active role in helping their neighbors help themselves.  The main advantage to the homeless population is decreased access to drugs and alcohol.  38% of the homeless are dependent on alcohol and 26% are dependent on drugs.  Most astonishing is the fact that these people depend on you for income.  So, essentially, the homeless population are victims of our generosity and by limiting the homeless’ access to traditional cash, a universal currency, we can help them become vibrant, productive members of our community again.

What We Need & What You Get

Mercy Cards is raising $75,000 for our first production run.  We have identified a company to design the custom, electronic filter and produce the cards.  The minimum initial order quantity is 10,000 units and we need your backing! If we do not reach our intended goal, we will continue to seek creative ways to bring this, or similar, products to market.

As an initial backer of Mercy Cards, you will receive a collector's edition, 1st production run card. Once Mercy Cards has become a resounding success, you will share in our joy, knowing that you help us start and, together, we have made a lasting impact on the way that the world gives to the needy.  The commemorative Mercy Card will be a lasting token of our gratitude and a keepsake that one can cherish forever.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign;
  • Like us Facebook;
  • Tweet about us;
  • Visit www.mercycards.com and
  • Purchase a Mercy Card, when available!

In short, Mercy Cards is seeking to revolutionize the way that we give to homeless.  We urge you to help us, but we don't need coins, we need CHANGE!The Impact
Our mission is to create technological solutions that allow eager citizens to contribute to those less fortunate and manage those contributions to ensure that they are not spent on abusive substances.  By doing so, we will reduce the homeless’ access to drugs and alcohol and increase their ability to achieve employment and get off the streets.
Breaking bread with your neighbor was once commonplace and helping those in need went well beyond one’s own dinner table, but in today’s world social circles have become smaller and most people have become complacent to the plight of the homeless.  In fact, most people rationalize this complacency with the two following reasons:


No Change – Donors, simply, do not carry cash anymore and change is a byproduct of cash

No Trust – While everyone is eager to buy someone a meal, most donors were concerned with giving someone money to support a substance abuse habit

Mercy Cards will directly address both concerns and provide a way for everyone to play an active role in helping their neighbors help themselves.  The main advantage to the homeless population is decreased access to drugs and alcohol.  38% of the homeless are dependent on alcohol and 26% are dependent on drugs.  Most astonishing is the fact that these people depend on you for income.  So, essentially, the homeless population are victims of our generosity and by limiting the homeless’ access to traditional cash, a universal currency, we can help them become vibrant, productive members of our community again.

What We Need & What You Get
Mercy Cards is raising $75,000 for our first production run.  We have identified a company to design the custom, electronic filter and produce the cards.  The minimum initial order quantity is 10,000 units and we need your backing! If we do not reach our intended goal, we will continue to seek creative ways to bring this, or similar, products to market.
As an initial backer of Mercy Cards, you will receive a collector's edition, 1st production run card. Once Mercy Cards has become a resounding success, you will share in our joy, knowing that you help us start and, together, we have made a lasting impact on the way that the world gives to the needy.  The commemorative Mercy Card will be a lasting token of our gratitude and a keepsake that one can cherish forever.


Other Ways You Can Help
Just because you can’t contribute, doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign;
Like us Facebook;
Tweet about us;
Visit www.mercycards.com and
Purchase a Mercy Card, when available!

story:
* all of the game footage is pre-alpha rendered and only some of the features are shown.

** Since we are only 17 years old, the bank/paypal accounts are on the names of our relatives. All the money that are transferred to them will go directly for funding Moo Lander !!!


Moo Lander is a 2D adventure game that will be free to download.

1. Team

Dimitar Popov /17 years/ - programing, game music, storyline and everything else

Yasen Bagalev /17 years/ - programing, game design, storyline and everything else

2. Storyline

We will try to explain the story line in a few words. The story begins in the past, where there are two civilizations - The Landers and The Anunnaki. Both of them use the milk as their primal resource. For a long time they live in peace, but in time The Anunnaki become greedy. Then begins The War - long and devastating, it puts both civilizations on the edge of extinction. Their only hope for survival becomes the legend of a mythical device that can produce infinite amounts of milk, which is located on a small planet called Earth.

The Landers send their bravest soldier on a mission of finding it and bringing it to save their world. And that is when your journey begins.

3. Gameplay

On Earth you will play trough all kinds of terrain - vast planes, deep caves, steep mountains, mysterious forests and even endless deserts. Then, however, your find out that you are a long way of finding the device.

Later in the gameplay you can expect:

- meeting alien civilizations

- playing on water planets


- fighting with ancient demons in god-forgotten places


- as well as challenge your skills against places where even gravity is unstable and constantly shifting


As we said in the video, we don't want to spoil your game experience, so we won't reveal the final now. We can only say that it will be really epic and even a little sad.

4. Features

- You will have different ships, which you can unlock in the game, as you find each of the six Books of Knowledge. Each ship will have different characteristics, which you can upgrade from the shop menu.

- You have two bars in the upper left corner of the game - one for health, and one for energy.

- In the game you’re constantly sucking or "Landing" cows for milk with your primary attack, /which is different for every ship/. But you will find all kinds of mechanisms and puzzles scattered through the game.

- At some point you will find other smart creatures or machines, who will try to kill you, and you will be able to defend yourself with your secondary attack - shooting some kind of bullets /also different for every ship/.

- You also have Cloak Mode /when you want to pass stealthily near someone/.

- When you really advance in the game you will discover capsules that activate Power Mode /you become invulnerable to enemy attacks, and you also have unlimited energy and health/, but for limited time.


- Some Landers will have a powerful mass-destruction weapon, which will destroy all enemies nearby.

- We also want to mention the Random Events /secret paths, mechanisms, big bonuses and etc./ - Those are events, that are spawn randomly through the gameplay, so replaying levels increases your chances of finding them.

5. Online

Playing alone is fun, but the real challenge is competing with other players, so we plan to make online system, that lets you challenge other players in couple of ways. The challenges are made for certain levels and with a deadline. After the deadline, the player with the higher score on that level wins:

- Prize challenges - both players bet equal amounts of credits, and the winner takes it all.

- Nickname challenges - The winner gets to change both players usernames/We expect that type of challenge to be the real fun/.

Also the best players, who get to the TOP 20 will often get awesome bonuses.

6. VIP options

- We will offer Deluxe Accounts - they will give you the privilege of playing the prehistory of your character.

7. What we have done so far

- We have built the engine of the game, which supports all the functionalities listed above.

- We almost completed the online system /challenges and etc./.

- We have drawn and built some of the levels, as you can see on the video.

- We have completed the storyline, and we have recorded over 30 min. of music as well, /but it is not fully completed/.

8. Why do we need you

- We have to build many more levels and a lot of creatures, and we have to animate them /for some of which we need a professional designer/.

- Also we have to buy all the software needed for developing our game.

- We have to go to professional sound engineer to record, mix and master our soundtrack.

- We have to build some 3 D cinematic pieces that tell parts of the story. And we want to really work for the finale of the game, to make a great ending to the epic storyline.

9. Conclusion

We have currently worked for 6 months, but as we want to release an elaborate game, we expect to release the first part somewhere around april 2014, and then release updates monthly.

We can promise you that we will bust our asses into making this game happen!!!

story:
Jurassic genetics is inspired by the film jurassic park and the idea of what jurassic park would be like if it had succeeded, it pays homage to the jp franchize and games like zoo tycoon 2 and jurassic park operation genesis, with similar concepts of building a successful zoo theme park maintaining visitor safety and keeping both guests and animals needs satisfied Jurassic Genetics wil feature the magnificent cast of charectors from the mighty t rex to the docile triceratops. If you ever wanted to see dinosaurs come to life then this is right up your alley.

Key Features

  • A new refreshing look when it comes to the menu screens, with interactive buttons and knobs to play with.
  • Over 12 dinosaur species to begin with with plans to include more in future updates.
  • Both third player and build it mode available where you can switch between the two.
  • You can take the park jeep out for a ride either through the park or out into one of the paddocks to check on a sick dinosaur.
  • A realistic ancient environment filled with prehistoric sounds and noises.
  • An all new Jurassic Park themed soundtrack by Ryan Gabriel Camus.
  • New and constantly updated top notch Ai with hunting, herding and mating available for dinosaurs.

                                                       About The Developer

Jurassic Genetics has been in development since early 2013 going through various stages of production and head managers and had part of its team leave to make a different game but in march 2014 development of jurassic genetics picked up again under the direction of a new manager, with now 3 released playable demos available for download. we expect to release the full game between October 2014 and january 2015.






This project is very important to us because we are big fans of jurassic park of which the game is based.  By helping us fund the project and reach 0ur goal of $1000 you will help pay for new team members who will only work for money. Since we are looking for top notch quality its very important to us that we have nothing but the best in terms of quality. You will help us make a great game worth your money and time. The game will be released on the Unity engine for PC. With possible plans for porting to Mac.

story:
Movies and television shows have been vehicles of thought-provoking historical fiction for decades. Meanwhile, the vast majority of video games about real events have focused on action-packed battle scenes and military strategy. Imagination is the Only Escape will be the first game to focus on the human element of one of the world’s worst atrocities: the Holocaust.

Understanding the mental toll the Holocaust took on the victims — especially children — is pivotal in a global society. As the main character, Samuel, users will have somewhat of a front-row seat into the horror of the Nazi Army’s occupation of Paris and persecution of Jewish families.


Imagination will not only have users thinking about the people involved, but the goal of the game is to inspire more people to research and learn about the Holocaust. As the old saying goes: “Those who don’t know history are doomed to repeat it.” Video games are often seen as meaningless distractions for children, but Imagination has the opportunity to blaze a trail for other games that look to tackle controversial, but important topics.


The story starts off before the Occupation of France by Nazi Germany. The player is introduced to the main character, a Jewish boy named Samuel who is playing with his friends, going to school, and living a normal life in Paris. However, when France is invaded by the Nazis, Samuel and his family are soon forced to wear the yellow star of David on their clothes.

The scene changes to the Vel' d'Hiv Roundup, the mass arrest of Jews in Paris that took place on July 16, 1942. During the chaos Samuel's mother tells him to escape the city. She takes off his star so he can't be recognized as a Jew, and gives him the address of a Catholic priest who can help him escape Paris and the occupied part of France. As Samuel escapes, his mother is spotted and killed as he is able to escape.

Samuel starts his journey to find the priest, sneaking his way through Paris. Samuel soon finds him, and is smuggled out to southern France. They arrive at a small village hidden in a forest, where the villagers are passing off Jewish children from all over France as Christian orphans, and soon Samuel meets a fox who tells him that if he helps her he will be able to see his mother again.



The story follows Samuel, a young Jewish child who is trying to escape the horrors of the Nazi occupation. He creates a mysterious world in his mind in order to escape reality. You will play as him throughout his childhood during the occupation of France by Nazi Germany.


While exploring a forest near the village, Samuel is being passed off as a Christian orphan. He discovers a Fox named Renard who tells him that if he helps her restore peace to the forest, she can bring his mother back to life. Samuel trusts her because it’s his only hope to see his mother alive.


Imagination is the Only Escape is a educational adventure game for iOS, Android, PC, Mac and Ouya. Unlike other games set during thatperiod the player will feel how it is to be a vulnerable child.



"Video games can be an excellent medium to educate players, particularly children, about topics that might be too dry or overwhelming for them to learn another way. Given the alarming number of people who believe the Holocaust to be a hoax, Bernard's game seems like an especially good idea."

Wired.com

"Books, TV shows and movies are all "allowed" to talk about the Holocaust. Video games deserve to do so as well. When a game like Imagination Is The Only Escape, which doesn't even promote a sliver of violence, is considered too risque', it only shows how prehistoric everybody's views on games are, and highlights just how badly things need to change if we ever want to see companies bold enough to bring us more than Madden and a hundred FPS'."

Destructoid.com 

Personally, I think this is absurd. As a kid, I was fascinated by the Holocaust, and I think making this material more accessible for children is more than a good idea; it's downright essential. If this is the only way some people will learn about something so important as the Holocaust, then this game should absolutely see the light of day. Not to mention I find it incredibly hard to stomach that a game educating people about the events of the Holocaust is under fire, when there are so many games glorifying the violent aspects of the war.

Kotaku.com 

"Imagination Is The Only Escape is a game we should all be backing, even if the odds are against it. We should be showing the world and letting companies like Nintendo know we want games to tackle a wide and interesting variety of subject matter. Games can be brave and daring as well, and we should be daring enough to give them a chance."

Destructoid.com 

Still, such games with higher messages are desperately needed in an industry clamoring for respect. If Imagination truly lives up to its potential, then it is exactly the type of game that needs release in the US. 

Gamepolitics.com

Luc Bernard is an independent Videogame Director currently living in New York City. He has worked as a design consultant on Pocket God: The Runs, and has also contributed to many other titles, including Reaper, SteamPirates and the critically acclaimed Mecho Wars. Mecho Wars was lauded by critics as an engaging, beautiful, groundbreaking game in the turn-based-strategy genre. In 2010, the game was nominated in the Best Handheld Audio category during the Game Audio Network Guild Awards. Luc’s games can be played on a variety of formats, ranging from iPhone to PlayStation 3. With an incredibly unique visual style and a passionate attitude toward direction, Luc has a wonderful approach to modern gaming. The experience of discovery and exploration is inspiring to him, and he strives to leave a lasting impression on his audience.


Contact: lucbernard26@gmail.com

story:
The Gods Have Returned...

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface it is no different than the world you and I live in. Most people go on about their lives never realizing the terrors that walk among them.
Despite humanity’s vast ignorance, the horrors are there. Angels and demons make war in the shadows. Hellspawn serve their demonic masters. Ancient gods, once imprisoned in a dark realm called Oblitus, now walk the Earth, seeking followers to help regain their former glory.

There's a war in the shadows....but for how much longer?

Rise of the Ilu

Rise of the Ilu is a 192-page supplement for the Contagion Second Edition Role-Playing Game published by Aegis Studios. This full-color supplement will include rules for playing members of the Ilu race, or as humans call them: gods. Whether a Gamemaster wishes to introduce the Ilu as a shadowy threat in the background, or run a campaign in which players assume the roles of these ancient deities, Rise of the Ilu includes everything you need to take your Contagion Second Edition campaign to a celestial level!

Rise of the Ilu contains:

  • Two new playable races: the celestial Ilu and their half-mortal children, the Ikkibu.
  • A dozen new feats for celestial characters
  • Fifty new spells unveiling the cosmic power of the Ilu.

Cover Layout by Travis Legge. Illustration by Joe Calkins, Cerberus Illustration, used with permission.

    In 2013, we came here, to IndieGoGo, to ask for YOUR help in making the Contagion Second Edition Corebook happen. Through your support, we were able to complete that project and it has gone on to be the MOST SUCCESSFUL BOOK Aegis Studios has EVER released!

    So we are back here asking you to help us do it again. Rise of the Ilu is an ambitious project and we want to craft the highest quality book for our players and fans. Your support, whether by pre-ordering the book here, donating just a single dollar, or even simply sharing the campaign link on your social media, can help us turn this ambition into reality.

    What We Need & What You Get

    Our basic goal will go towards acquiring a few key elements we need in order to make Rise of the Ilu a success. Your support will go toward:

    • Hiring freelance writers to flesh out the world of the Ilu.
    • Acquiring quality art for the full-color interior of the book.
    • Providing print copies to our backers.

    Which brings us to the REALLY fun part: the perks!


    We are offering a wide range of perks for your support. Through this campaign, you can acquire digital or print copies of existing Contagion Second Edition products at discount prices, a game session run by Contagion developer Travis Legge via Skype or Google Hangouts, signed print bundles of Contagion products, the Contagion Second Edition Print Omnibus, which collects various supplements that have previously been digital-only releases and is available ONLY to backers on our crowdfunding projects, and much much more!

    Cover Layout by Travis Legge. Illustration by Joe Calkins, Cerberus Illustration, used with permission.

    For full details be sure to check out the perks section of the page, and do not hesitate to contact us with any questions!

    We will also be unveiling new stretch goals once we meet the base goal! Help us get there!

    PLEASE NOTE: Perks are not cumulative, and only include the items listed in each individual perk. Please double-check to ensure you are receiving the perk you want.

      The Impact

      Your support with this project will help us bring a quality product to our fans. By sharing this project, you just might introduce someone new to tabletop role-playing, modern horror storytelling or the urban fantasy genre. Every dollar helps us make a better product and YOUR support makes all the difference in the world to us. We've been down this road before with the Contagion Second Edition Corebook, which turned out beautifully! We can do it again, with your help!

      Risks & Challenges

      The majority of the system development for Rise of the Ilu is complete. The risk factor for supporting this endeavor is very low. Whether we only raise a dollar, or if we raise 10 TIMES our base goal, this book will come out. We will keep our backers updated on the progress as the book comes together. Based on previous publishing experience, I believe we have set our delivery dates far enough out to give us significant time to wrap up production and get the books delivered ON TIME!

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Even if you cannot contribute, you can be a MASSIVE help to us by:

        • SHARING THIS CAMPAIGN! Share it everywhere! Share it on all your social media sites using the share tools above! Tell your friends, fellow gamers, and the staff at the local brick-and-mortar hobby shop! Spread the word!
        • Like the ContagionRPG page on Facebook for news & updates!
        • Visit DriveThruRPG, which is the EXCLUSIVE sales outlet for all Aegis Studios products! If you DO get any of our products, be sure to rate & review them on the site!

 walk among them.Despite humanity’s vast ignorance, the horrors are 
there. Angels and demons make war in the shadows. Hellspawn serve their 
demonic masters. Ancient gods, once imprisoned in a dark realm called Oblitus, now walk the Earth, seeking followers to help regain their former glory.
There's a war in the shadows....but for how much longer?

Rise of the Ilu
Rise of the Ilu is a 192-page supplement for the Contagion Second Edition Role-Playing Game published by Aegis Studios. This full-color supplement will include rules for playing members of the Ilu race, or as humans call them: gods. Whether a Gamemaster wishes to introduce the Ilu as a shadowy threat in the background, or run a campaign in which players assume the roles of these ancient deities, Rise of the Ilu includes everything you need to take your Contagion Second Edition campaign to a celestial level!
 Rise of the Ilu contains: 
Two new playable races: the celestial Ilu and their half-mortal children, the Ikkibu. A dozen new feats for celestial characters
 Fifty new spells unveiling the cosmic power of the Ilu.



Cover Layout by Travis Legge. Illustration by Joe Calkins, Cerberus Illustration, used with permission. 

In 2013, we came here, to IndieGoGo, to ask for YOUR help in making the Contagion Second Edition Corebook happen. Through your support, we were able to complete that project and it has gone on to be the MOST SUCCESSFUL BOOK Aegis Studios has EVER released!So we are back here asking you to help us do it again. Rise of the Ilu is an ambitious project and we want to craft the highest quality book for our players and fans. Your support, whether by pre-ordering the book here, donating just a single dollar, or even simply sharing the campaign link on your social media, can help us turn this ambition into reality. 
  What We Need & What You Get Our basic goal will go towards acquiring a few key elements we need in order to make Rise of the Ilu a success. Your support will go toward: 
Hiring freelance writers to flesh out the world of the Ilu.
 Acquiring quality art for the full-color interior of the book. 
 Providing print copies to our backers.

Which brings us to the REALLY fun part: the perks!
We are offering a wide range of perks for your support. Through this campaign, you can acquire digital or print copies of existing Contagion Second Edition products at discount prices, a game session run by Contagion developer Travis Legge via Skype or Google Hangouts, signed print bundles of Contagion products, the Contagion Second Edition Print Omnibus, which collects various supplements that have previously been digital-only releases and is available ONLY to backers on our crowdfunding projects, and much much more! 


Cover Layout by Travis Legge. Illustration by Joe Calkins, Cerberus Illustration, used with permission. 
For full details be sure to check out the perks section of the page, and do not hesitate to contact us with any questions!We will also be unveiling new stretch goals once we meet the base goal! Help us get there!
PLEASE NOTE: Perks are not cumulative, and only include the items listed in each individual perk. Please double-check to ensure you are receiving the perk you want. 

  The Impact Your support with this project will help us bring a quality product to our fans. By sharing this project, you just might introduce someone new to tabletop role-playing, modern horror storytelling or the urban fantasy genre. Every dollar helps us make a better product and YOUR support makes all the difference in the world to us. We've been down this road before with the Contagion Second Edition Corebook, which turned out beautifully! We can do it again, with your help!
  Risks & Challenges  The majority of the system development for Rise of the Ilu is complete. The risk factor for supporting this endeavor is very low. Whether we only raise a dollar, or if we raise 10 TIMES our base goal, this book will come out. We will keep our backers updated on the progress as the book comes together. Based on previous publishing experience, I believe we have set our delivery dates far enough out to give us significant time to wrap up production and get the books delivered ON TIME! 
  Other Ways You Can Help Even if you cannot contribute, you can be a MASSIVE help to us by: 
SHARING THIS CAMPAIGN! Share it everywhere! Share it on all your social media sites using the share tools above! Tell your friends, fellow gamers, and the staff at the local brick-and-mortar hobby shop! Spread the word!
 Like the ContagionRPG page on Facebook for news & updates!
Visit DriveThruRPG, which is the EXCLUSIVE sales outlet for all Aegis Studios products! If you DO get any of our products, be sure to rate & review them on the site!

story:
First off, we'd like to give the community an idea of who and what we are. The easy answer is, we're just gamers like you!  Our lives have been impacted greatly by video games, and in a positive way.  From the Atari 2600 to the Nintendo Entertainment System, all the way to current gen consoles and PC games.  We live, eat, and breathe pixels!

About a year ago, we realized there really wasn't a place to go to hang out and simply play a wide array of video games with others like us.  I mean sure there are LAN parties with our friends, but lugging around my rig and consoles isn't exactly the easiest thing in the world.  My cables and set-up in my home took hours to meticulously set-up and ensure cables are run the correct way.  Undoing all of that isn't my idea of a good time.



So we decided to bring the South Korean phenomenon known as PC Bangs (PC방) to Columbus, Ohio. In South Korea, they are at every corner of every street with thousands of gamers congregating to play the latest and greatest PC games at a low pay per hour rate.

But computers and licenses for all the great games we want to offer the community, on our DEDICATED NO-LAG FIBER-CONNECTION is not cheap, and we need your help to become a reality!


We will also have a Bubble Tea/Smoothie station that you can order from in person, or from your gaming station!






Did we mention weekly tournaments in our shop with prizes?!  That's right, we WILL have MAJOR tournaments based on the most popular games out right now!  League of Legends, Starcraft 2, SMITE, Call of Duty & More!  On top of all that, we will also have retro-tournies such as Super Smash Bros 64 and 007 Goldeneye! (Golden gun anyone?!)

With the sponsors, affiliates and support of the developers, you can expect Tournament skins, promotional gear, and of course other great prizes such as Video Games, Game Cards, In-Store-Hours, and CASH!




What's better than tournament play?  How about joining a League with quarterly prizes for the best of the best!  The League system will allow local teams to register and compete outside of tournaments!  Did we mention that it's 100% free to sign up for the League?  While tournaments will have buy-ins, joining a league will give you a chance at earning prizes and free game-time just like a tournament would!




What would a PC Bang be without exclusive events for those special occassions we all love!  Major Video Game release events will allow everyone to BEGIN playing at the stroke of midnight the latest and greatest video game with NO INSTALLATION WAIT TIME, or even the drive home from the store.. Why waste time on such trivial tasks, when you can countdown with 2GM and possibly even WIN a copy of the video game being released!


Special Events aren't limited video game releases.  Anytime a game is undergoing a major tournament (Summoner's Cup anyone?!), we will be sure to have big screen TV's streaming their performance with pizza, drinks and more!




We need to raise, at minimum, an additional $20,000 on top of the large sum we have already acquired over the last 2 years!  While this does seem like a lot, we will go half a million dollars in debt on day 1 of opening!

While we of course hope to meet and far exceed our goal, if we do not we are NOT going to give up!  This is our dream in the making with thousands of hours spent fine tuning the business to what it will become!

This entire operation is designed around building a place for everyone to come together as gamers, and work towards common goals.  Even if it's as small as finding a group to play with or as big as winning the next tournament or even going Pro and being Sponsored by 2GM, we want to create an environment for all of us that will change your life for the better!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word about this campaign and our upcoming shop that will premiere near OSU Campus in Columbus, OH!
  • Also please like and share our facebook page here: www.facebook.com/2GMPCBang


The Lifetime Epic Membership Card explained

  • This exclusive perk is limited to 10
  • This card NEVER expires and can be transferred to another person up to 1 time per year!  In 50 years you can pass it down to your children, or sell it online/in-person, and it will still be valid.
  • The card will have a VERY UNIQUE look to it and will never be sold again!
  • If your card gets damaged, you simply bring it into any 2GM shop and it can be replaced. 
  • Because this Epic Membership Card is linked to your very own account; if you happen to LOSE your card, you can request a new card at any one of our 2GM shops.  
  • Normal fees apply for lost or damaged cards.

Because this Epic Membership Card is linked to your very own account; if you happen to LOSE your card, you can request a new card at any one of our 2GM shops.  
Normal fees apply for lost or damaged cards.

story:
- You know who we are. You know what we've been through to get here.

 

Our community's been around for almost 5 years now & it's not going anywhere. When I mentioned that we were bringing back teamspeak & making a website a bunch of people offered to throw money at me without question. Taking funds in that way seemed distasteful, but I wanted to open the opportunity to contribute to the guild up to everyone instead of just a few people.

No contribution is required of course, but every little bit helps!

Thanks to Rio & Kyban's efforts we currently have a teamspeak for free! But it costs about ~$193 / year for the domain & website. Which are important parts of how we do recruitment & keep the quality of our members high!

I haven't & never will take a cent from anyone for my personal use. Everything, the funds, my efforts, & anything extra we raise is and always will be for the community!

 

If you have any questions feel free to ask me on TS or in-game!

See you in Tyria,

 - Pseudo

 - Pseudo

story:
Project Ultra is a survival game where you get to work in a Norwegian reverse engineering program of an alien spacecraft and sell alien technology to the Russians, and all kinds of crazy s*** like that.

This game is based on the UFO conspiracy as a whole.

https://www.crazy-dog.fi/

NOTE: I have selected the Flexible Goal as any amount of money can help, the 250k would assure the quality of the finished product by hiring, for example, a graphics designer but I don't need a team to make this game happen, I can always just buy Unity-assets to make the development a bit easier and less time-consuming.

You can download the demo from here https://www.mediafire.com/file/l0i5zrmowmc9ul6/...

 

Short Summary

  • I have some educational background and experience in game development in Unity.
  • This is a kind of game I would definitely play myself, humorous game design, lots of stuff to do, some hidden background story in the game.
  • The funding will be spent on hiring a small team.
  • The game will be developed with Steam Early Access format.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding will be spent on hiring a small team so it doesn't take me forever to make this game, and of course the software and hardware needed to make this game and if needed I'll rent an office for my employees. Probably some Unity assets and of course Unity Pro, 3D-modeling software etc..
  • Lots of stuff to do in the game, for example, you can rob stores, buy a computer which allows you to acquire skills needed to get a job (the ufo reverse engineering program), sell drugs to junkies, selling alien tech for the Russians, get drunk, buy cars, fly an alien spacecraft, get arrested and thrown in jail where you can gamble.
  • If I don't reach my minimum goal I'll use the money on buying Unity Assets and for getting the game on Steam once the first playable version is ready.

The Impact

  • If I reach the goal, I can hire a team of professionals (2-3 employees), I need at least a graphics designer and a coder specialized in Unity.
  • I have some experience in game development and coding so I'd say I know what I'm doing.
  • The Early Access format gives me more freedom during the development and makes it possible to listen to your suggestions and implement them.

Risks & Challenges

  • The only risk I'd say is that I don't receive enough funding to hire a team, I can however continue the project even without funding but then I would need to rely on Unity assets.
  • If I receive the funding the challenge will be leading the team and deciding what which employee does next. And of course, providing a playable version of the game within a year.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give money for the project but want to see the game happen, the free way to support the project is to share it with your friends. Preferably use the provided Indiegogo tools to share.

story:
A group of monsters gather around the table to play their favorite game: “Voodoo Madness”. They set up a table with six voodoo dolls, each linked to a different monster.

Each player plays as a voodoo doll. Your goal is to reveal the identities of your opponents, or destroy them before they reveal yours.

Voodoo dolls target each other with object cards. Each object in the game is linked to a particular monster’s weakness. The last unidentified voodoo doll standing wins the game!














Around 4.5% of people are colorblind, we added some symbols to the object cards that will help them have a guide.


The games will be shipped to fulfillment centers around the world in order to keep shipping costs low. Our research has shown that this is the best and most cost-effective method for fulfillment.

Since Monsters' Party: Voodoo Madness’ value is under EU €22 / GBP £15 / CAD $20 / $21 it is exempt from VAT/HST in most countries. Backers in France, Sweden, Denmark, Greece and Romania have low (or no) VAT fee thresholds, so please select the "Join the EU Party!!!" reward tier. Remote addresses might incur extra charges. However, these are rare cases. Contact us if you’re worried!


If you're a retailer, please contact "Yo" at monstersparty@outlook.com during the campaign for pricing information.


"IN’sanity Games?" was born when we realized we had too many great ideas, and couldn’t bear to let them gather dust any longer. We’ve been creating and developing boardgames for 14 years now!" We’ve done a lot of research, worked tirelessly for several months, playtested the game, and improved upon it multiple times before starting the campaign process. Now, you can get your game, as we are already working on it!


Collaborator 


Sponsor


Risks and challenges

Fulfillment: 
Fulfillment can be a frightening prospect for a first-timer. That’s why we asked for help from experienced and successful developers on this site. This is what turned us on to the “China method” (Shipping directly from china to fulfillment centers around the world).

Our method is not new and has been used successfully by other developers. Our fulfillment company has the experience to deliver your games, and just to be sure, we will have some backups to ensure 100% fulfillment!

Finally, we are keeping the rewards simple. We do not want to take more time than necessary to complete the shipping. We want you to get the game as soon as possible!

Manufacturing: 
Our manufacturer, WinGo Games, has extensive experience in game manufacturing. They are also close in proximity and friendly with our fulfillment company, which will ensure a smooth and fast fulfillment once our games leave the factory.

Game design & Art: 
Design and art are 100% complete for the basic game. This means we are saving as much time as we can and you won’t have to wait long for your game! 
We are in the manufacturing process already!

story:
Game Description

This is the most incredible game that you've ever seen, as it completely revolutionizes the way you play a puzzle game. So arm yourself with your creativity and solve the various ingenious levels designed by the creative developers.

                 

Do you like to play? That's a whole new way to have fun and solve intricate puzzles with the use of your finger. 

Have all of your creativity and get comfortable, because this is a game is both exciting and fun, but not necessarily be easy. 

The Tomorrow Artist is a physics-puzzel game with an addition of creativity never seen, so there will be lots of levels, various items to use, but above all, a million ways to solve the same level !!


      


In each level the task will be to get the ball in the basket, drawing the solution, so the solution will be different for each of you. However to complete each level the better, we must:

  • Take all three star rating
  • Use less paint as possible
  • Solve the level in the shortest time possible

                                        

Levels

Each group of levels will have special features and various special items referring to the theme of the package of levels, for example:

Blocks Red, Blue, Green

   


Teleportation, Transformers, Lasers, Alarms, Electricity


      


Menu

Another essential feature of the game is easy and intuitive menu interface currently has 5 languages:
  • English
  • Espanol
  • Italiano
  • Français
  • Deutsch
Navigation through the menus is simple but fun, here are some screenshots of the main menu:

              

              


This is only a brief description of the game, but be aware that there will be more: 

Score in the levels of friends on Facebook 
Sharing Achievements 
Shop for paint brushes or ink 

and more ...


About Me and Campaign

I am an independent developer of mobile applications, primarily games, and use the Corona SDK and Marmalade SDK as the core software, it is my greatest passion. In fact I have already made several successful games. 

I started this campaign to raise the funds necessary in order for my app to reach the level of other similar games such as Cut the Rope, Angry Birds, etc ... 

The game is already in a good place, but with the money that I'll be able to pick up I will try to improve it further.


What We Need & What You Get


I put $ 3,000 in order to make you understand that the game needs a little push in the big universe of app. First I want to explain how i will use the capital reached: 

  • 20% Improved graphics and animation 
  • 20% Adding extra functions and production for additional platforms
  • 20% Marketing and Promotion 
  • 40% Perks, shipping costs 


Here are my main goals to be achieved: 

$ 250 Launch Android version 

$ 500 Store and Facebook Integration 

$ 1500 Launch version for IOS 

$ 2,000 Other 20 more levels for the initial launch 

$ 2,500 Other 50 more levels for the initial launch


Here are some of Perks for Contributors:


Physical Perks Coming Soon!


    Risks & Challenges

    The Android version of the game is pretty much finished, so the launch of the game will take place in any case, however, a greater contribution will help the game to take off and get to other games of the same level as Cut The Rup.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Anyway, make know that this new game is coming, to your friends, visit the website or the page on twitter and watch various videos before launch. Your every contribution possible a huge help for me and for the game, and do not forget the sharing tools to top.


    Contact

    You can contact me to ask for anything or suggest anything to my e-mail: 

    stany2011@gmail.com 

    or Twitter account of the game: 

    @TomorrowArtist 

    or on the website: 

    http://stany2010.wix.com/thetomorrowartist

I am an independent developer of mobile applications, primarily games, and use the Corona SDK and Marmalade SDK as the core software, it is my greatest passion. In fact I have already made several successful games. 
I started this campaign to raise the funds necessary in order for my app to reach the level of other similar games such as Cut the Rope, Angry Birds, etc ... 
The game is already in a good place, but with the money that I'll be able to pick up I will try to improve it further.

   What We Need & What You Get 

I put $ 3,000 in order to make you understand that the game needs a little push in the big universe of app. First I want to explain how i will use the capital reached: 


20% Improved graphics and animation 

20% Adding extra functions and production for additional platforms

20% Marketing and Promotion 

40% Perks, shipping costs 



Here are my main goals to be achieved: 
$ 250 Launch Android version 
$ 500 Store and Facebook Integration 
$ 1500 Launch version for IOS 
$ 2,000 Other 20 more levels for the initial launch 
$ 2,500 Other 50 more levels for the initial launch
Here are some of Perks for Contributors:











Physical Perks Coming Soon!



  Risks & Challenges  The Android version of the game is pretty much finished, so the launch of the game will take place in any case, however, a greater contribution will help the game to take off and get to other games of the same level as Cut The Rup.
  Other Ways You Can Help 
Anyway, make know that this new game is coming, to your friends, visit the website or the page on twitter and watch various videos before launch. Your every contribution possible a huge help for me and for the game, and do not forget the sharing tools to top.Contact
You can contact me to ask for anything or suggest anything to my e-mail: 
stany2011@gmail.com 
or Twitter account of the game: 
@TomorrowArtist 
or on the website: 
http://stany2010.wix.com/thetomorrowartist

story:
Art of Atari Signed Edition Book

THE BOOK IS ALREADY PRINTED AND READY TO SHIP AS SOON AS THE CAMPAIGN ENDS! 

  • An Amazing Tome of Nostalgic Atari Art Collected in a Beautiful Hardcover Edition
  • Relive the Golden Age of Video Games with a Unique and Loving Look Back
  • Signed Tim Lapetino Tip-in Plate
  • Exclusive IndieGogo Atari Missile Command 8x10 Lithograph
  • 352 Pages of Incredible Full Color Art
  • Atari is Developing a New Generation Video Game Console 

The Story of Atari

ATARI is one of the most recognized names in the world. Since its formation in 1972, the company pioneered hundreds of iconic titles including Asteroids, Centipede and Missile Command. In addition to hundreds of games created for arcades, home video systems, and computers, original artwork was specially commissioned to enhance the Atari experience, further enticing children and adults to embrace and enjoy the new era of electronic entertainment. ART OF ATARI is the first official collection of such artwork. Sourced from museums and private collections worldwide, this book spans over 40 years of the company's unique illustrations used in packaging, advertisements, catalogs, and more!

The IndieGogo Exclusive Missile Command Lithograph

  • Representing Atari's Classic Missile Command Artwork
  • 8" x 10" Dimensions Perfect for Framing
  • Archival Quality Paper and Printing
  • Exclusive to IndieGogo

Final print image pending licensor approval.  

Atari Comic Books

  • Centipede #1-3
  • Swordquest #0 - 4
  • Atari Classics Swordquest Mini Comics Graphic Novel Collection

Atari Poster Book

  • Classic Atari Video Game Art Ready for Framing
  • 40 Unique 12 " x 16" Prints
  • Millipede 2600, Star Raiders 520, RealSports Baseball 5200, Missile Command 2600, Centipede 2600, 3D Tic-Tac-Toe Asteroids 2600, Basketball 2600, Asteroids 5200, Centipede 5200, Asteroids 7800, Combat Two, Demons To Diamonds, Crystal Castles, Football 2600, Haunted House, Haunted House (Unused), Home Run, Missile Command 5200, SwordQuest Fireworld, RealSports Tennis, RealSports Baseball, Surround, RealSports Basketball 2600, Video Checkers, RealSports Soccer 5200, RealSports Volleybal, SwordQuest Airworld, AtariAge SwordQuest Cover, Video Pinball, SwordQuest Waterworld, RealSports Basketball 5200, RealSports Football 2600, Star Raiders 2600off, Super Breakout 2600, Tempest 2600, Warlords, Yars' Revenge, Warlords Family, and the Atari Wizard

Shipping in Time for the Holidays

  • Books are already printed
  • Signed Tip-In Sheets are On-Hand
  • All Inventory Digital and Print is ready to ship in time for holiday gifts

The Perks

Video Game Veteran - $60 
At this level you will receive the beautiful Art of Atari Hardcover Edition with Tim Lapetino signed tip-in plate!  You'll also receive a digital edition of Art of Atari and the IndieGogo Exclusive 8x10 Missile Command Lithograph for your collection.  These items are on hand and ready to ship out as soon as the program closes! Shipping detailed on perk levels.

 

Digital Destiny - $25
At this level you'll receive a beautiful digital edition of the Art of Atari fulfilled by Dynamite Digital.  This DRM free edition features all the amazing Atari art of yesteryear in a handy edition you can store on your devices. 

 

8-Bit Warrior  -  $80
Relive the fantastic art of Atari with these 40 beautiful ready-to-frame 12" x 16" prints representing the most dynamic images from Atari's classic video game library!  Surround yourself with vibrant imagery from the original home video game system.  Shipping detailed on perk levels.

Swordquest Swashbuckler - $90
At this level we add the colorful graphic novel collection Atari Classics: Swordquest Trade Paperback to the mix.   The Swordquest mini-comics originally packaged with the Atari cartridges of their namesake are gloriously remastered and collected in a trade paperback for long-waiting fans to enjoy!  Shipping detailed on perk levels.

 

The Complete Atari Fan Bundle - $110
We add eight collectible comic books to your unbeatable Atari Fan Bundle including Centipede #1-3 and Swordquest #0-4! This bundle is perfect for holiday gift giving and includes all of the items from the lower pledge levels.  Shipping detailed on perk levels.

 

Original Art & Autograph - $150
The ultimate Atari fan level - we add an original Centipede remarked hand sketched edition by Ken Haeser and signed by Max Bemis (of the band Say Anything)!  Now in addition to all the perks of the previous levels you will receive a one of a kind original collectible as well!  Only 10 sets available.  Shipping detailed on perk levels.

story:
A brand new Super Nintendo game!

Final game will feature unique levels 

Exclusive Indiegogo rewards!

This campaign is for the newest Super Nintendo game... "Justice Beaver".  We at CollectorVision Games are all huge fans of the classic SNES system, and we want to continue to breath new life into this great retro console by releasing a new SNES game for it! The quality of this game, both gameplay-wise and production-wise, will meet or exceed your expectations. 

Justice Beaver was initially influenced by a great game called Rick Dangerous, however we have listened to the fans, and we are now making this game completely unique, including one of a kind level designs and new gameplay.

 It'll feature four challenging levels with colorful graphics, fun gameplay and challenging enough to warrant high replayability.  Justice Beaver uses both a gun and bombs for weapons, and it's his goal to save the world from some evil saboteurs. It's up to you to help him along the way. 

It's our goal at CollectorVision Games to produce a quality product that you're excited to own and play, as much as we are excited to produce for you. 

This project isn't licensed, endorsed or affiliated with Nintendo. All rights reserved.  


Why the $20,000 goal is significant. 

Producing new games for old consoles isn't cheap.  We have to pay for the artist, programer, designer, cart, box, PCB board, label, shipping, fees etc.  By reaching the $20,000 goal, it will help significantly in releasing this game on time, as well as help us financially to focus on other great new games.  Everything we make we put right back into new projects for you guys!  If we don't reach our $20,000 goal Justice Beaver will still be produced and come out, so don't worry about that.  It just may take us a little longer to sell other games to get to the finical ability to produce Justice Beaver as we want it. 

Limited Edition Red Cart (only 150 available). Comes complete with game/box/manual: 


Limited Edition Indiegogo Exclusive Blue Cart (only 100 available). Comes complete with game/box/manual, and your name in the game manual as an exclusive backer (SOLD OUT): 


Stretch Goal: If this campaign meets or exceeds $30,000, we'll port Justice Beaver to the Game Boy Advance!

Title Screen:

Screenshot of the first level:

Screenshots from level 2: 


T-Shirt: 



What We Need & What You Get

Your support will help push this game faster to the market, and will help breath new life into one of the best retro game consoles of all time…the Super Nintendo!  

Risks & Challenges

It is our goal to produce Justice Beaver for the SNES no matter what.  It costs a lot of money to produce new games for old platforms including but not limited to the costs of the carts, boxes, manuals, boards, development etc. Justice Beaver WILL come out regardless of how this campaign does, however by meeting our exceeding our $20,000 goal, it will greatly improve the speed as to when the game will be available, and it will greatly help in covering production costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign through your social media links including but not limited to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Myspace etc.

story: The players in the Prospects Academy train and play year round together with the goal of reaching college and/or professional baseball. One of the biggest highlights of the year for the players and the team is the annual showcase trip to the North Atlanta Open in Atlanta, GA, in May. It is an incredible opportunity to play some of the absolute best high school competition in North America, as well as play at the prestigious and beautiful East Cobb facility. The players will be playing a 100 Inning Game to fundraise for this event and asking for your support! The money will go towards flights, meals on the road, and tournament fees. The Academy has participated in this tournament the past two years and it has been a great experience. Thank you for your support!

story:
Lokahi

Team Lokahi is a U-10 soccer team in AYSO's Region 48 Diamond Head, Hawaii. Under the guidance of Head Coach David and Assistant Coach Sandi, these girls are gaining soccer skills and learning lessons that foster their confidence both on and off the soccer field.

2014 National Games

This year, AYSO is celebrating 50 years of providing "world class youth soccer programs that enrich children's lives". The 2014 National Games will be in Torrance and Riverside, CA during the week of June 29 - July 7, 2014.

Team Lokahi will be sending nine girls to represent Hawaii and experience the epitome of AYSO's vision, mission and philosophies.

The girls of team Lokahi need your help to offset the costs of getting to the games and covering game fees. Each of the girls' round-trip ticket between Honolulu and Southern California will cost at least $700!

Help Get the Word Out!

Please share this with your friends and family. Every little bit will help us get closer to our goal.

Mahalo nui loa for helping team Lokahi proudly represent AYSO Region 48 Diamond Head at this year's National Games!
