story:
Update: All who contribute get Mithril and Green dragon mount within 48 hours (or sooner) from funding time. 

Rest of rewards after funding finishes.

 

THE OLD SCHOOL MMO RPG RETURNS

Do you remember Ultima Online, early days of Everquest 1 or other games from that era?

Do you remember the days when MMO Role-Playing Games were actually about RPG, deep immersion in the game world and a community of like minded players?

We teamed up to create a new old-school MMO RPG which brings all that back.

World of Midgard is a multi-platform, old-school 3D MMO RPG core game, the kind you used to enjoy in the past, now about to be brought to your Mac & PC and mobile devices (Android, iOS).

All players will play on the same servers.

How many times you wished to be able to take your PC or Mac game with you? 

Well now you are about to be able to.

Click here to download beta version of the game for Mac & PC, Android & iOS 

Because of long apple approval times iOS beta version has still old user interface. We plan to have Linux beta version next month.

Guys and Gals we need funding to make HD graphics upgrade (HD textures) so game can look awesome on big Mac & PC monitors, and on best tablets&phones.

 

 

Read what others have said about World of Midgard

"And you've seen a lot of them offering to let you play on both mobile devices and on your desktop...

Wait, that part is kind of new. And if it appeals to you, you should probably take a look at..."

Original article is here

 

"It's crazy what we're starting to see on mobile devices as the performance gap closes more and more with each iteration of mobile technology."

"Back in the day when I was playing EverQuest, Dark Age of Camelot [...] I never thought I'd be playing something that looked even remotely similar on my phone. Enter World of Midgard..."

Original article is here

 

"There are dungeons as well as raid dungeons, PvP arenas, mounts, gear sets, quests, lot and lots of items and pretty much everything you expect to find in an MMORPG. This one is also cross-platform compatible..."

Original article is here

 

Check those fan-made videos and see for yourself how great fun people are already having from the beta version. 

Watch: 8-man guild raid: Open world boss Oughust 

 

Watch: 5-man Dread Basilica Dungeon Guild Run 

 

Watch: 5-man Hellenic Dungeon Guild Run 

 

World of Midgard offers rich, amazing, full 3D fantasy world, together with full support for factions conflict, factions battleground, rated arenas, 10-man raiding system, and more.

On plot level, World of Midgard focuses on a conflict between the two warring faction, the Alliance and the Fury, the struggle between them, and also their fight against a common enemy, the Swarm.

The game has a deeply immersing lore, which tells the story of the past of World of Midgard’s heroes, the battles they fought, and the tale of the Schism, the Swarm, Survival & Conquest, and the Treaty of the Fallen Oak. Those who want to find out more about the game lore should check the link that enables the download of the book.

Click here to download Lore Book Sample

During your journey through the game’s world you will immerse yourself in a world inspired by Norse mythology. There are 6 playable character races: Human, Elf, and Dwarf belonging to the Alliance, and Orc, Dark Elf, and Blood Drak belonging to the Fury. In addition to selecting a race, you can choose from 5 different classes, which represent a unique style of the particular player.

The classes are: Confessors, Fighter, Mage, Rogues, and Templar. We plan to add a Ranger class next year, but your help can make it possible much faster. The game world is already huge, but it will grow even bigger with each content update -meaning  more quests, more zones, more dungeons, more mounts and more kick-ass gear sets.

And, have I mentioned that while the whole leveling game play is fun, and includes hundreds of quests in open world, solo dungeons and 5-man dungeon leveling system, the game really focuses on end of the game experience? It’s true! Therefore reaching the level cap is just the beginning of the real core game experience, which includes a very unique end-game 5-man dungeons, 10-man raids, battlegrounds, and rated arenas.

Click here to check development videos on our youtube channel

Why do we ask for help?

When you look on current version of the game on big screen like Mac or PC monitor, texture are not impressive because they were originally meant for small phone or tablet screen.

HD textures would be big Mac & PC version quality jump.

Current mobile textures are 256x256. Mac & PC would be 1024x1024+

We plan to have 512x512 textures on newer tablets with possibility to have full 1024x1024 for top end 9+ inch tablets (like new iPad or coming Google Nexus 10)

 

What do we need the money for?

We started on HD textures but cost is to big for us to make all of them.

We need to hire graphics designer to make those HD testures.

By helping us you are contributing to a fantastic project that fulfills the vision of many wonderful people; you are taking a part in this project, and you can actually shape it with your suggestions and ideas. This is a game made by gamers for gamers – please, help us keep it this way. We recommend visiting our forum at forum.worldofmidgard.com, where you can check more info and look for updates.

  • If you donate 10€ you will get game copy.
  • Same for any bigger donation

story:
Greetings!

  My name is John, co-owner of Gate Keeper Games.  We are trying to publish our new game, the highly acclaimed: The King's Armory.  We really love tower defense video games, and so we made a true tower defense board game to share.  After sharing it, The King's Armory has been so highly lauded by everyone who's played it that it seems a must to do everything possible to increase its public availability.  (But don't take our word for it, see the list of reviews below.)

Therefore, this IGG campaign is specifically to help us raise funds to create excellent art for the game in order to help it reach market and draw the attention that people are saying that it deserves.  Since this campaign is not yet for the game itself, we've created a wide array of perks to choose from for your support.

100% Funded!
The campaign now acts as "Fixed Funding", therefore your pledge goes +5% further and...

Stretch Goals Announced:

If we hit $4500 - by the end of the campaign, in FOUR DAYS, we will increase the value of all "Game Credits" by $5 to a total value of $30 each!  Go tell your friends!  (Only 1 Early Bird left!)

If we hit $5500 - We will be able to reduce the cost of Minis on the KS relaunch by pre-paying for some art and molding costs!  (Exact amount TBD, but it will be at least a couple bucks per set.)  (I should also add: Getting minis involved from the very beginning has taken some very good turns this week!)

We will gladly add more Stretch Goals as these are hit.


Here, on IndieGoGo, you can get access to the full Print-n-Play and rules, so that you can play the game now!

By spreading awareness of the game, creating great art, and lowering our production goal, the official Kickstarter launch (October 2013) will be able to meet with tremendous support.

You will make the difference for The King's Armory, in making it become a reality.  Your support means the world to us.  Join the many who have already contributed and are now playing The King's Armory.

Thank you for your support.  If you have any questions, please contact us.  We're completely transparent in our plans, and love feedback and suggestions, so ask us anything you like.

Art Sample for the Digital Wallpaper and Poster Reward tiers.

Midnight, the Sorceress reward wallpaper (with watermark)

Reviews and Reactions to The King's Armory:

"The amount of variety this game provides... I mean... it's second to none."
~Rahdo - 3rd Party professional game reviewer

"I [gave] it a shot at GenCon... What really intrigued me was the list of key features: 1 to 7 players, variable game length, and --most interesting-- the ability to have players drop it and out as needed."
~Geek Dad

"We learned to play in less than 10 minutes... It's amazing, it's an awesome game!"
~Bryce S. - playtester

"We are very happy to know you're making a tower defense board game! And we are honored to have you inspired with Kingdom Rush :)"
~Ironhide Games - makers of "Kingdom Rush" & "Kingdom Rush: Frontiers"

"This game completely supports scaling mid game... it adjust dynamically... That is awesome!  Why doesn't every game do that!? ...Really really great, I just can't rave about it enough!"
~Rahdo

Much-loved Key Features

  • Strategy - mid weight
  • Add or drop a player mid-game
  • Tower Defense themes and game play
  • Co-op play (up to 7 players)
  • Solo play
  • Player vs. Player option
  • Variable play time (30 mins to 3 hours, your choice)
  • Variable and flexible rule variants (Easy mode, campaign mode, survival mode)
  • Powerful Heroes to be played
  • Humorous yet intimidating enemies
  • Tough enough for adults, clean enough for kids (recommended for 12+)

Valcor, the Warrior reward wallpaper (with watermark)

What We Need & What You Get

  We're setting out to raise $3,500 for art, graphic design, and PR/Outreach/Reviews expenses.  This amount doesn't cover all of our expnses (breakdown below), but every net dollar raised here will improve the game and reduce the funding goal for our upcoming Kickstarter.

By asking for a lower amount than our total need, IGG fees are reduced, which means more of your donation goes toward the actual cause.  (When we reach "100% funded," fees are reduced by 33%.  A set goal of $14,000 is less likely to reach 100% funding than a $3,500 one.)

Expense Breakdown:

  • $6000 Art (40% of funding) *
  • $1500 Graphic design (10% of funding) *
  • $2400 Advertising & Reviewer costs (15% of funding) *
  • $2500 Physical reward creation & shipping (20% of funding)
  • $350-1400 IGG fees (10-15% of funding)
  • $14,000 Total

*reduces Kickstarter funding goal

Rewards!

  Even though you naturally want nothing in return for your kindness, we're going to give you stuff anyway.  Here's what you stand to receive.

  • New "Wallpaper" art for your computer, iPhone, and iPad.
  • Limited Edition Poster Art of the Epic Heroes!
  • Put your face on a Hero, a Boss, or a Monster - immortalized in our game pieces & manual!  We have made several of our Hero and monster characters available; first come, first serve.
  • Kickstarter credit!, usable toward Add Ons and/or International Shipping costs on the KS relaunch!
  • Unique and useful items with our Logo and/or a Hero on it: T-Shirts, Flash Drives, iPhone cases, 2014 Calendars, and more.

Perk Tier Breakdown Below

Raphael, the Psion reward wallpaper (with watermark)

The Impact of the Game

Community - This game has been a great example of our mission as a fledgling company put into action: bringing people together with board games.  So many people have contributed ideas, art, and blood, sweat and tears to this game.  And it shows!  One of the most common comments, in fact, was gratitude for the way community was prioritized over competition or pride in the first Kickstarter campaign. (first Kickstarter? see Q&A below).

Tower Defense - There are many "Tower Defense" board games on the market.  But in the words of Rahdo, a professional non-paid reviewer:

"I don't think that there is any other Tower Defense game besides The King's Armory, that so closely emulates the game play of a straight up flash-based computer tower defense game.  I mean this game really does have it all!" 

  So, for the millions of people that enjoy online "TD" games, we are the first to bring a true re-creation, and fully playable version, of that to the board game table.  And now you get to take credit for it also.

Game Genre Shift - Why not just play TD online?  Here are our answers.

  • Social Gaming. - Playing TKA, you can be truly social, and enjoy the company of friends face-to-face..  Host a game night, meet new people, kill some orcs.
  • Unique value of board gaming - A board game offers a different level of enjoyment, control, and satisfaction from online TD gaming, no matter how good the online game.
  • TKA both ends, and doesn't. - "Huh?" - Some TD games online never end, they have endless waves; that can be fun... for a while.  But most gamers enjoy a sense of accomplishment and TKA offers that because it be conquered.  Other TD games have too few levels; TKA has endless replay value because you can always create a new game with different combinations of map tiles, new enemies, new Heroes, and new strategies.
  • Finally, if you're a parent with a child addicted to online TD, this can be a great way to gain some common ground and spend time together.  (We do what we can to support families, as we're a family run business... did you notice the bibs in the supporter perks? ; )

Perk Tier Rewards

"Tech Decor"

iPhone Fob collection (3) Silver Key, Brass Key, and Bow & Arrow; and Stat Sticker.


*Substitute "Daddy" on a bib for any relational title! (Mommy, Grandpop, Brother, etc.)
*Shirts come in 3 styles: Men's/Women's/Children's, and sizes Sm, Med, Large, XL, & XXL
*Add $5 to have any of the following phrases replace the "Tower Logo" on the back of the t-shirts.
~"My ____ is my Hero."
~"I support indie games."
~"Keep Calm and Game On." (retains rear logo, as this text is on the front side)
*Items' final designs subject to vary slightly based on final manufacturing needs.

Perk Tier Breakdown Chart

Click here to open a larger version of the above chart.
*Some perks removed do to availability reasons.

Other Ways You Can Help

  Naturally, word of mouth is the best.  Any spreading of the word is greatly appreciated.  You can follow us on Twitter @GateKeeperGamin; you can like us on Facebook, and you can copy and paste these helpful links to those sites if you're into that kinda thing...

www.GateKeeperGaming.com
Rahdo's Video Review

Slap a post on Reddit or BoardGameGeek and we'll be extra grateful!

Thank you for your time and friendship.

Stretch Goals

$3,500 - Every pledge goes 5% further, reducing IGG's cut and increasing yours.

$7,000 - All posters increase from 8x10 inches to 11x14 inches!

$10,000 - ??? TBD by backers.


Game Resources:

GateKeeperGaming.com - Official company page
Downloadable Rules Doc - Available to all
Link to Print-n-Play - Pledge to receive the access password
Rhado's video review

Game Play Video


Fun comedy short honoring board games
Fair Warning: This video is related... but not.  Just for fun.




Q & A:

Q: What happens if you go over $14,000?
A: Every buck-a-roo goes towards production costs, and thus we can and will reduce the Funding Goal of the KS game, thus making funding the game (ie: getting it in your hands) easier.  We'll also have a few extra bucks to tip our artists with. (Really looking forward to this.  No joke: 2 of our 3 main artists experienced family tragedies during our 1st campaign, but they both chose to keep working through it.  It's been a rough trip, but they're utterly amazing men, and I say they deserve applause for it.)

Q: What is *Guaranteed Art*?
A: This art will absolutely be commissioned based on your pledge.  You WILL see your face on the indicated character/monster type regardless of all else.  Period. 

Q: Game Credit, brilliant!  How does it work?
A: An email address is required for all "Game Credit" pledge levels.  At the close of IGG we will email each person their own unique 1-use "Thank You Code".  When pledging on KS at re-launch these supporters will use the "Contact me" link to send me their Thank You Code and what they would like in free stuff - worth up to $25 in Add-Ons or International Shipping.  Once the code is verified, we will act as if your KS pledge amount were increased by $25 with no actual need to increase the pledge amount at all.  It's as simple as that!
Note: Max 1 "Thank You Code" per KS account, must pledge for at least the base game level (approx $49) to use it.
Note: If you wish to give a "Game Credit" as a gift, that's fine by us, just give them your Thank You Code.  Simple as that.
**Note: This is not to be confused as a monetary return on investment, a cash gift, or any type of profit sharing.  This is simply and straight forward a promise of free stuff for pledges you give to us in advance here.  (As if we had offered the KS Add Ons now.)**

Q: Didn't I already see you on Kickstarter for TKA?
A: Yessir!  Our first attempt to Kickstart was a huge success ...except that we failed.  ...but even there, we only 'failed' in reaching our Total Goal.  Gosh, during the course of that 1st campaign we learned so much, fronted the cost for tons of art (supporting up-and-coming artists), and grew the project by leaps and bounds.  You can view the final Project Page with all the extra art not shown here, at: KS - The King's Armory Round 1.

It should be noted that we have no shame about the first campaign because it was a great bit of success ($25k and 350+ backers for a first time KS).  Now, by having this mini sub-funder (as we affectionately call it), we can reduce that ginormous funding goal, have a better round of promotion, and better economize artistic efforts, so that we blow a "reboot" out of the water.  But only with your help.

Q: I'm crazy rich but don't see a place to donate more that $450...?
A: Well, first of all, let me tell you that you look lovely today.  ...  Well, ridiculously good looking person, you can donate as much as you like, and if you have an idea for a Perk in mind that you would like in return, let us know; and I'm certain we can create a "Perk Tier" just for you.  Signed copies of stuff, trips to Tahiti that we pretend we've paid for but did so with your donation money, or even a big hug.... it's all possible.  Just let us know.

story:
Hi, Imscared fans,

my name is Ivan Zanotti and I'm a game developer. You maybe know me thanks to "Imscared - A Pixelated Nightmare", a game of mine developed 1 year ago.

To celebrate Imscared birthday, I'd love to do something unique: a more polished and stuff filled version of the game. I tought about how to create a great experience, so the awesome technology called Oculus Rift flew through my mind.

Oculus Rift is a great thing. Horror games will be much, much more immersive and scary with it. And I want Imscared to be much more than a simple "experience".
Imscared works breaking the 4th wall, trying to activate the player imagination by simple, rough graphics. I think that the Oculus Rift can enhance the "4th wall break" in many ways and I really want to try out those ideas of mine.

So, here I am, ready to develop a NEW Imscared version (also with Oculus Rift support)... But I really need your help to make this dream come true!
Right now I'm in a really bad situation, financially talking, and I can't afford the Oculus Rift to develop stuff with it. So I'm talking to all the fans that liked Imscared as much as me!

Fundings, results and perks

The thing is simple: I'm trying to reach the money necessary to get an Oculus Rift and to keep up the good work. The new game will also be playable without the Oculus Rift, in case you can't afford it. Don't worry, I don't want to disappoint anyone! =)


Anyway:
IndieGoGo can't create a campaing with a funding goal inferior than $500, so I won't only buy the Oculus Rift with those money: Like said before, I'm going to expand Imscared with new "levels" and 4th wall break events, lenghtening the game and making it more unique. Also, to help me and get cool things at the same time, here's two perks for you:

  • YOUR PORTRAIT IN THE GAME - $20 or more
    Fans that will donate $20 or more to the cause can send an E-Mail to Imscared@live.com with a personal photo: the game will contain a pixelated portrait of the backer;
  • DIGITAL GAME MANUAL - $35 or more
    Fans that will donate $35 or more to the cause will receive via E-Mail a game manual containing hints for the game secrets and curious informations about Imscared. Also, the backer can request the "Your portrait in the game" perk if he wants to!
  • YOUR MAP IN THE GAME - $60 or more
    Fans that will donate $60 or more to the cause can draw a topdown-like map to see  it as a game area in the new Imscared version.
    Please contact Imscared@live.com for more infos about this perk!


Other Ways You Can Help The Cause

Probably someone will not help the funding because he can't. I really understand it, so the only thing I'm asking You is to spred the word about this raise funding!

If You have some question (or request), please contact me!

E-Mail
Imscared@live.com

Facebook page
https://www.facebook.com/pages/MyMadness-Works/125347074231317

Follow me on Twitter
https://twitter.com/MyMadnessWorks

Play my other works on GameJolt
http://gamejolt.com/profile/ivan-zanotti/16513/


Thanks for helping, guys, ans stay tuned for new infos about the project!

Oh, and really,



White Face miss You

Probably someone will not help the funding because he can't. I really understand it, so the only thing I'm asking You is to spred the word about this raise funding!
If You have some question (or request), please contact me!
E-MailImscared@live.com
Facebook pagehttps://www.facebook.com/pages/MyMadness-Works/125347074231317
Follow me on Twitterhttps://twitter.com/MyMadnessWorks
Play my other works on GameJolthttp://gamejolt.com/profile/ivan-zanotti/16513/

Thanks for helping, guys, ans stay tuned for new infos about the project!
Oh, and really,

White Face miss You

story:
Howdy!

I'm Patrick Rodriguez. I'm a game designer in Boston, Massachusetts. I was the lead designer on Movers and Shakers and Robotany while at the MIT Game Lab, and now I'm making educational games on the North Shore. I also frequently participate in game jams, during which I have worked on games such as Unicorn Joust and Lesbian Cat Wars.

Last May, I participated in a board game jam hosted at MIT. During that jam, I made a storytelling game called Legends of Beforia. It turned out that people liked the concept and enjoyed playing the prototype, so I decided to continue working on it and publish it!

That is NOT what this Indiegogo campaign is about.

A couple months ago, I submitted my prototype to a few game festivals, one of which being the Boston Festival of Indie Games. My prototype sadly didn't make the cut (it was in its early stages when I submitted, it's improved a lot since then!), but I can still purchase an indie developer table and demo my game! Unfortunately, the cost is a little beyond my budget at this particular time.

I think Boston FIG would be a great opportunity for me to show my game to a wide audience, generate hype for the eventual release (early 2015), and most importantly, get people playing and receive feedback!

What is Legends of Beforia?

If you haven't seen the game yet, it is a simple storytelling game for three players where the core mechanic is telling myths and legends. Players draw "Myth template cards" which are then filled in with random creatures, verbs, adjectives, and the like. One player starts off by telling a story based on their randomized prompt, for example, "Sneaky owl creates the world with a magical slingshot". Other players then have to draw and replace one word in the myth template, and make up a variation of the myth. The original player chooses their favorite variation to become the new canonical myth, and play continues, with players telling variations on the new version. It's a fun party-style game where in order to win, you have to convince others that you are the best storyteller.

You can read more about the game here.

Creating the art for Legends of Beforia is Illustrator and Dyscourse artist Carrie Witt. Together, we are creating a visual aesthetic to the game that is humorous and lighthearted, with some touches of traditional Mexican culture and imagery (with the game originally having been inspired by a scary Mexican legend, and the importance of the oral tradition in this culture). What we're currently crafting behind the scenes is something akin to a mix between the art styles of Guacamelee and Grim Fandango.

Here's the Sitch

An indie dev table at Boston FIG costs $200. I'm told I can use my submission fee to offset the cost, lowering this amount to just $190! That's not enough, though.

I also need to bring a copy of the game to demo! I have been using The Game Crafter to print copies of the first prototype. The first prototype cost $10 to produce. The second prototype which we are currently working on (due to be finished by the end of the month) has 33% more cards (80 different cards) and comes in a bigger box, and is estimated to cost $12-15 to produce. If I want to bring two copies to demo, and one backup, that's $45 max.

In addition, I'll need some promo materials, printing a little sign, designing some business cards, fliers, etc. The game doesn't have a logo yet, but I'm going to publish the game under the name Patchwork Games, which does have a logo. The website (patchworkgam.es) currently redirects to my blog, but I plan on implementing a proper website in the next couple months. I estimate the cost of these items (minus website) to be ~$30.

That puts the total at $265. The minimum amount you can run an Indiegogo campaign is $500. What will I do with the excess should I be fortunate enough to receive that much? I'll explain below.

What This Means To Me

I am really proud of Legends of Beforia. It is the first of my games without any complex systems or tricky numbers, which is saying something. It is a design that is very simple and organic, and plays upon a person's basic need to tell a story. It's also really fun to watch people laugh and giggle over the stories they end up telling with friends.

I want Legends of Beforia to be the best game it can be, which means I need to show it to lots of people and get good feedback! That is why it's important that I take advantage of every opportunity to have new players try it out.

If you also think Legends of Beforia is worth playing and would like to help me show it off and make it better, I would appreciate anything you are willing and able to contribute.

In addition, I've submitted the game to this year's IndieCade. I'm still waiting to hear back from them, but regardless of whether I get in, by submitting the game I've obtained a ticket to the festival. So either way I plan on going to LA and showing people Legends of Beforia somehow. To that end, I intend on using whatever surplus money I receive to help towards purchasing a plane ticket to the IndieCade festival in October (~$500).

Risks & Challenges

I am told that there is no hard deadline for getting a table, but that they are filling up fast, so in the event that I am unable to acquire a table, all funds will be used instead to acquire a plane ticket to IndieCade, to make sure the game is seen there.

I've scheduled the campaign so that there is at least two and a half weeks between the end of the campaign and Boston FIG (I received my notification from them last Friday). In event that I am unable to acquire printed prototypes by that time, I do have copies of the first prototype that I will be willing to demo in its place. However, printing and shipping times have been really good with The Game Crafter (less than a week from order to delivery), and we plan to have all the art for the second prototype by the end of the month.

    What's In It For You?

    I have set up some rewards for people who are able to contribute. For $1, you get my thanks. I truly appreciate your help.

    For $15, you'll get your name in the special thanks section of the final release of the game, currently scheduled for Spring 2015.

    For $25, you'll get a copy of the prototype being demo'd at Boston FIG, as well as your name in the special thanks. I can send you the game (probably only US, sorry), or you can pick it up from me at Boston FIG. If the latter, I can even sign it for you!

    And for $50, you'll get a copy of the prototype and I'll write you a short personalized poem in a meter of your choosing (or you can specify my choosing, I like double dactyls and limericks, for example). You'll also get your name in the special thanks.

    If You Can't Contribute

    That's perfectly fine! I completely understand. If you'd still like to help, though, you can spread around the campaign on social media and such! It's only a week long, so I'll need all the help I can get.

    Additionally, if you want to keep updated on the game and its development, follow @PatchworkGames on Twitter!

    I'm looking forward to showing people my game and hopefully getting a bunch of new players interested and helping to make the game better. Thanks for reading!

    If you have any questions, you can email me at patrick@patchworkgam.es.

story:
Who I am & How I started into Target Shooting

Hi Everyone, My name is Bobby Spence. I live in the Orkney Islands and currently shoot for the Scotland Fast Track Shooting team at International level.  I was also one of the few shortlisted for consideration for this year’s Commonwealth Games. Shooting has been present in my life as long as I can remember, I was first inspired by my dad who has competed for Orkney on numerous occasions at Islands Games level reaching as high as 4th place at the 1995 Gibraltar Islands games.  The last games he competed in was the 2001 Islands Games in the Isle of Man, The following year he returned there with me to give me my first taste of competition. Since then I was hooked and after a break from the sport to go to university to study for my degree I returned to the sport in 2008 and saved enough money to purchase my first purpose built rifle. I spent 2009 traveling around Scotland competing at domestic competitions and by the end of the year I had met the criteria to gain selection for the Scotland “B” squad. Since then I have been competing at national and International level gaining promotion in 2012 into the “Fast Track” squad and since then have been working towards the requirements for the Commonwealth and Great Britain teams.

Why I Need Your Help

Much of my equipment is now getting old and is in need of replacement or upgrading in order to ensure I am able to successfully compete at higher levels of competition.  With my current levels of expenditure already proving to be an on-going challenge as training and existing competition costs are high, it is proving extremely difficult to maintain and upgrade my required equipment on my own.

To train and compete all year round costs me personally around £9000 a year. This on its own is a massive commitment from myself which over the last 4 years I have managed to support myself. However now i am looking at the cost of replacing my equipment which will also come to a sum of around £9000 trying to do this in my own has become impossible and this is why i need your help. I have already managed to secure £1000 backing from my local council which is a great start. I'm running this campaign in order to attempt to raise the additional funds i need in order to be able to replace my old kit with new kit that I hope will help me get to the next level in my sport and achieve my ultimate goal which is to Represent Scotland at the 2018 Commonwealth Games in the Gold Coast, Australia.

Highlights of last few years

  • Scottish 10m Air Rifle Champion (2014)
  • Scottish 50m 3 Positions Grand Prix Champion (2014)
  • 1 Gold 2 Silver and 3 Bronze medals competing at the Commonwealth Shooting Federation (European Division) Championships (2010-2013)
  • Achieving selection standard for 2014 Commonwealth Games (2014)
  • Selected for "Achieve 2014" Programme (2014) for Scottish athletes predicted to be pushing to compete at the next Commonwealth Games in the Gold Coast in 2018
  • Represented Orkney at the International Islands Games in Isle of Wight in 2011 (Will be competing again representing Orkney in Jersey in 2015)
  • Currently ranked in Scotland, 2nd for 10m Air Rifle, 3rd for 50m 3 Positions and 6th for 50m Prone Rifle
  • 32 "Cap's" representing Scotland (as of May 2014)

Other Ways You Can Help

Donated? Check! Perk? Check! Want to do more? Well come this way.

Please tell everyone about my campaign, send them links, like my Facebook page. Anything that gets the word out there, the more the merrier as they say!

And don't be shy get in touch say hello I am massively grateful to everyone.

Want to become involved in the sport? Get in touch with me also and I'm sure i can point you in the right direction! :)
